40931562.review:
Dig or Die прекрасный пример того как надо делать игры.
Что есть в игре (всвязи с какой-нибудь обновой этот обзор может устареть или я могу что-то упустить):
1. Процедурно генерирующийся мир. В нём есть константы (например вулкан всегда будет справа, а разлом слева).
2. Tower defense. Он очень хорош, но из-за алгоритма нахождения пути у ИИ (он очень плохой)бывают проблемы.
3. Биомы. Они все разные, имеют разную атмосферу, наполнение и условия.
4. Враги. Здесь их много. Они могут оличатся друг от друга как только внешним видом, дамагом и атаками, так и быть совершенно непохожими.
5. Крафт. Ничего особенного из себя не представляет. Есть все нужные вещи от лампочек до плазмаганов.
6. Физика (особенно воды и лавы). Она порясающая. Вода имеет даление, может просачиваться сквозь блоки черезкоторые она может просочиться (земля, песок, и т.д.). 
Чего в игре нет:
1. Выживание. Вам не придётся искать чам-бы покормить персонажа или делать водоочисные станции.
2. Декор. Это вам не Terraria где имеется +100500 разнообразных декораций для украшения своего жилища. Сугубо полезные в фортифицировании вещи (лампочки не в счёт).

40722928.review:
I like this game well enough, but at the same time, I was disappointed with it. I played for just over twenty hours at time of review and didn't get to the end because I just got bored. In the developer's description of this game, it appears he's very eager to make this game not Terraria. He says, "No swords, magic or flying clown monsters here" and "you build a fortress, not a holiday house. So you won't find hundreds of flowerpots or tapestries." 

The thing is, that's what makes Terraria fun. It gives me a reason to exist in the world beyond just the grind of building a rocket ship and endless turrets. And something else Terraria has is variety. I don't feel like this game has a ton of that. The crafting recipes are limited and you'll have access to all of them quite quickly. The enemies are just not very exciting and they each only drop a single resoucre. This one drops a horn. This one drops a gem. And so on. There's no chance for an enemy to drop some rare item, and because of this, the enemies simply become a nuisance rather than a farming opportunity.   

Another huge problem:  you carry all of your inventory on you. One of the things that makes crafting games so great is that loot need a place to be stored. This gives you a reason to build a base. And then you have a reason to defend that base because the place where you put all of your stuff becomes a home. But because there is none of this, no chests, no NPCs, no real reason to have a farm or store all of your hard earned loot and armor and weapons, there's no real reason to build a base at all. In the end, your base ends up being an empty place with a bunch of rotating turrets. That's not really fun.

Where the game really shines is in the physics, the use of rain/ water and the use of hydroelectric. I think the game could have been entirely based around only these concepts alone and it would have been way more fun. I'm still giving the game a thumbs up because I enjoyed my time with it and for the price, it's really reasonable, but I really can't see myself playing it any more. It's just a very lonely world with no reason to visit again.

Игра просто невероятная, наиграл +100 часов честно скажу, она просто затягивает :D Прошел на всех сложностей ( кроме Мирной, подумал там наверно мобы пассивные, база не нужна ) Но обо всем по порядку.

Геймплей:
Здесь интересный и разнообразный мир, очень понравилось дожди, шум воды. Деревья, цветы и т.д которые растут за 5 секунд ( видно планета чтоль особенная ? ) Шикарная музыка саундтреки, днем музыка спокойная приятная, а ночью там такой музон более напряженный. Ну ладно погнали дальше.

Биомы:
Их здесь много, примерно 9-11 слоев, все эти места радуют глаз, все шикарно проработано до мелочей, куча ресурсов там. А пещеры вы видели ? Да там такие дыры что падать будет весело )) А острова летающие... там высоко на небе... растут кактусы... КАКТУСЫ ? Все нормально )

Мобы: 
Там где-то 20 видов мобов. Здесь они разные кто-то летает, ходят, ползают плавают. Вначале когда появляешься, они такие беззащитные слабенькие, с пушечки твоей любимой с 2 раз бац-бац, и потом ты умудряешься ♥♥♥♥ть еще пару мышей и подземных ежей( Ежи-это копатели это мое личное мнение xD). И ночью на тебя летит вся стая, ♥♥♥♥а твоей заднице и твоему бункеру. А Искусственный Интеллект у мобов такой, что на сложности Трудно Невозможно дырявят все стены проходы, достают где угодно.

Механика:
В игре есть Физика,( это вам не Террария построил мост на 200 блоков и твоя жизнь удалась ) Тут важно уделять внимание на распределение веса блоков, что очень трудно пройти огромные ямы, высоко парящие острова, и так далее все это будет рассыпаться как карточный домик ))

Крафт:
Он очень разнообразный и много полезного что можно скрафтить, я даже просто залипался сидеть в базе смотреть на этот гребаный МК-строитель ) Куча оружия, турелей, механизмов, конструкций стен и прочие хилки и абилки.

Боссы:
Сложность боссов зависит от уровня сложности игры, лично мне они как-то легкие и простые. Главное уметь использовать хорошее оружие и тактики боя. Их тут 4,( говорят есть 5 секретный босс, не знаю где он находится я наверно проспал ) все на каждом биоме, призывают своих подопечных мобов. 

Вывод:
Игра хорошая, и она еще в раннем доступе разработчики хорошо постарались, и на этом не останавливаются позже может будут добавляться новые предметы и тд.

Плюсы:

-Цена этой игры, не в рублях, а в копейках )

Минусы:
-Игра в раннем доступе, будем ждать выхода релиза тогда будет все в норме.
-Вышеописанный баг с муравьем и пауком.

Оценка;

40282883.review:
Amazing, brutal game. I bought it a few years ago in a sale, not expecting much of it (price under 1 €...). Back then, it had a very rough, unpolished look, only 2 areas and one boss. I liked it, it was a nice short experience about jumping and digging and killing stuff, with the occasional tower/bridge to build in order to advance. The only bad thing was the water which sometimes behaved weirdly...

Then, 2 years later, I looked at it again after it received some updates. Suddenly, there was this huge, layered world with 7 unique, interesting areas to explore, 4 bosses, tons of new monsters, weapons, buildings, machines etc. Some very game-changing and fun forms of movement were added. A whole system of in-game electrical wiring was designed. New music, art, effects, the graphics were polished, the water was fixed...

I was simply blown away by how much the game had improved, especially when finding out that it was done by 2 or 3 people. It was a much better experience than before, much longer, yet not repetative. The gameplay was not less challenging, with more diverse environments to explore during the day and huge hordes of monsters to gun down during the night. I played through Dig or Die 3 more times, messing around a bit in god mode. It is a very fun game.

Cons: 
- if you farm too much and build too many turrets, the game might become a bit boring. I found that it is rather better to explore certain areas or kill bosses when not having all the specific tier-equipment crafted-> this makes the game more challenging and (at least for me) much more exciting.
- sometimes, due to the randomly generated world, certain areas requiring towers to get to are spawned so far away, that getting there even with the tallest pillars and shotgun-knockback is almost impossible. Also, some rare plants needed for progressing the game might not spawn. That sucks.
-some bosses can be killed through walls with the storm gun. It is slow, boring and not very fair. Don't do it.
-the volcano is b******t.

If you enjoy 2D platformers with destructible worlds, fast, flashy combat and chaotic battles with hordes of monsters, buy this game. If you don't, also buy it. It is not that expensive and sales are a thing. You might like it.

40105804.review:
At first this game was interesting...

I thought it was multiplayer because of the tags, I even looked on reddit and steam chats to see if it was, the only comments I found were from months ago so I didn't know what to expect. I played terrarria with my friends and this looked cool so we checked it out. Me and my friends spent money on this game. At first we realised we couldn't play multiplayer, we tried it singleplayer anyway. I didn't like it, it was a worse version of terrarria. So we didn't enjoy it...so we waited for  multiplayer to come out.

Multiplayer came out months later, we rushed and really wanted to play. We tried it. At first it was enjoyable, surviving the first few nights was hard. We experienced little lag. We played it more and more and found it to become more and more boring. The servers became super laggy, sometimes I didn't know where my friends were, I couldn't drop items or see where I was. It was bad. I know lots of people liked this game...I have no problem with that. I can understand why, but when you have played terrarria so much I found it boring and unoriginal, the only difference was that when all of you died you had to restart the night and that their were less but new items to see. Nights were hard, especially the first few, the bugs would destroy your base, you would barely survive and the next day you would have to recollect the materials and then-....night would come and you wouldn't be prepared. The game is more fun with multiplayer and I found it still boring. You would have barely any time to defeat the bosses and you often wouldn't have the right weapons to kill them or survive the many bugs flying towards you. I have only played 7 hours so I can't say much, I haven't had the courage to carry on playing because I find it boring and hard (btw I play hard games and enjoy them like shovel knight or cuphead except this is a bad type of hard, something that doesn't make you want to complete or carry on...) incase I will waste my time playing and would much prefer to play other games with my friends like dirty bomb, worms or terrarria. Building was fun in terrarria, it didn't involve anything to do with structure and you could be free, with this game I just found it annoying with building, I couldn't build anything fun. I know people like this sort of thing but I will not play it anymore. As I said I have only got 7 hours so don't not buy the game because of me, lots of people apart from me enjoy this and I would hate to stop you from having fun, my internet can be terrible so multiplayer could be more fun than I have experienced. 
I would recommend this to people who like terrarria, minecraft or any game where you have to defend your base from enemies like Fortnite: Save the World or something else. I would not recommend this to people who think this is much different to terrarria or has more originality. If you like structure and building buy it if not then no...

Thanks for reading, hope this helps and gives you and idea of how the game is. Also sorry this is so long, I had a lot to say ;)

39957763.review:
Ah dig or die. You are definetly a gift I was glad to recieve.

Overview:
Dig or die is, at least at its surface a really simple game. You crashed on an alien planet, now just survive till you have the resources needed to build a rocket to get off world. Simple right?

This simplicity is then made more complicated as you realize just how much area there is to cover, and just how tricky things are able to get. It's always funny to say "I think I got the hang of this." only to upgrade your building station and go "Oh crap. Where am I gonna find that?"

At its core, this game plays as a combination of terraria, and a tower defence game. Whats nice to see is that there is a massive amount of buildable gear, and hidden complexity. 

Another impressive aspect is the games physics simulations. Simply put, most games wont even come close to this level of physics in a 2D game. Structural integrety, limitations of building integrety, and basic fluid sims are all an impressive additions.

The games multiplayer makes everything about this game instantly better. True, multiplayer optimization may be a bit off, and it definetly causes some recurring serious bugs, but the simple act of having a friend along is completely worth it.

Summary:
Pros:
+ Plays like a combination of terraria with a tower defence game, making a unique combination.
+ Complexity grows as time goes on, ensuring you never feel completely lost.
+ Physics simulations of this sort are rare in a 2D game, making this one stand out.
+ Feels like a classic 2D game, which is undeniably great.
+ Easy to get into, grows complex quickly, and yet, you rarely feel completely lost, or like there is a lot of hand holding. That shows some very good game design.
+ Huge selection of equipment and defences on offer, which helps cater to different playstyles.

Cons:
- You can still feel completely lost on what to do at times ( mainly with the biomes located at very high or very low areas).
- Buggy multiplayer system.

Final thoughts:
This is definetly a good game, and well worth it price. Its fun, and easy to play, with loads of complexity. Its only major detrement are some rather prevelent bugs, which can impact gameplay.

Final score: 8.5/10

39747179.review:
クリアしたのが数週間前なので間違った情報があるかもしれません。　クリアした難易度はノーマルです。

良かった点
・夜の襲撃
タレット置きまくって殲滅するのは楽しかったです。　ノーマルでも油断すると返り討ちにあう程度の難易度です。　タレットがないとかなり厳しいので、拠点から離れた探索や建築の際は時間に気をつける必要があるのは賛否両論かもしれません。

・防衛用のタレットなどが豊富
NPC引き連れて敵を倒してもらえるタイプのゲームは好きなのでハマりました。


気になる点
・夜の襲撃時は敵のドロップアイテムが夜専用のものになる（すべての敵がほぼ同じアイテムをドロップする）
敵のドロップアイテムが大量に欲しくても、敵が少ない昼間にちまちま集めていくことしかできないのが気になった。　夜ドロップ9割、通常ドロップ1割程度でも良いので夜でもドロップする仕様で一度やってみたいと感じた。

・敵
中盤は序盤の敵の色違い強化版がほとんどだからダレそう。

・ボスの性能
行動が単純で攻撃も簡単に避けられるし、無駄にでかくて硬い敵としか感じられなかった。

・マップ
１度遊ぶ分には全く問題ないが、バイオームの配置は全て同じ。　なので1周目をクリアして2周目をやろうとしても途中で飽きやすいと思った。

・インベントリが無限
アイテムが貯まるたびに拠点に帰るといった手間がかからないのはいいと思います。　しかし、少なくともノーマルまでは最終的に”拠点を作る必要性”まで薄くなってしまっているのは微妙です。



こう見ると難点も割りとありますがいいゲームですよ。
大きなアップデートが来たら、似たようなゲームがあったらまたプレイしたいですね。

Геймплей интересный и очень разнообразный, радует разновидность флоры и фауны. В отличии от своих "братьев" Dig or die не врезается на скорости 240 км/ч в тупые похождения по шахтам, а тот же фарм ресурсов не является настолько скучным и однообразным, нежели в Terraria (ибо раз 20 умереть за это время точно можно). Сама идея (хотя про это сказано было не мало) неплоха, ибо довольно трудно терпеть нападки монстров без возможности давать сдачи, но еще труднее не удалить игру после очередной смерти из за фатальной ошибки в виде убийства всего лишь одного моба. Единственная проблема - большое количество багов и недороботок, хотя игра сырой не кажется. Всем, кому не во что поиграть с друганами, ибо ETG пройден несколько раз, а Lost Castle надоел рекомендую к просмотру и дальнейшему залипанию в монитор, а так же скудных попыток выжить. (кстати есть поддержка серверов, и поэтому можно зайти к рандомным людям / поиграть одному / или самому стать хостом.).

39389789.review:
Well... i bought this game around 2,5 years before just only because i was needed a light game to run it on laptop or any low end (office) pc on my free time. I cant say that i enjoied the game .. i dont know why, it gave me a grinding image ... digging building defffending etc so i spent few hours and after that i abandined it like many other games in my library. After 2+ years plus and after spending my free time by playing other "2d" games like oxygen not included and factorio, a though came to soend 155 MB of my mobile internet and give it atry again...what i saw...?

1. Graphics rework-grahics are really nice
2. steam cloud (it had a little plroblem but due to dev's quick responce he/she sholved it
3. Multiplayer (WoooW...thats was exactl what i wanted be4)
4. Adventure (idk if it was like this before 3 years but it didnt leave me such a feeling as now)

So, my final opinion of the game, the game has the following features

1. full of explorations. It has many different bioms in random generated world that everyone has its unique mobs,sources etc
2. Full of survival - you need the correct equipment in order to stay alive
3. No lives (and for all of us the old games "UP") everytime you die you reload last save
4. crafting - yeah, the crafting system is part of the exploration, as you explore, you unlock new things
5. building - you can do eeeeverything but not that easy... the game has great physics (you will see it the first time you ll try to bild a bridge)
6. Tower deffence- - and thats the point, mobs are a bit smart, they know where you are better than you and will find you everywhere u hide. They will attack only where your charatcer is not in your base if you are missing from home.
7. Bosses --- yeeeaaaahhhhh thats exactly where you will need your friend(s) "Hey pal, i will shoot boss you will cover me..." - Roger that... :P"
8. Awesome Developer team (actually i dont know if is one or more but they are doing good job)
9. Different difficulties. The second difficulty (the easy one) is for my opinion a challengable difficulty that merge chilling, adventure and learning/enjoying the game if you are a casual player.
10. Resource balance. Diging and gathering resources are in very balanced condition which means that you dont need to gather 8+ hours just to make a T1 weapon. that makes the gathering unborring

Guys, if you hae the money just buy it, i cant promiss you that will spend more that 100 hours just to understand it and leave planet (the final goal) but worth it. I can play this game even on my netbook and i cant understand how the add all of this staff in a 155MB game. The game has depth and you cant run fast to the end game goal...you can "quest" yourself

39163477.review:
[h1] Amazing Potential	[/h1]

Many might think it another Terraria copy before buying. It's actually it's own game, and pretty damn good for Early Access. Much better than many "fully released" games. 

[b] This game can only get better with more content and variation.	[/b]

Simply adding more for us to customize, like our little characters or our base aesthetics. More monsters to worry about. Make each monster type have a few different appearances instead of the same model each spawn(This is what I mean by variation.) Just like trees, a lot look different, but they do the same thing. 

Progression feels like it's good, but there could be more to it. How about upgrades to our health pool? Perhaps an energy pool to be added for unique abilities. Or to be used for our fun gadgets.

On another note, regarding the UI.

It may be beneficial to have a character menu for us to use to equip our fancy gadgets and armor...and speaking of armor, would we ever get more pieces to equip instead of one? We have a chest piece. How about arms, legs and head? It may be easier to keep a single piece like it is now, but have it be considered a full body suit that completely covers our character. Think of a Spartan combat suit from Halo. 

To get even more beyond with the full future sciency cool armor, perhaps your energy pool would upgrade with it and you could temporarily use it to power certain things in your base, like a repair turret.

These are just ideas that can be expanded upon to make the game feel deeper, and not Early Access.

As of this review, the game is on a great road and could go really far. I only hope for it to gain popularity and support.

39103586.review:
Great game.  Played it with my brother over multiple weeks (few hours a week).  Given it's made by one dude I went in with low expectations.  I've played alpha minecraft as well as terraria back when it only had the first skeletron, so I'm used to games without much end game.  This game, however, kept giving, and kept giving, and kept giving.  It's well done, it's varied enough to be interesting, it has fun progression with biomes that are new and interesting, and it doesn't overstay its welcome.  It has a clear end game objective (build a rocket) that had its own mini event (survive until it launches) which means we got that feeling of "beating" the game, rather than it just being an open ended sandbox.

For the price point and the fact that it's made by one guy - 10/10.  Well worth the time we spent.  Not sure we'll ever come back to it (maybe to do brutal difficulty), but we greatly enjoyed the time we spent and this game deserves recognition for its contribution in innovation within the 2D crafting and world exploration genre.  It is tower defense done right.

39040766.review:
Okay, we will address the Elephant in the room, that burning question everyone seems to ask when a game of a similar genre pops up; "Is this like Terraria?"

It is a lot like Terraria, in many good ways but is also very different. This game has a bigger focus on tower defense for example, something I am loving. This game is faster paced and quite a bit harder from the get go, depending on the difficulty level you choose, I suspect. This game has an almost unhealthy fixation with liquids, an abundance of liquids.

I played the game solo first and then tried it multiplayer, I recommend both, but like any good survival game, it is better with company.

Play this, it is one of my new favorites and it comes with a developer who actually answers people and considers their input! A rare thing these days.

36506124.review:
Dig or Die is one of the few build your world Games where the dev has actually not only stayed to complete their work, they are still adding more to the game quite often. The game designer is very friendly, and definately open to siggestions. Unlike other games which require characters to grind to level up, in order to get anything done, you get right down into building and exploring. Every block has it's own strenghts and weaknesses which follow the laws of physics where if you build a house with a walkway above with no supports, its going to fall the moment you step foot on it or it rains. As you explore, and find new things, you get to build up the equipment to make even better and stronger items and weapons. Don't pick on the local animals, they won't pick on you at night. 
Dig or Die has gotten my attention because not only does it stand alone from others like Starbound and Terraria, the game doesnt get to repetative. And even after you solve the gane, as long as you let the credits go by without aborting them, the game designer has an awsome suprise which allows you to continue the game with special items. 
You can play alone or with friends with it's own built in server program that takes care of itself. You only just have to select multiplayer in order for it to run. Single player option is it's own content. This means if you start out using single player, you can't make that world multi-player. My suggestion if your unsure of what you wan't, start your game multiplayer with a password and then if you wan't others to join you, to just invite them later. 
The control and game play is very easy to learn. The AI is comical and game play never gets boring. 
There is  so much to do that I'm still playing the game weeks after solving it. Check out my many screenshots, but be careful of spoilers.

36178979.review:
I just beat the game.  Made my rocket and got the hell off that planet!  If you beat the game wait tell credits are over there is a huge surprise waiting for you!

Review-

-Very Hard game
-Cool enemies
-Cool concepts like after you kill an enemy it will attack you at night.  This goes for all the higher level mobs you eventually run into as well.  So you need to make a decision if you really want to kill something sometimes until you are ready to move to the next area.
-Great concept.  Its not Terraria and that's was great about it.
-Hard!  This game will piss you off if you can't handle that then don't play
-Great game for the price easily
-This game is more direct.  It's about getting the stuff you need to get the hell off the planet instead of just surviving on it.  This makes it feel different and play different and makers you really push to get certain things you need to get off the planet.  Although its hard and especially one item you need is just down right infuriating, but I figured my own way to get it!
-SAVE OFTEN!!!!!!
-The art style has been updated a lot since the begining and the game is about to release.  I had a lot of fun! 
-Only real downside is some items you get you only use once to  make something then after that they are useless.
-Could be a few more turret types and more turrets to make less gaps in turret strengths.  Instead of just going from a small to medium, to heavy turret there could be 3-6 more levels to make it more interesting, but I cant really complain because I beat the game anyway with the big gaps.  
-BOSSES ARE COOL!  Not super hard.  Well balanced for sure.  Of course I died a few times until i came up with a better strategy on some of them!  

Its cheap so just buy the damn game.  If its on sale you are stupid for not buying it.  If you like terraria and Starbound just play this game and remember its about getting the hell off the planet as soon as you can.  Not sitting around and surviving as long as you can on the planet.  

-I looked up a few things online because the game doesn't tell you what to do on certain things.  So don't be afraid to look it up online if you don't know what to do next.  Just remeber there is the lower areas, but there is also sky islands you have to go to as well.  Should help most people.  It's not a spoiler.

-GREAT GAME!  ENJOYED BEATING IT!  THANK YOU!

35903749.review:
Dig or die is a great experience that most fans of 2d survival/crafting games will enjoy. The randomly generated world is massive and the game overall has a pretty decent selection of craftable items. 

The tower defence mechanics are also a welcome change of pace. Creating kill zones in your base adds a level of strategy to this genre that is sorely missed.  

For me however, the main selling point is easily the cost. A game you can put over 15 hours into for 10 bucks is a steal. I feel that this game easily has the content to support the cost and if you take the time to explore, you will find countless things to do. 

I go more in-depth in my video but if you guys are just looking for a quick run down;

Overall I recommend Dig or Die because of it’s strategic gameplay, unique tower defense mechanics and cost to gameplay ratio. If you are interested in an explorations game with a Tower Defence Twist then Dig or Die is for you.

If you guys want a more comprehensive look check out my Early Access first impressions on YouTube here: https://youtu.be/hE97lW3S5Vs

Un peu comme Terraria, sauf que l'aspect exploration est beaucoup moins poussé et qu'il y a moins de contenu.

L'avantage du jeu (qui se retrouve dans son nom) c'est qu'on peut se constuire une base avec plein de tourelles et autres pièges pour affronter les hordes de monstres la nuit (on ne peut pas se terrer et attendre que la nuit passe, ou affronter les monstres tout seul).
Y'a encore un peu de travail à faire, mais je recommande ! C'est assez fun d'organiser ses défenses puis de se barrer enfin de la planete avec sa fusée à la fin de la partie !

35004576.review:
Edit - Changed my review to a positive. 

Because the dev came on here like a boss, talked about the problems I had, and the whole conversation convinced me to try the game again. How often do you see a developer taking that much time and sorting things out with a negative reviewer?

Played on easy. As a new player on Easy, when you don't have to worry about getting upgrades before the first sunset, the game moves along at a nice pace. It's not a walk in the park especially at the beginning, but you're able to set up a solid defense and expand your zone of control outward however you like. 

There's always a feeling of exploration and challenge - as you expand your base, there are more potential points that the creatures can attack. Likewise, if you get too carried away with exploring the wilderness or the subterranean area, you can end up not making it back to your base before nightfall. And then you're in big trouble. 

The mechanic where only the monster types that you've killed during the day will hunt you at night is an especially good idea. There's time limit to anything, and no spike in difficulty that you as a player have not voluntarily decided to do.

Obviously in 2 hours I haven't finished the game yet, but what I've played is enough to be worth a positive review. Dig or Die is a good pickup.

I'll leave my negative review here, so that if your opinion is similar to my original one, you'll know it's not as bad as it seems. The dev addressed my points in his comments below.

**********************************************************************************************************

OLD REVIEW

Just not my thing at all. Died a few times at night, said the hell with it.

Why can I build a wall but not a light source? On a planet where you're spending a lot of time underground and monsters attack you in huge waves at night, a light source early on would be nice.

What does the game have against doors? A block that lets me though, but not monsters?

Those auto-turrets I'm supposed to build are expensive and complete rubbish.

Dig or Die might be alright if I really sat down and played with it and figured it out, but I haven't seen anything in the early game that makes me want to risk going over the 2 hour limit.

34906335.review:
Vraiment déçut de ce jeu heureusement que cette erreur m'a couté seulement 10€. Mais plutôt revenons sur le jeu qui nous vend du rêve avec "un moteur physique de qualité","une gestion des fluides aux petits oignons" et mon argument de vente préféré "construisez la base de vos rêves".
L'histoire commence sur un petit texte comme quoi nous venons de la compagnie craft&Co (compagnie de tourelle autamatisée) et que nous nous crashons sur une planète hostile jusque-là tout vas bien... Puis ce qui choque dès le début c'est que c'est moche ptin. Et en plus la seule chose que l'on retiens c'est l'animation immonde de l'eau qui avec d'énormes pluies qui gache le gameplay de la "gestion des fluides".
Tiens parlons an du gameplay outre le fait de se déplacer au fusil à pompe tout le temps(bah grace au recul on est plus rapide mais oui...). Mais le mieux reste la"construction de la base" qui se résumera à un couloir avec des tourelles. Malgré les attaques bien faites pendant la nuit ce qui emmerdera le plus ce ne sont pas les mobs qui attaque normallement ce sont qui creuse d'énormes galeries dessous votre base même pendant la premiere nuit qui pourrira le map aux environs.
Bon je viens de remarquer que ma critique est trop longue du coup la magie du tableau récapitulatif...POF:

Les + :

-l'ajout d'un multi ce qui est vraiment nécesaire pour ce type de jeu
-les fights contre les mobs pas punitifs assez facile comme on aime quoi(enfin si vous avez la bonne arme)
-la posibilité d'automatiser sa base certes assez simpliste mais pas mauvais en somme
-bon je ne suis pas arrivé jusqu'au bout(flemme) mais l'ajout de la fusée comme objetif est une bonne idée

Bon on va attaquer du lourd

Les - :

-la construction d'un couloir plein de tourelle qui fait office de base(je pense ce qui manque c'est la nécécité a protéger quelque chose car les mobs peuvent rentrer chez sans que sa pose promblème)
-la gestion des fluides(les mecs vous vendez sa comme un bon truc mais c'est mal branler mais même dans Starbound c'était vachement bien fait alors ce n'était pas un élément principal du jeu)
-les crafts vraiment limités et pas innovateurs
-les raids de mobs qui sont plus des taupes que des sortes de léopards et de blatte chelou(d'alleur jsp pourquoi ils en veulent uniquement a ton cu)
-bah c'est tout simplement moche quoi non mais srx...

Bon Ccl car flemme d'en faire plus, alors certain(e) diront "ouias mais c'est qu'une béta" sa n'empeche pas un jeu d'être bon(le meilleur exemple est Factorio c'est pas très beau mais le gameplay commpense tout ducoup balek, ah oui il y a pas longtemps je crois que c'était en core qu'une béta).

Pour finir passer votre chemin ceci est encore un jeu sortit trop tôt et qui justifie des erreurs par "c'est une béta fait par un studio indépendant".

34778781.review:
Эта игра просто шедевр в своем стиле.Хоть это и есть клон Террарии,но он получилось достойным.Лично мне эта игра зашла больше,чем террария.Я помню те времена,когда кооператив был доступен только в Бета-версии игры и ради этого я попросил друга купить эту игру.По началу освоиться в этой было сложно,но со временем мы с другом начали понимать все больше вещей в этой игре.Например : 
С помощью выстрелов из дробовика можно передвигаться быстрее и прыгать выше.
С лучевым дробовиком лучше не заигрываться.Дальше я расскажу,почему.
В этой игре отменный саундтрек,особенно ночью.
Сразу вам скажу,что самый легкий босс это Краб.Находится он в подземном океане.
Что бы туда попасть вам нужно пройти налево до тех пор,пока вы не увидите огромную яму.В нее нужно спрыгнуть.Не бойтесь,умереть там невозможно,ведь падаете вы в воду.
А еще в этой игре самые дикие фейлы.Как-то раз я сделал себе лучевой дробовик.И пошел убивать Лорда Копателей.И когда  я подошёл к вулкану,выстрелив я ударился об стену и разбился на смерть.Друг надо мной рофлил,как только мог.Эта игра создана исключительно для кооператива.И даже не вздумайте начинать с Невозможного режима сложности.
Эту игру стоит пройти хотя-бы раз,поверьте,после прохождения игры вам станет очень весело,ведь вам откроется очень веселый режим.В майнкрафте он называется "Креатив"
Однозначно игре я ставлю 10/10

34600981.review:
Bon alors alors...

Je suis assez mitigé sur l'avis à donner à ce jeu, mais je vais malgré tout le noté en positif.
Mais comme je n'ai pas grand chose à en dire: je vais simplement m'en tenir a un + et -

les +
+ les mobs attaquent la nuit (bien que se soit mal exploité selon moi)
+ facile à prendre en main
+ bonne réalisation en général et pas de bug
+ quelques boss 
+ évolution sympathique (mais simpliste)

Les -
- Le craft plutôt basique (il y a tout un tas de chose que je n'ai pas eu besoin de crafter car je les trouvais inutile)
Bon en même temps faut vraiment avoir envie de se faire un vrai bonne base... mais pour ce jeu ce n'est jamais venu pour moi. Tout tourne autour de la gestion de l'eau et donc de l’énergie. Et le système de spawn des mobs, et la façon dont ils attaquent aussi durant les raids la nuit, ont fait que je n'ai vraiment pas eu envie de me casser la tête à monter une base.
Un grand couloir avec quelques tourelles (14 ou 16, et 6 grosses de réparation) au plafond, auront suffi à me mener à la fin du jeu.
Après, en version très difficile, je ne doute pas qu'il faille se creuser un peu plus la tête, mais cela reviendra au même, je pense. A ceci près, qu'il faudra s'assurer de monter un bon système de gestion d'eau, chose qui somme toute, reste assez basique.
Il suffit de canaliser les eaux de pluie sur un large secteur, et de les faire tomber en cascade dans différents bassins. Vous aurez comme ceci toujours de quoi alimenter vos générateur.
(Attention toutefois à la fin du jeu, il y a une surprise)

-Et bien en fait, les moins sont tous réunis dans ce qui est juste au dessus...

Mais je me suis tout de même amusé. J'ai fais deux partie. LA première pour découvrir le jeu et ensuite la seconde pour le terminer, en prenant mon temps.

I haven't progressed very far so not sure how much content there is, but so far it's been enjoyable but challenging. The game does a good job of telling you where resources come from so you'll always have a decent idea of where to go to get what you need, but it's up to you to decide WHAT to go for next.

I'm also enjoying what the water mechanic adds to the game. Water is far more dynamic, interesting, and useful here than in other similar games.

34358334.review:
Dig or Die is a game that takes elements from Terraria, Starbound, and other such games and provides a challenging experience from start to finish.  I can remember moments of dread when "discovering" a new alien life form; as I had to make the decision of either-

A: run from it and save myself a headache later, or 

B: Kill it and pray that my defenses are ready for the onslaught of it's rather cheesed off kinsmen each night.  This game is surpisingly deep, and it shows that a lot of care and attention to detail has gone into bringing us into a hostile world.

Only complaints are that there is a moderate-steep learning curve (depending on your prior experience with survival, crafting, and tower defense games.)  The game does its best to give you a general-vague idea of where you need to go next, but it is very easy to get slammed by a difficulty spike, because you didn't know *Which* order of suggestions to follow from your ships A.I.  

Also the "intense" night time music is stellar!

To be honest I did not realize that this was an earl access product until I went to post this review; this feels like a solid game, and I am excited for new content!
Died many...many times....would die again as this game is a treasure, (if not a bit rough).  9/10

34335942.review:
I bought this game based on the review 'Tower defence terrarria' (which sounds like my heaven) and the fact it's 'very positive' rated both recently and overall. However; to me this game was a sharp dissapointment - to save you from reading the rest of this  review in short the reason for this is i would rate the price (£6.99) to content ratio as being disgustingly poor. In short, the terrarian community (most people who bought this game) is so brilliant they love games like this to the point where they'd give the same money they paid for terraria to a game infinately more terrible, almost, purely because it's the same kind of game terraria is.

The antithesis of the following review would be an adequate review for the game 'Terraria' or 'Starbound'.

I'm sorry: it's shit. there is so little content to work on 'early game' that it bores the action gamer with the most uncreative generic weapons possible paired with lazer bullets with every gun, medium game is the same and so is late game but the problem for me isn't this fact but how there is nothing inbetween! I don't just want to be bombarded with 10 new items to craft when I upgrade my crafting table, (there are only 2 upgrades so don't think that's a positive) I want to have excitement inbetween with dungeons to find and bosses and people and... this game has none of that, this game has nothing.

For the adventure gamer it gets dull within minutes when you realise you get 1 biome and if you try exploring left you might find an incredible mountain!! After realising this mountain is just an everlasting slope which forces you to return to your base because it goes on too long, paired with the fact it generates every time and is at almost a 45 degree angle it is very dull. adventuring to the left you are greeted by a casm, randomly turning the game into a shitty bridge building simulator for a second, you are greeted by the same world generation but with red grass instead......... ugh.

So I'm sure at this point your thinking as you can break and destroy blocks this must finally be a great creative outlet for you... only astonishingly this is actually the games weakpoint. Don't build your base abuve ground as it will be destroyed easier, don't build your bunker out of dirt as it will break, or stone as it will break later; build it out of alluminium blocks. To be honest just go back to playing terraria and build a treehouse style wooden lodge with a slightly victorian theme like I did :)

Honestly I was excited by the terrets this game has. For some reason it didn't scratch my itch for this still... terraria has dart guns and flame traps and many others so I guess that's part of the reason but the other part I think is that it doesn't have waves or tactics like TD games do; it is very basic - the word that best describes this game. Now if this was advertised as a free-to-play copycat of terraria I wouldn't have made this review but at the same cost as the one and only (terraria) honestly this game is disgusting and not worth even contemplating buying. Plz save an hours wages and get terraria or starbound instead.

34092222.review: Dig or Die is a nice, streamlined mining and base defense game. Every day you collect resources and build your base, and every night you fend off enemies. Mining is relatively fast and resource costs are low so you don't feel like all your time is spent just digging or farming a specifc item. The crafting seems well balanced and useful. Some are upgrades for yourself like armor and a flashlight, and some are placeable buildings like turrets and teleporters. Some of the mechanics are a little weird (armor takes a hotbar slot?) but whatever. Still one of the best base defense games I've played.

34020059.review:
"Dig or Die" во многом похожа на других представителей 2D песочниц... Что? Физика?! Черт возьми, Карл! Они физику завезли!
Если опустить мои неумелые шуточки, то "Dig or Die" является замечательной игрой своего жанра. И если Вы играли в таких гигантов, как "Terraria" или "Starbount"(а я и там и там наиграл порянка ~200 часов), то эта игра Вам тоже понравится.
Плюсы:
-Неплохая физика. "Хочешь построить мост? Он развалится под собственной тяжестью! Хочешь построить башню? Осторожно, ее ждет таже участь. Блоки в небе? Где ты такую глупость слушал"? В "Dig or Die" Вам предстоит учиться на инженера.
-Особенности/Отличия. Какое интересное поведение животных! Днем они защищают свою территорию, нападая на Вас только, когда Вы рядом. Но если Вы убили хоть одного представителя вида... Все. Ждите гостей ночью. Все монсты, которых вы убили днем, придут в умноженном комплекте ночью.
-Энергия? Некоторые приборы не работают без питания. Вам будет необходима решать эту проблему.
-Интересные (и возможно неповторимые) виды оружия и дополнительных вещей. Грозопушка? Винтовка с дикой отдачей и море урона? Браслет невидимости? Силовой щит? Круто!
-Элементы Tower Defence'а. Мне, огромному любителя этого жанра, доставляло огромное удовольствие планировать бой, строить пушки, ловушки. Наблюдать за своим творением и понимать, что я в безопасности даже ночью.
-Реалистичное поведение животных. Если Вы закроетесь блоками-Вас достанут. Если Вы залезите на вершины столба-Вас достанут. У них здесь интелект " наименьшего сопротивления "(Если монстру, будет легче сломать блоки и напрямую к Вам, он так и сделает, чем обходить эту блоки, по пути получая в глаз плазменные снаряды).Монстры здесь, настолько умны, что если бы им добавили еще чуть-чуть разума - все, никто бы даже первой ночи не прожил.
-Сложные достижения, которые бросают вызов.
Но у всего есть минусы...
-Для меня главным минусом оказался тот факт, что игра очень коротка. Террарию, я прошел за 150 часов, а "Dig or Die" я прошел за 12... я получил 50 часов, пройдя нормальный, сложный и невозможный режимы. И тем не менее я понимаю, что мне этого не хватило. Связано ли это с недостатком контента или легкостью игры(лол, нет), но факт остается фактом. Игра быстротечна.
-Боссы. В той же Террарии(я сравниваю "Dig or Die" не потому что хочу указать на недосттки этой игры, а потому что хочу чтобы эта игры стала лучшей) боссы были мощные, разные, тебя брасало в ужас от них. В Копай или умри боссы меня огорчили. Их тут 5, можете считать, что 4, т.к. один секретный. Ну, ладно думаешь ты, может, они очень сложные... А нет даже на уровне "Невозможный" эти боссы имеют всего 2 атаки(бьют или кидаются в игрока) Все! Занавес. Черт возьми, половина боссов(2из4) это увеличенные копии мобов(Королева сверчков и Лорд Копателей). А как их нарисовали, поворачиваются они как, рисунок на бумаге))
-Малое количество блоков, материалов и др. строительных блоков в игре 5! 5, Карл!
 
   И тем не менее я рекомендую к преобретению эту игру, т.к. игра на стадии бета. И многие минусы(я надеюсь) подправят. 
   8/10 сапфиров

33789396.review:
I don't really do reviews so when I do, the game must be special.

I keep coming back to this game as it develops and it really is coming along nicely with many updates regularly.  The latest beta allows you to play with others too!

The controls are really great, smooth and so intuitive.  I especially like moments that occur like this,  I got caught out while digging down, miles away from my base.  I had to try to get back up and across the land.  It got dark real quick and I had to defend myself against all of the creatures while not stopping.  In a moment of matrix style jumping and shooting all died at my hands as I kept running.  You get many moments like this in the game. You wonder how you survived the last load before another load of creatures are on you...

Base building is fun when you realise not to block everything off.  Funnel them creatures!
Start off with digging for basic building block materials for the first few nights and improve the base with better, harder blocks as you progress.

You soon get to use turrets to help defend your base somewhat.  I like to think of the best ways to plant them down so they can do the most damage while not taking to much damage to the turrets  when creatures attack.

The graphics in the game are truly lovely and the music.... wow.  Goes with what ever the situation seems to be on screen.  One minute calm and serene and the next anxious and foreboding.
Great 4k support where you can actually see the UI. 

Water and funnelling water plays a key part in this game.  It never feels frustrating but can lead to some moments when you thought you knew how things were going to pan out while you tried to channel the water.  All hell can break out with water bursting into caverns!  On top of that when it rains things can change in an instant deep underground as the water filters down through the cave system.

Overall just a really nice game that can have you calmly building and thinking then when you head out you really feel the loneliness in the depths...

33271507.review:
Поиграв небольшое количество времени в эту игру, и я уже могу сказать что эта игра очень даже достойная.  Чем же эта игра хороша?
В этой игре много возможностей, и хардкора. Для любителей хардкора, и физиков, а так же длялюбителей 2D игр эта игра просто идеальная. Эта игра основана на настоящем выживании, сбора материалов, и логики. Так же в этой предусмотрен сюжет, который действует от нача игры, до её конца. 
В этой  вам предстоит выживать на неизвестной планете на которой вы потерпели крушение, создавай всякие пушки с ловушками для защиты своей базы, которую вы должны построить сами, исследовать планету, сражатся с боссами, и в конце игры следуя сюжету улететь домой на простроенной ракете. 
Пройти эту игру будет не так уж и просто. Тем более в игре предусмотрена физика. То есть для того что бы построить широкую платформу в воздухе нужны будут опоры, иначе опора просто рухнет. Да, игра очень не проста, но в после прохождения игры, по сюжету вы опять прилетаете на свою планету,  но в этот раз с хорошим оборудованием, и вы можете после всех мучений разбомбить планету :).
Игра очень хорошая, и я все рекомендую в неё поиграть.

33059638.review:
[h1] Intro [/h1]
    My initial reaction to this game was, oh hey a terraria clone, doesn't look that bad. Can check it out see if it's of any worth and refund if not right? Well wrong, I can't refund it now and I never would in the first place, this game proved me it was of well worth extremely quickly. Especially with the new multiplayer update the game got a whole lot better.
[h1] The Game Summary [/h1]
    The game takes place on some random planet after your ship has crashed. In order to get back home you most fight all sorts of powerful monsters, and mine in order to get the items in which you need for escaping and protecting yourself. This game is a lot more "reality" based then the game most compared to it, Terraria. In the world you will haft to survive from monsters who will break through anything to get you, while the world is constantly flooding with rainwater, that builds up rather then being like Terraria and just disappearing. However building big to escape this will not always be an option, because there is actual gravity that affects blocks.
[h1] Cons [/h1]
    Everyone wants the cons first,  you watch the video, you get interested, you don't want to read about the pros you can already see in the video. So what are the cons? There's actually not to many other then usually stuff that is bias to the player.[list]
    [*]It's not really possible to do decorations to make the builds look nicer (paintings, furnichur for the most part, and overall block designs). However even then it does have some legitimacy behind why this would be a lack of things. Reading through the story, the very short and just why you need to leave this planet story, it's apparent that you're not there to make it look pretty but rather to get off as fast as possible.
[h1] Neither Pros Nor Cons[/h1]
    [*]The block, background, and enemy design, is not the worst, nor is it the best. But before you call me a hypocrite because up there I mentioned block design as a con, I was describing them for decoration along with thing's I'd like added like furniture and such. But blocks alone is meh, not bad nor great, along with the 2 other things on this bullet point.
    [*]Enemies can break through just about anything, this can be annoying, but for the most part you are probably looking at this game because it provides that challenge unlike games like Terraria. And even then that's why you get turrets that can heal things and others that can shoot.
    [*]Updates, at least from what I've seen, wipes all game progress. Now you may be thinking nope not buying, but it's actually not bad. This game very rarely updates, I'd say about once a year. Now you may be saying okay well that's a problem in and of itself just adding on. However to it's credit it does do massive updates.
[h1] Pros [/h1]
    [*]Are you afraid that your pc, laptop, microwave, may not be able to run this game? Fear not this game runs very smoothly, especially with how minimum the minimum requirements are shown, it just screams you're gonna get 60 fps without much sacrifice if any.
    [*]This game overall provides a very nice challenge with very nice physics and AI.
    [*]The music is very good.
    [*]This game is a game where you don't haft to be embarrassed to say you did it on easy difficulty.
    [*]There's multiplayer.
    [*]The updates are massive and add tons of new content, the latest [url=http://steamcommunity.com/games/315460/announcements/detail/1340233436572459938]v0.3 update[/url] added a whole lot more to the game, and it went from v0.25 to v0.3, which would not be seen as a big change by most just looking at how small the number difference is.
    [*]Has full command modability.
[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
    If you like what you see in the trailer, you're gonna like what you play, hands down no regrets,[b][u][i] 9.2/10.

32831077.review:
So my initial reaction when my friend bugged me to get this game was, "Hey, it's just some terraria rip off,"
and in all honesty it is.

But I'll be darned if this isn't the best rip off of a game I have ever played.

Its terraria with bigger blocks and less stuff yeah I know that doesn't sound appealing, but the way you progress in the game through all of the gear tiers, the order of bosses, the final goal of building a rocket and escaping this god forsaken planet, the hoards of bests and demonic ants and dogs and fire spiders, the GLORIOUS water physics... all of these add up for a completley different game.

If you play Terraria, the game will feel weird at first and you will probably feel like you are playing a watered down version of the game.

If you don't play Terraria, than this will seem like an amazingly crafted game and Terraria will feel weird if you play that after this.  I know it did for me.

The single player is fine but honestly I only got back into this game after the multiplayer hit the beta mode.  I highly suggest getting some buddies together and playing this game.  For, what is it, ten bucks, this game is a delightful play with friends.

I got my  copy gifted to me from my cousin for my birthday I think lol but right after playing about 2 hours I bought a copy for my friend and gifted it to him lmao.

7/10 
Terraria-esque fun with friends complete with satan dogs

クリア（星から脱出）したのでレビューを……
敵がそこそこ強く、昼間でもやりたい事ができない事が多かった。
夜は敵が多く現れて戦闘に集中するかタレットを置いた場所で篭もるしかない。

つまり、作業や戦闘がやや辛くイラッとするとこもありましたが、ロケットを作り星から出れたときは嬉しかった。

だがしかし、難易度がやや高いことだけがDig or Dieの楽しいとこである。


☆作りたい建物を作るというのは諦めたほうがいいです。
（ブロックなどには重さや耐久度があり、大きい建築物は基本的には作れません）
（敵がブロックを壊してくるので、宙に浮いたような建物で篭もるようになってしましました）

☆電力もありますが……
（まず、電気を使うことが少ない……テレポーターぐらいです、電気で動くタレットもありまが使いにくい）
（ソーラーパネル：夜に襲撃があるのに、夜はまったく使えなくなります。進めると光る岩？があるのでそこでは活躍）
（水力発電：発電量は多めですが、発電に大量の水を必要になるので、使いにくい。私は施設こそ作ったもののほぼ使用せずに終わりました）
（トリウムリアクター：作るのは少し大変ですが、勝手に発電し続けるます。でも１個め作ったころには、ロケットが出来つつあり。活躍の場はほぼなかった）

☆ちなみに、クリア後はまた同じマップに帰ってこれて、強い武器やずっと飛べるジェットパック、アイテム作り放題の状態で遊べますが……いや、いらないよ…もうすることないよ…って感じでした

32042212.review:
このゲームは非常に評価が分かれるゲームである。
最後までプレイをしたものの、『良い』と感じる場面と『悪い』と感じる場面がいくつかあった。
総評してどうかと言われるとおすすめなのだがこれは値段の割にはという条件があってのおすすめである。

最近では当たり前となったマイクラ・テラリア系ゲームの亜種であるが
亜種ゲームにも秀逸な作品が多々溢れている今、このゲームを選択する理由はほぼないだろう。

難易度にもよるが、最初の夜から運との戦いになる。初期の防衛装備などに必要な蜂の落とす素材を
夜がくるまでの間にどれだけ取得できるかでこのゲーム対する印象が変わってくる。
この素材が無ければ、土や木などを採取する装備のアップグレードも出来なければ
防衛に必要な砲台（タレット）なども作成できない。
そのまま夜を迎えると敵の襲撃で死んでしまうことは避けられないだろう。
安いからという理由で、あるいは暇つぶし程度の積もりで購入したプレイヤーは
ひとつのアイテムもつくらないままここでゲームを投げるかもしれない。
ある程度装備を整えて、流れに乗れば楽しいであるが今度は別の問題が発生する。

DigorDieは敵の感知能力と追跡力が半端ではなく一度見つかるとどんな地形もブロックも書き分けて追いかけてくるのである。
（マグマ等は除く）
昼間だろうがこちらが素材を採取したり、建築をつくっている最中でも数ブロック隔てた向こう側や画面外から
敵がどんどん押し寄せて作業にまったく集中できない。
そのうち夜になりさらに多数の敵が押し寄せてくる上、せっかくつくった自分の建造物はあっさりと壊される。
色々と工夫をこらしてはみたが、画面外で水力発電のためのダムが決壊させられたのを見て私は諦めた。

上記の通り採取もし辛いため、常に素材はかつかつであり満足な建築も出来ないまま最終的にロケットに乗って脱出した。
DigorDieはタワーディフェンス要素が強いことを意識させられたが採取のし辛さ、素材の少なさ、敵のしつこさから
防衛装備ひとつに作るか作るまいか悩まなければならず非常にストレスの溜まる仕様であった。

幸いクリア後は全装備が素材なしでつくれるアイテムが追加されるため
思うがままのプレイを楽しむことが出来るが、結局クリア後にはやることもないので1時間ほどで飽きる。

悪い印象ばかりを与えるレビューではあると自覚はしているが、仮にこのゲームの続編、または精神的続編が
出たとすれば私はまたプレイするであろう。
上記した煩わしさ、敵のしつこさ、アイテムをつくるかどうかを悩む時間、それもまた魅力のひとつでもあった。
ただ、無心に掘り続けてアイテムを作って『はい、終わり』ではなく
敵に対処し、防衛装備を整え、襲来に備える、この流れの中でクリアを目指すというゲーム性は非常に秀逸であった。
人に寄っては「めんどくさすぎる」「難しすぎる」と感じるかもしれないが決してそんな事はない。

最後、ロケットに乗って脱出する際に上空の大陸を処理しわすれ
ロケットが衝突してゲームオーバーになった瞬間には思わず声をだして笑ってしまうほど熱中していた。
値段も安く、そこに納得がいくのであれば買ってみるのも悪くはないかも知れない。

I enjoyed my time working with Craft&Co very well, though the local life-forms on my maiden flight were perhaps underappreciative of the prospect of advanced technology. The built-in AI was very helpful when we made planetfall (though, perhaps could have helped me not [data redacted]), and eventually we were able to achieve ESCAPE velocity and plot a course back to more civilised systems. Thank you for the opportunity to learn and grow with your company, and this is my 2-week notice.


In all seriousness, an enjoyable game that I will likely keep coming back to, and there are plenty of ways to set your own difficulty and pacing. The nighty (and other) monster raids kept me on edge and wanting more.

A few concerns are that the storyline is a little short once you get the hang of the gameplay, and the map is somewhat small for the sake of multiplayer, but the future could hold alternate storylines, or possibly even different planets, so I hold out hope for the future of this wonderful gem.

31859460.review:
I've played Terraria and it's highly adventurous clone: Starbound. Dig or Die a clone? Sure, the same gaming platform/concept. Before you throw bricks at me, I am from that ERA where we call games that uses the same platform/concept CLONES (example: Wolfenstein 3D = Depth Dwellers, Corridor 7, Blake Stone, Operation Body Count) - (example 2: Doom = Heretic, Hexen, Shadow Warrior, Duke Nukem 3D) - (example 3: Command & Conquer = Starcraft, Age of Empires, Rise of Nations)


Okay, to my review and verdict of this game.


Let me just make a list of things to explain this game easier for seeing the bigger picture:
- Structure Integrity (like building a bridge is okay, as long you use support blocks, the stronger the support blocks, the stronger the entire structure will be without collapsing)
- When it rains, it's not just rain, it's like an ocean coming down, floods everything! You can use it for your advantage, if you play your cards well through though.
- Difficulty Rises when you kill an enemy type the first time (the more different types of monsters you kill, will show up more during the "bloodmoon" that happens every night - now it's not called a bloodmoon, but it also doesn't tell me on which planet I am or whatever, but at night it becomes crazy and all monsters are focussed on you)
- One Life (sure, if you die, you can start from your last save, but everything which you have collected during that lost gameplay, is lost, because it never happened)
- The MAP is procedural generated, with solid hotspots where certain things are always there. Like the vulcano is to the right for example. From left to right, it's not very big, but from top to bottom, it's frickin' HUGE!!!!!
- Collect all sorts of ore to craft better equipment, stronger blocks, upgrading, etc..  The deeper you go, the more ore types you will find. Some rarer then the other.
- The whole buildup of activities just adds up perfectly in balance, making this game challenging and long lasting. 
- Try to build a powersystem that can power your base for an unlimited time. (like solar panels only give you power during the day and water turbines only when there is a flow of water, but can be continiously if you use basins and pumps to keep the water flowing)
- It's not only building a base and you are done. You need to protect it with turrets. During a bloodmoon, monsters are so angry, so determined, they will destroy blocks in order to get to you. If you made a base on support blocks, I hope for your sake, monsters will not target those support blocks or your base will collapse to the ground (or whatever is down there)
So you need to be strategic how to build a base, how to defend it and use it to benefit from it without dying during that bloodmoon. Because if you die during a bloodmoon, the entire day, everything you have built is GONE - never happened... Crucial to survive that night of horror!
- Certain items need to be collected, some harder to get, some need some smart thinking...  Like, do you need to build a base right away? Make a base underground, above ground, on support blocks, under water?
- No bookcases, chandeliers, vases, flowergardens... No, you are stranded on this planet and you are not staying for long. The goal in this game is simple: Get your wiggly ass off this frickin' hostile planet!
- Eventually you need to go very very deep under the ground. Where there is LAVA and lava eats through basically everything. There are items down there which you need and even your mining laser cannot get through that thick substance, so you need to use explosives to rip those items out of the walls. The moment you do that, the integrity of the surrounding walls can get comprimised and wakes up the lava, continueing eating through the walls again and making your trip back to the surface a pain in the arse or even worse: impossible.
- The only "adventure" are your trips down there, trying to get the ores to get progression and eventually succeed in getting off that planet. The more your progress, the better equipment you get and certain things can be easier. Like teleportation devices. Although they need power to operate, they can speed up travelling to certain points on the map. 


By saying all this, making me want to play this game again. :D


Now this game is still in development, I totally recommend this game!!! The challenge is compelling. But, if you are more of a gamer that wants more exploration, treasure hunting, quests and such, this game might not tickle your senses.


And by saying that (hoping the developer reads this bit of my review) - because of the lack of like ancient structures, ancient technology... I would like to have that in this game too. Like that there are very challenging ancient buildings/spacecrafts somewhere, top or bottom, its random, very difficult to enter because they have turrets too, walls are undestructable so you can only enter them where there are open rooms and as treasure special items like a jetpack or a diving suit or a legendary mining laser or a powerful defense drone or a special weapon... 
And because they are ancient, you need to place cables to the doors, connecting it to a powersystem so you can actually open the doors... That kind of thing... Like a little diversion of the solid gameplay for getting a very special item that is like... not craftable but very handy. <--- Just an idea, think about it...

Ce jeu est un coup de coeur. Une petite pépite d'excellentes idées. 

Le faite de pouvoir utiliser l'environnement comme source d'énergie (solaire et hydraulique) donne des possibilités gigantesques ! Qu'est ce qu'on s'éclate à drainer le sol pour faire des monstreux barrages qui alimenteront vos défenses et utilitaires !

Un système d'évolution dans le crafting qui nous donnes toujours des surprises sur les possibilités suivantes. Sans oublier un choix d'armes, armures, gadgets et défenses conséquent pour notre petit bonhomme :-)

Bref, c'est que du plaisir. Une très belle aventure à vivre seul ou en coop.

This is a game that i would definetly reccomend to anyone who likes action strategy. this game looks like a bare-bones Terraria ripoff on surface, but once you play, you start to see how deep this game really is, gameplay wise.

Pros:
Great Gameplay. Exploration and gathering by day, tower defense by night, and you're the tower!
Soundtrack sets the mood properly, and is great on its own.
Progression is smooth and feels satisfying
Combat, the night tower defense feels great and weapons are extremely fun to use

Cons:
Building: Building can at points feel tedious and resource demanding (reccomneded to build a base underground, saves time)
THAT FREAKING BRIDGE IN THE WEST YOU NEED TO BUILD TO PROGRESS SUCKS AND I HATE IT.

That's really all I have to say about this game, it's certainly not for everyone, but if you want a unique tower defense experience, you will find it here

31238589.review: 这是一个很不错的游戏。怪物生成模式和制造方式类似mc，而操作模式类似泰拉瑞亚，吸收了两者的长处，但在两者基础上作了很棒的突破。在游戏里不管是休闲类玩家还是高玩都能找到属于自己的专属游戏感觉，这是很难的。作为有结局的生存游戏，但是游戏的最后结局并不能左右玩家。每个人都可以在最后结局上找到自己的额归属感。你可以以最快的方式做完飞船回家；也可以慢慢发展，最后做完飞船尘封它，在这个世界里活到地老天荒。属于自己的结局等待你去寻找。

31226907.review:
Just my opinions, if you disagree that's fine. It's just not my cup of tea.

TL;DR: when you die you start from last save having to go and mine everything again. small map. Building fun but annoying. shooting and jumping very fun. I do not recommend, but I hope the game continues to get better

As it currently is in early access, I will be forgiving of many of the problems like, bugs and bats swiming underwater and diging through 8 walls just so that they can try to eat you, but one thing I can't stand is this games death mechanic. If and when you die, you don't drop your items like in other games like this but rather you go back to your last auto save, usually being at the start of the day. So if you happen to spend a bunch of time working and harvesting resources and then die right before your next save you don't get the chance to pick up all of your things, you just have to start the work over again (who wants to do that).

one issue I have that most likely (I hope) will change is the map. it is a very small map and it would be nice to have it wrap around to the other side, rather than just ending.

the building is simple enough but with the addition of weight to your blocks. I actually like that part of it. The part that sucks about this part though is just how easy it is to place something in the wrong spot and having to start over before night.

another thing I love is the kickback from the guns. It's very fun to go flying across the map by shooting the gound and jumping! 

So the game is not my cup of tea and for now I can not recommend this game. I hope this game continues to get better so that I can change my opinion

31223199.review:
A great mix of sandbox, physics, survival and fun!
This game offers something different than your traditional terraria-esque games. You don't have the grind of desperately scrambling to get a weapon to defend yourself with, having to constantly replenish your hunger and thirst and other stuff that survival games require you to do. There is only one goal: get off this planet.
You use the advanced tools at your desposal to defend yourself against waves of enemies at night, which can be tough, but if you build smart can be quite fun. There is no you have to upgrade from wood to the most powerful weapons in the game. You start off with weapons that can just about defend you, but you can take the game at your own pace. The more monsters you kill for the first time, the more that come at you at night. This is a really intuitive and unique take on classic wave based survival, and offers a tremendous amount of challenge but not too much for those who just want to play casually.

Besides, this game runs on stone age hardware, so what's not to like?

Edit:
Coming back to this later, I must admit I find it a little difficult to get back into the game, and yet when I find the will to press that play button, it does not disappoint. Even now I immensely enjoy goofing around in this game, and legitimately attempting to leave, because of the amazing physics, graphics and gameplay mechanics.

10/10 would listen to the music on repeat for 3 hours again.

31215925.review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Le gameplay est superbe rien à dire là dessus ! Il mélange construction, exploration, combats de boss sympathique bien que  très simple arrivé à un certain niveau. La construction : celle-ci est très réaliste car tout les blocs sont soumis à une gravité plus au moins importante selon leur poids ! A noter que poser des blocs en l'air ne les feront pas tomber/bouger si ils sont relié à l'arrière plan (comme poser une étagère murale en gros, sur un mur, sa tien, mais dans le vide, sa tombe). Beaucoup de blocs à dispositions ainsi que toute sortes d'outils éléctronique (pensez à réviser votre cours de technologie avant de vous lancer^^) comme des panneaux solaires qu'il faut relier à un interrupteur, etc... Les possibilité sont infinies (ou presque) !
Ensuite parlons de l'exploration ! A première vue la carte est vraiment petite ! Gouffre à gauche, coline avec débris du vaisseau au milieu et volcan à droite (avec une touche de génération plus au moins aléatoire). Mais rassurez vous, c'est sous la surface et dans les airs que réside l'exploration en elle même ! La map fait 1000 cubes de haut et 1000 de long mais étrangement on à l'impression que la profondeur fais plus 2000 voir 3000 cubes ! De nombreuses grottes à explorer ainsi que de nouveaux mécanismes naturels à observer au fur et à mesure qu'on avance.
Dernièrement, les combats. Alors ici pas de PvP (pour le moment) mais que du PvE ! Pas grand chose à dire là dessus il y a pleins d'espèces différentes avec chacune leur caractéristiques plus au moins dangereux et propre à chacuns. 

On peut penser que le jeu se termine rapidement au début mais à vouloir allez trop vite vous allez plus crever qu'autre chose ! Car la jour, si vous tuez par exemple une guêpe rouge, tout ses congénèrent viendront vous attaquez chaques nuit après le drame. Donc ici la création de la base est comparable à clash of clan, il faut maxer notre base avant de passer au niveau supérieur et sa augmente le temps de jeu sans être dérengeant, splendide !


[h1]Les graphismes[/h1]
Ce jeu se démarque par ses graphismes moderne, et non en 8 bit voir 12 bit contrairement à la plupart des jeux en 2D et c'est super cool ! Les graphisme sont plutôt simpliste et dans ce jeu on s'y habitut très vite et au final ces graphismes sont au top du top ! Je ne sais pas trop ce que je pourrais dire de plus à ce propos !

[h1]Les animations[/h1]
Sûrement le plus gros (ou le seul) point négatif à ce jeu. Les animations ne sont pas variés la plupart du temps (je prends pour exemple le MadCrab) les mobs sont juste une image en png qui bouge. Je pense que plus d'animations dans les mouvements seraient appréciables ! Par exemple lorsque qu'un mob saute (chien, madcrab etc...) on voient les jambes en train de faire un effet ressort (comme quand les animeaux (et donc les hommes y compris) sautent dans la vie réelle).

[h1]L'équipe du jeu[/h1]
Malheureusement pas d'équipe pour ce jeu, mais n'allez pas croires que ce jeu ce développe tout seul telle une IA ! Il n'y a qu'un seul développer, GaddyGames. Il est très à l'écoute des joueurs et réponds presque tout le temps aux joueurs (même aux questions les plus stupides qui soient). Il est très ouvert à sa communauté contrairement à de nombreux développeurs ! Il met beaucoup de temps et d'efforts dans ce jeu donc personnellement je n'ai rien à dire sur l'équipe du jeu ! (enfin "l'équipe" c'est vite dis, plutôt LE développeur).

[h1]La fluidité ?[/h1]
C'est bien beau tout sa mais le jeu, est-ce qu'il faut une machine de la nasa venant d'un futur éloigné avec des grands-mères tyrannosaurs bionniques pour le faire tourner ? Non. Le jeu est très mais alors très fluide même sur un PC de merde 
vous arriverez toujours à jouer. Encore une fois rien à redire ! 

[h1]Le multijoueur...[/h1]
Le multijoueur est en phase bêta et donc il n'y a pas encore de serveurs officiels (en même temps va tant faire sa dans un jeu en 2D toi xD) mais le plus gros défauts (je répète le multi est encore ne bêta donc il sera corrigé très prochainement) est la stabilité des serveurs. Ici de nombreux lag en multijoueur alors j'espère que l'hôte du serveur à une bonne connexion sinon R.I.P (bon no stress sa passe quand même j'ai juste abusé comme un porc).

[h1]Conclusion :[/h1]
Ne pas l'acheter serait un crime envers votre âme de gamer tout simplement, il atteint presque la perfection d'après moi car il est encore en développement de nombreuses màj sont prévues alors foncez !

+ Экшн. Все время куда-то бегал, что-то копал и в кого-то стрелял. Хотя до запуска игры ожидал кучу времени на базе за крафтом.
+ Физика. Никаких висящих в воздуже сараев и многокилометровых мостов. Приходится учитывать как вес блоков, их прочность и нагрузку которую они передают цепляясь друг за друга.
+ Чуть-чуть сюжета, приправленого щипоткой юмора.
И это только то, что приходит на ум в первую очередь. В любом случае эта игра подарила мне более сорока часов, потраченных с удовольствием.

30825124.review:
An excellent game I've followed for a while and watched grow and expand.

I have quite a few hours in this game and it's continued to be something enjoyable to come back to and explore.

Probably spent way too much of my life becoming way too prepared for the next tier of difficulty but it's been enjoyable.

Really great game and very much worth the entry fee.

I'd add too that the creator has a clear vision and that the game respects the players time.  Many games these days require you to smack things with a stick enough times to get the thing and rinse and repeat that painfully slow, life-sapping process.

while it can't defy the genre staple of accumulating resources, you do so quickly and have means by which to find almost everything in a way that is reasonable but not trivial 

For me, this is something I look for in games.  After literal decades of walking in games and grinding, I appreciate that kind of respect for the finite existence we have as human beings, hahaha

Keep it up Gaddy Games.

30799047.review:
[i]Attention : Avis donné pendant la bêta v0.3 / Jeu m'ayant été offert[/i]

N'étant pas fan des bacs à sable, ni des survival, ni des accès anticipés, on m'a offert ce jeu pour m'y forcé à jouer.
Exceptionnellement, pour cette évaluation, je vais mettre le résumé en 1er, car je n'ai pas trouvé de point négatif.

[h1]Synthèse + points positifs :[/h1]

Aucun regret ! J'avais l'impression d'être un lemming plus évolué qui craft pour se barrer de cette folle planète X)
La durée de vie en difficulté facile est d'environ 14h pour ma part. Ce qui fait 1.75 heures de jeu par euro. Sachant qu'il y a des difficultés supplémentaires, et les succès Steam, c'est un excellent rapport.

On a eu la chance de jouer à ce jeu lors de la bêta accessible v0.3 qui implémente le multi-joueurs (mais désactive les succès). Si en solo le jeu est aussi intéressant, il est bien plus marrant à deux ! 

C'est aussi un jeu d'architecture, car il faut savoir construire des ponts et des tours, donc bien faire attention à bien répartir les forces pour que les structures tiennes.

La physique de l'eau (mais pas que) est bien faite. Et, pour une fois, vous allez adorer la pluie.

Ce qu'on pourrait attendre d'ici la sortie officielle du jeu après avoir joué à Dig Or Die :
[list]
[*]D'autre monde
[*]Map aléatoire
[*]D'autre boss
[*]Un workshop
[/list]

Pour ma part, je ferai les succès et les niveaux de difficultés supérieures, une fois le jeu vraiment sortie.

[i]édit : Correction [Merci à Gaddy Games][/i]
[i]édit : Nominé dans le catégorie "Aucun regret" 2017[/i]

30789916.review: 这游戏内置了简体中文。

30775077.review:
DIG OR DIE

I have to say that this game is beyond awesome.  The fact that I got it when it was $7.99 which I feel like it is to low in price, but hey I'll take it. I love the fact that it has water physics, structure integrity, power structures, and most of all dynamic challenges.  One screw up and your dead, go to far without preparing yourself, well your dead.  Fall to far down the chasm your dead.  Go away from your defense base when it is about go into the night, you better scramble to use all the walls to protect yourself and "Pray" that you'll survive the night.  Get swarmed because you we're not prepared, then well you'll die.  Dig to deep with water pressure nearby in the 30+ and you break through and drown.  Well you die.  This game speaks for itself.  

After playing all weekend.  This game is highly addictive and NOW that was playing on EASY mode.  I haven't even finished the game and I feel like it's pretty tough already but not hard enough.  So I will be starting over (yes over again) since I learned the hard way about building a defense base.  

Will be doing "NORMAL" mode.  How will I design the base, the water flow for rivers/to my defense base and end game base.  Well that is up to me.  However, this game is "NOT" a clone.  It has similarities to Starbound (Which I have played), Minecraft (I have not played, and no I won't play it), Terraria (Have not played it).  With that saying, the concept of exploration (do it carefully), and preparing your end-game base is critical.  Don't do what I did, just explore like crazy and then almost get wiped.  Save often, you don't know what might be lurking around that corner.  

Let's say I cannot wait to get home to play more.  If you get the game you won't get disappointed (that is if your like me that likes water physics, structure integrity, powering your base with wires)

30434099.review:
I played a little of this game. It was moderately frustrating mainly due to the unintuitive interface. It is 100% derivative, I mean literally without one original idea or gameplay mechanic. That's pretty depressing and suggests the developer is either very cynical or a bit stupid.

Playing it for a few hours made me think "Oh, I wonder how Starbound is getting on". So.. I stopped playing it, and played Starbound instead.

I remember playing Mincraft for the first time, when it was puely browser based. Much later I became an alpha backer and I enjoyed it a lot in multiplayer. 

Then Terraria came out and I was like "Man, this sh*t is purely 2D minecraft, totally derivative, the devs should be ashamed of themselves", but I played it for a while and you know what? The game itself was pretty fun what with the variety in crafting recipes and loot drops, and bosses etc.. I was a fan. 

Then Starbound was released and I was like "Man, you've got to be f*cking kidding me, this is literally Terraria which was literally 2D Minecraft, it's not just a cheap uninspired copy, it's a cheap uninspired copy of a cheap uninspired copy", but I played it for a while and you know what? I liked the multi-planet mechanic, and I thought the art style was much nicer than Terraria.. I was a fan!!! 

Then Dig or Die comes out and.. I was like "Man, this junk is not just a clone, it's a clone of a clone of a clone." Unfrotunately, unlike Terraria or Starbound, it doesn't add anything new to the formula. It really is totally uninspired and generic. A cynical ploy to extract money from those who enjoy these kind of games, and this ploy obviously works because they've got my money!

So, in summation, don't bother with this uninspired junk, play Starbound instead, but only if you've already played Terraria, don't bother with Terraria though unless you've sunk a good amount of time into Minecraft.

Disclaimer - I know there are many of these survival, world-builder type games out there, I'm sure I'm missing a lot of important milestones from my list, these are merely the ones that I've actively played.


---------------------------


Addendum.. The developer genuinely seems to care about this title. I have to admit, my opinion has not really changed but I do feel that the dev is attempting to create a different experience and that perhaps that experience is simply not to my taste.

30304313.review:
First let me say that for an early release game this is pretty solid and fun to play. It mixes together turret defense aspects with the nearly overused underground miner style game to make something fresh and challenging.

The game is progressional and easy to figure out where to go next. At night you are attacked en masse by the creatures you have already slain at least one of and the need for mazing and base construction on the fly is a lot more fun then only using one zone fortified to the max (though i recommend this for secutiry your first game). Construction physics sold me on how much effort was put into the game despite the game feeling way too short after your first completion.

My only suggestions would be to add a little more variety and length. As is the game is fun but simple with only a few ores to mine and a small load of items to construct. There are only a couple types of monsters per area and the same style of base constructions rules supreme vs all mob combos at night. And the world is huge and difficult to traverse making additional layers/biomes an exciting enahncement to game progression. To elaborate, you are only about halfway into the world before you get your final mining tool and I feel as though a little more difficulty would slow down what feels like an easier progression from that point and allowing for more upgrades and more crafting variety.

Despite small things I would add mainly to lengthen playtime and thus enjoyment, this game feels practically done and is very fun to play and judging on full retail price, I recommend this game due to its length of gameplay and replay value on top of the challenge and fun behind the hours put into the game.
