23019852.review:
There's nothing wrong with a game taking heavy inspiration from a popular title if said game does enough to differentiate itself from the title it is taking inspiration from. Dig Or Die differentiates itself from Terraria by taking the Terraria formula and emphasizing tower defense and construction elements while significantly compacting the experience.

In Dig Or Die, you play a man who has crashed on an alien planet and must build a rocket ship to escape. You do this by collecting resources and gradually climbing up the tiers of a crafting system until you can build a rocketship and leave the planet. You'll have to survive until then and when nighttime comes that's when the party arrives. Nights in Dig Or Die are short but brutal. The player is swarmed by monsters and the best course of action is to build a base with several turrets because even if you have state-of-the-art firearms it won't be easy taking out the enemies by yourself.

Tower defense is a large part of Dig Or Die. The main challenge throughout the game will be surviving the nights as increasingly difficult enemies attack you during nightfall. The game allows you to control how quickly the game's night assault difficulty increases by only adding in a type of enemy into the night defense roster after you've killed it during the daytime in its natural habitat. Turret construction will also come in use when you are fighting bosses because chances are your weapons won't be killing them quick enough.

The other big gimmick with Dig Or Die is the construction physics. Anything that's not built in front of a natural background wall will have to abide to the game's complex physics systems. You cannot just simply build a pillar of blocks to the sky, no. The player will have to build eventually because some biomes (and therefore, some crucial resources) are trapped away beyond neverending chasms and the like. It's a very satisfying puzzle, building these constructions and this reviewer enjoyed it a lot even though sometimes it was hard to understand how weight distribution worked.

One thing that doesn't get mentioned enough is how Dig Or Die plays with spectacle. Finding new biomes and new enemies is very thrilling and its pretty surprising how deep you can dig down into the earth. Your journey will take you to some very exciting places and there are all sorts of surprises to uncover, at a pacing that sets it ahead of Terraria.

In conclusion, those looking for a briefer and quicker Terraria-like experience with heavy defense elements and a construction system that provides interesting puzzles should give Dig Or Die a purchase.

22988099.review:
BugZy's Review: Dig or Die - Almost as difficult as Super Meat Boy!

The following is my opinion.

Welcome to Dig or Die, the wonderful yet terribly hard 2D sandbox game where if you haven’t watched walkthroughs or read any helpful reviews, you’ll go through world after world before actually being half decent at the game. Trust me, this is far from your ordinary sandbox. Oh, and I would like to state that while being inspired by a game like Terraria, it is vastly different and a heck of a lot more difficult.

Here is a little background. Dig or Die is a game released in March 2015 by Gaddy Games. You are a representative for a space-based company called Craft & Co. and have crash landed on a hostile planet, leaving you stranded with no way to get out besides using the equipment manufactured by the company to survive and ultimately build a rocket ship to escape.

When you load up a new world, your gaming instincts will kick in and you will have the urge to kill every creature in sight, but let me warn you that if you do, it will make the game an astronomical amount harder than if you just mind your own business. Of course you will have to kill some things anyway for crafting materials and other stuff, but if you haven’t killed any of its kind and have no reason to, then try to resist the urge to obliterate it with your pulse rifle.

If you are wondering why I am warning you about this, it is because at night the enemies come as a wave of creatures trying to get their revenge. Basically, different types of creatures will attempt to kill you if you have killed said type of creature. For example if you kill a dog, more dogs will attack you. If you kill a giant blue wasp, waves of giant blue wasps will attack you, which leads to my next point.

Defense is a major part of Dig or Die, especially when - as I’ve stated above - the monsters attack in a big wave. You must build a fortified base that hopefully you can survive in by using turrets, sturdy walls and your nifty craft-o-tron to help build these. Be careful though, because the hostile creatures that your base so desperately defends you from can and will tear your base apart, so be prepared to repair things! Also keep an eye out for blocks that are holding up large amounts of other blocks as this game enforces the laws of physics and they, also, crumble apart.

Something I would like to point out is that there are quite frequent flash floods, which add a great deal to the game’s suspense and makes it even more difficult as your base can be flooded in a matter of seconds. This is another thing you should look out for, so just a tip: build drainage pipes!

The game works somewhat in tiers, where you start with MK I gear and try to go up through the ranks to get better equipment, to venture further and get more items to craft better stuff and survive for longer. Eventually, you will have climbed the ladder of better items and will be able to create the rocket ship that I mentioned earlier, which is where the game ends.

The game’s art style is incredibly beautiful, being what you would imagine from a cartoon-styled game set in an alien planet. The animations can seem jittery and not-so-smooth, but if you are not paying lots of attention to them there isn’t really much of a problem.

The music and sound effects feel very fitting to the game’s atmosphere. I have had a few encounters where the music stops altogether when a sound effect plays and doesn’t start again until another sound effect plays, usually when I shoot my pulse rifle, but that is only a very small issue that I have come across and haven’t seen anyone else complain about it, so it could just be for me.

In conclusion, Dig or Die is a brilliant game. There may be some issues here and there, but in the end the game is a great play and for the price it is, I wouldn’t think twice about recommending it to any friend who enjoys 2D sandboxes.

I rate Dig or Die 8.5/10 hungry dingos.

22979793.review:
C'est quoi Dig or Die?

C'est une epsèce de croisement entre du survival, de l'exploration du craft et du platformer. Certains penseront sûrrment a des jeux comme Terraria ou Starbound en y jouant et c'est vrai que le concept de base est un peu le même: on vous fait construire et crafter dans un univers en 2D vue de côté avec des tonnes de monstres pour essayer de vous bouffer, tout le temps. Jusque là il n'a pas l'air très original mais au bout de quelques heures de jeu on se rend compte qu'il y plus que ça, que le jeu a son propre intérêt et que ce n'est pas une déclinaison d'un jeu récemment devenu culte (cf terraria ou starbound encore une fois).

L'intérêt du jeu.

Il est bourrés de challenge qui mettent l'inventivité et la ruse du joueur à l'épreuve, entre autre il fautconstruire un pont pour traverser une crevasse qui n'a pas l'air d'avoir de fond, construire des barrages hydrauliques pour alimenter des machines extrêmement utiles, prendre garde a ne pas inonder ses mines sous peine de les rendre inaccessibles et j'en passe... Il y a juste énormément de choses a faire et une multitudes de façon de les faire. Le tout avec une contrainte majeure, le cycle jour nuit. en effet se ballader la nuit est une mauvaise idée puisque des vagues de monstres attaquent avec la ferme intention de vous démonter, vous et votre base au passage. 

Les plus.

- La physique du jeu est très efficace, construire une tour réellement haute est un challenge et les signes avant coureurs d'un effondrement rendent le chantier satisfaisant: les constructions ne s'écroulent pas aléatoirement sans prévenir, on vois les bases s'éffriter, trembler, puis se briser puis tout le reste suis. ça aurait été encore mieux si on voyait réellement le tout s'écrouler au lieu de juste retourner à l'état de bloc rammassable mais c'est suffisemment satisfaisant comme ça. 

- Autre point sur la physique: les armes ont un recul. ça n'a l'air de rien mais ça change beaucoup de choses, par exemple le recul du fusil a pompe est tellement fort qu'il permet de sauter plus haut et ainsi de faire des genre de rocket jump... au fusil a pompe. ça aide beaucoup et c'est fun.

- L'exploration est réellement intéressante, il a des choses à trouver, peut être pas aussi excitantes que lors d'un premier gameplay sur starbound mais il y a toute de même des surprises et en général le jeu donne accès a des ressources rares quand on réussi à aller loin dans l'exploration. 

- Le système de tower defense pour les nuits est réellement bien fait. C'est ce qui me faisait un peu peur en achetant ce jeu, je me disais que cette partie du jeu allait me saoûler mais finalement pas du tout! Passer le temps du jouer à renforcer sa base pour abattre les vagues de mobs la nuit est réellement jouissif, les possibilités sont vastes: recouvrir sa maison de tourelles, faire des tourelles réparatrices, faire des tunnels pour endiguer les ennemis et se les faire au fusil... Bref j'en avais peur et c'est un des trucs qui m'a le plus amusé!


Les moins.

-La bande son finit par être lassante, je ne la trouve pas assez variante et je dois avouer que jouer plusieurs heures d'affilé à ce jeu finirait par me faire péter les plombs juste à cause de ça. bien sûr il est possible de couper la musique et de se mettre sa propre playlist à côté mais bon...

-Je ne saurais pas trop expliquer pourquoi mais ce jeu fais partie de ceux qui ne me poussent pas à rejouer encore et encore. Il y a de ces jeux auxquels vous pensez souvent, qui vous donnent envie de revenir plus tard quand vous jouer et pour une raison qui m'échappe, Dig or Die n'en fait pas partie. J'y joue de temps en temps et j'apprécie y jouer mais une fois que j'ai arrêté il peut s'écouler plusieurs semaines avant que je repense à ce jeu et que je me dise que j'ai envie d'y rejouer.

-Perdre dans ce jeu, c'est rageant. Ce n'est pas très punitif, le jeu charge la dernière sauvegarde auto (qui se situe au début de chaque journée donc si vous mourrez pendant la nuit vous recommencerez la journée d'avant), mais lorsque vous voyez votre base se faire détruire pendant la nuit, même en essayant au maximum de la renforcer pendant la journée qui précède cette nuit là vous pouvez être à peu près sûr que ça ne passsera pas et dans le cas contraire ça passera tellement serré que c'est la nuit d'après qui ne passera pas. Donc globalement si vous n'arrivez pas à fortifier correctement votre base au fil du temps vous serez obligé de repartir de zéro à un moment donné


Conclusion

Globalement ce jeu m'a plu et je le recommande, malgré ses petits défauts c'est une bonne expérience et il porte son lot de surprises et de challenges à relever. Ce jeu conviendra parfaitement aux gens qui aprécient la construction, la ruse et la stratégie. En plus il n'est vraiment pas cher et les développeurs sont encore actifs dessus, avec des petits patchs de temps en temps donc il semblerait que Dig or Die tende a offrir encore plus qu'au moment où j'écris cette évaluation.

22806971.review:
A good shorter game (by crafting game standards) of about 12-15 hours.

Dig or Die is fairly reminiscent of Terraria, having several similarities, but differentiates itself on it's more modern focus.
Whereas Terraria would be all about the bosses, RNG weapon/item drops from monsters and fantasy, and Starbound is about the exploration of strange new worlds and upgrading your spaceship, Dig or Die is a shorter more personal story about survival and escape from a hostile planet.

You are accompanied by your ship's AI that, like the Guide in Terraria, gives you advice and hints on what to do next. You're free to do whatever you want, however, as the enemy progression in the game is cleverly tied into the exploration.
Every night you're assaulted by rabid creatures that want to rid the planet of your presence, but the only ones that attack you are species you've already killed a member of.
The bases you build are basically just forts with one singular purpose: to keep you alive at night, There're a myriad of traps and turrets available to choose from, and each is useful in its own way. As you advance up the tech tree, more toys become available to help protect you against the new & nastier enemies you've angered to get there.

Finally, I'll talk a bit about the water physics.
The water is this game is the best implementation of it I've seen in any crafting game ever. While it's a bit overexaggerated in it's flow and abundance, it otherwise behaves just as you expect water should.
The game simulates pressure, flow and absorbtion to a very impressive degree. Massive rainfalls ensure you always have to contend with it, or have your bases and mines flooded. Dirt will absorb water into it, which is released underneath it or when broken. Mining underwater is a hazard due to the inability of crafting air pockets, as the water pressure pushes the surface upwards.
You can also harness the water for use with hydroelectric dams and pumps, and managing the flow of water to your advantage is a constant concern.

Physics is also applied to forced acting on the blocks you place.
While underground this is a non-issue, as the blocks are always supported by the background layer, but above ground (and other places where there's no background layer) you have to consider thw weight and resistance of the blocks you place, or the whole construction will come crashing down.
I kinda wish it'd simulate the different kinds of material stresses better, as even concrete cannot stand vertical towers for very high before it just bursts, but at least it provides an engineering challenge.

So:
In summary, Dig or Die is a fun little crafting game focusing on survival and tower defense elements in a (partially) physics driven hostile world.
I had fun with it, and for the pricetag you could certainly do a lot worse.
It's a charming little game, with some cool engineering puzzles to solve and fun combat.
Oh, and the battle music kicks ass ;)

22770744.review:
Dig or Die may seems like just another Terraria clones, but underneath the similar mechanics, it is quite a different beast. Its unique mechanics sets it apart from Terraria, and so it is worthy of attention even from Terraria veterans.

The two prominent unique mechanics are: liquid and structural physics. Water not only flows down and fills up space, it exerts pressure to surrounding blocks. Building blocks have structural strength, so they can crumble under pressure. No longer can you dive into the ocean, dig a chamber, create a one block thick seal, and 'mine' the water out to start a dry underwater tunnel. Do that in this game, and the sealing blocks will crumble and your tunnel will be flooded, just as it would in real life.

Structural integrity will also apply to buildings. You will not be able to create a high one block wide tower with platforms on the side, or that stair structures you used so many times in the other games, because your lower blocks would crumble under the weight. A long one block bridge, highway in the sky? Snap! You get the idea.

This game is pretty much under the development, so you will be able to learn these and other features as the game develops. By the time this game came out of Early Access, you will be master at managing water pressure and structural integrity.

I will give this game a score of 8/10.

22717948.review:
[b][u]The Gameplay[/u]
The actual gameplay is great for the first few nights, running around shooting creatures and trying not to die. When you get deeper into the game you start the base build part of the game (My fav part), you will need a brain for this or lots of real life experience with it. 

[b][u]The Graphics[/u]
The looks of the game are great for a one man team, not saying they are bad, but could use upgrading. I understand that the developer of the game is looking for a graphic artist during the making of this review so upgrades are on its way. (Update) New Graphics are now avaliable.

[b][u]The Updates[/u]
The developer is putting his heart and soul into this game. With every update (As of this review the updates have been coming out once every 2-3 months) you can see the effort that the developer is putting into the game. The developer has also said that he plans to input multiplayer so if you want a game that is fun and will get better soon, this one would be a great investment.

[b][u]The AI[/u]
The AI of the game is well balanced making the game fair on every level you play on it feels real (Peaceful feels peaceful, easy feels easy, normal feels normal, hard feels hard and so on).

[b][u]The Realism[/u]
The realism of the games physics are fantastic. This feature really makes you need to think whenever you build, what do I need to get this done? How do I get this done? And will it work? This game is a real pain when something just does not want to work.

[b][u]The Cons[/u]
There are not many cons to this game but just to balance the review here are some:
[list]
[*]It’s made by only one person so updates take a while.
[*]It’s not multiplayer (However this is coming soon)
[*]The water in the game is a pain (This is part of what also makes it fun though)
[*]And.... wow.... can't think of much else...


[b][u]Should I Buy This?[/u]
In the end it’s up to you, but I do recommend this game. Hopefully this review has also helped you make up your mind on the matter of buying this game.

[b][u]Rating[/u]
I don't quite know how much I should rate this game but I guess it would be something like 8 or so.

8.2343123/10

22630052.review:
Wer Terraria-artige Spiele mag und ein Herz für TowerDefense spiele hat, wird dieses Spiel lieben.

Ich habe nun knapp 30 Stunden Spielzeit investiert um es komplett durchzuspielen.
Es macht einfach süchtig nach immer neueren Erzen und Items zu suchen, um so seine Basis noch besser gegen die Außerirdischen Lebensformen zu schützen.
Storymäßig gibt es nicht viel, was ich aber auch gar nicht schlimm finde; Man strandet auf einem Planeten und muss sich eine Rakete zusammenbauen um von dort wieder zu verschwinden. Die Schiffs-KI haut ab und zu ein paar lustige und hilfreiche Sprüche heraus, das war es aber auch schon.
Es gibt 4 große Bossgegner und ein "geheimer", von denen Man besondere Items bekommt um seine Items noch weiter zu verbessern.

Auf jedenfall hat das Spiel für mich einen wiederspielwert, sobald neue Updates herausgekommen sind und es noch mehr Items gibt, möchte ich mein Glück auf der höchsten, oder 2. höchsten Schwierigkeitsstufe testen.

Für die momentanen 8€ ist dieses Spiel wirklich ein Schnäppchen.
Kauft es euch und probiert es aus!
Falls es nicht gefällt, kann man es unter 2h Spielzeit wieder zurückgeben.

Ich würde das Spiel auf jedenfall wieder kaufen, auch für einen höheren Preis. Und ich freue mich auch schon auf kommende Updates und neue Items/Gegner/etc...

22564232.review:
Суть игры заключается в том, что вы оказываетесь на незнакомой и враждебной планете, с минимальным набором ресурсов. Ваша задача – построить ракету, на которой вы бы смогли покинуть эти воинственные края. 

Плюсы:

1.	Потрясающая физика мира
2.	Различные варианты крафта, много ресурсов
3.	Огромное количество вариантов отстройки и защиты “базы”
4.	Приятная графика, хоть и не люблю пиксельную
5.	Отличное музыкальное сопровождение
6.	Достаточно большой мир для исследования
7.	Реиграбельность! (На мой взгляд это главное, что должно быть в игре) Мир каждый раз создается рандомно! 
8.	Работа над проектом. Разработчик на связи с играющими и планирует еще много улучшений для уже вполне играбельной “Dig or Die”

Минусы:

1.	Хотелось бы побольше разнообразных врагов
2.	Многие отмечают отсутствие мультиплеера (на момент написания обзора он находится на стадии разработки)

Подводя итог, можно смело заявить, что игра удалась на славу. Для любителей “выживалок” и “крафтинга” – рекомендуется к покупке! 
Итог: 9/10

Dig or DIE!
(Usable rewiev is in a bit lower, long post)

Kinda a game similiar to Terraria.
But there is one thing that bothers me really in this game:
I Feel like NOAH during the biblic float, just without an ARC!
I fully adapted now to the water.
My House is underwater,

My enemies drown underwater,
I Drown underwater!

7,8/10 - Would drown again

(WARNING may contain spoilers or hints that could help you in game)

Now for the serious rewiev:

When i would have compare Terraria or DoD, i would chose DoD
i make a little pro and con list what i like:

Pros:
-Its a allready known game mechanism you get used to really fast
-adaptive Monsters
-HUGE enemy waves at night
-An objective you have to complete
-A beautifull, living planet that wont stop trying to get rid of you
-Different Difficulty modes, from Easy (Hard) to Brutal (its only DIE then, no Dig)
- Bosses!


Cons:
-its hard to maintain the huge amounts of water in the beginning and find a way to Dig deeper for materials.

I like this game, its something new (well not the game mechanism), you have enemys you never seen before and the concept, that every single new species that you kill, will encouter you at night too, i like that. Overall its already a solid game worth the relative small price

I highly recommand to buy that game, if you are a terraria or minecraft fan, or if you just looking for a game that challenges you with enemys and natural power! (Like water)

Update:

The Multiplayer finaly got finished (yay!). Now you can play with your friends local or online up to 4 Players! Find new fun in this game when you didnt played it longer by inviting your friends via Steam! Work together to Build, Construct, destroy, kill, evaporate almost everything! 

And everything is better when you do it with friends. Even drowning

22213493.review:
Ayant été très intéressé par Terraria, la première impression quand j'ai vu les images du jeu a été de me dire qu'il s'agissait d'un clone. Mais après quelques heures de jeu, force est de constaté qu'il n'en est rien !

DoD a sa propre personnalité, son propre rythme, et son propre plaisir !

Sans tout détailler, ce qui me marque le plus, c'est la progression qui semble plus rapide, alors que le jeu reste profond, on a toujours l'impression qu'il y a quelque chose de plus à faire. De plus, avoir un objectif final qui permet d'aboutir reste selon moi important même dans les jeux de type bacs à sable.

Ensuite, le cycle jour/nuit prend toute son importance. Et on se sent vite en danger quand les rayons de l'astre solaire commencent à faiblir. Gérer une base comme un tower defense est vraiment un plus qui dynamise le jeu et demande une certaine réflexion dans sa prise de risque : suis-je assez prêt pour aller découvrir de nouveaux espaces et par là même provoquer de nouvelles espèces de monstres encore plus puissantes ? Suis-je assez préparé pour miner en profondeur et remonter à temps avant la nuit ?

Enfin, la physique du jeu ! Un must ! Une simulation de l'eau et de la pesanteur sur les constructions donne un plus que n'ont pas Terraria, ni Minecraft et qui là encore amène le joueur à réfléchir à la fois aux ressources utilisées et à la manière de les poser.

Je n'en dis pas plus pour laisser à la découverte, la seule chose qui manque actuellement à ce jeu est le mode multiplayer, mais il me semble que c'est prévu.

22174943.review: This is essentially a Terraria clone with larger blocks and more water and electricity. It's not bad, and I really love the basic story about crashlanding on a planet and trying to escape it by ultimately building a new space craft. What I don't like is that the game is not very good at following through on that story. The worst are the creatures. They are highly unoriginal, and the AI is just plain dull. I would expect to find aliens, from weird little blobs (they even have those in Terraria) to dino-inspired terrifying bonemunchers. Instead I get... yes, it's true: bees, bats and dogs! And what is it about creatures from all biotopes suddenly narrowing down on you at night (after you attacked them just once)? No matter if you're deep, deep underground or high, high up on a mountain, they all gather just outside the screen boundary to start their relentless onslaught. The fact that even the aforementioned bees, bats and dogs can easily tear down your hard-earned reinforced steel blocks, is just another example of how this games needs more consistency to be taken seriously. It's a treat to build a secure base. It's just so much more annoying to see it fall apart every night. Why bother?

22125605.review:
Llevo prácticamente una semana jugándolo, siguen desarrollando nuevas cosas y mejoras.
Puede que al principio recuerde a Terraria (así que si sois fans de éste quizás os agrade) pero realmente tiene muchas cualidades y cambios que lo hacen diferente.
Construyes, avanzas de forma progresiva, no es fácil y además debes usar tu imaginación sobretodo para generar energía y eso llama mucho la atención.
Que incluya físicas es un puntazo porqué no será coser y cantar crear una torre para llegar por primera vez a lugares de gran altitud y deberemos tener mano para ello.
Un punto bajo quizás es que las especies de mobs son las mismas prácticamente con alguna pincelada de cambio.

Nadas, exploras, creas diferentes armas, evolucionas tus máquinas y dispositivos para ser capaz de conseguir nuevos materiales, consigues volar en cierto momento. 
Sobrevivir a las noches es otro puntazo de emoción al juego (si a partir de modo normal conseguís sobrevivir al avanzar, claro xD).
Realmente para ser un indie a mi me ha dejado muy buen sabor de boca tras haber probado más de uno de este estilo, por lo que lo recomiendo del todo.

22106506.review:
Dig or Die ist ein überaus gelungenes 2D-Sidescrolling-Survival Jump n' Run. Nach einem ersten sehr intensiven Durchlauf, kann ich es getrost weiterempfehlen an alle, die Tower Defence-Games und Survival mögen.

[h1]Story[/h1]
Zur Geschichte gibt es nicht viel zu sagen: Ihr seid auf einem fremden Planeten abgestürzt und wollt jetzt wieder hiervon verschwinden. Hierbei stehen euch die KI eures Raumschiffes und die Produkte von Craft & Co zur Verfügung. Ziel ist es letztendlich eine Rakete zu bauen und damit zu flüchten.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Um sein Ziel zu erreichen, erkundet man tagsüber den Planeten, sammelt neue Blöcke im unbegrenzten Inventar und craftet am Crafting-Automaten Geräte und Maschinen (z.B. Heiltränke / Lampen), sowie passive und aktive Verteidigungsmechanismen (Mauern/ Türme). Man ist dabei stets auf der Suche nach bestimmten Blöcken, mit denen man seinen Crafting-Automaten upgraden kann, was zu neuen Rezepten für bessere Waffen und letztendlich zum Bau der Rakete führt. Dabei dringt man immer höher und tiefer in die Spielwelt vor und trifft auf verschiedene Mobs, die allesamt feindlich gesinnt sind.
Damit kommen wir auch schon zum Kampfsystem und zu den Nächten:
Nachts heißt es in die Basis zurückziehen und Wellen von Gegnern abwehren. Besonders erwähnenswert ist dabei, dass man nur von solchen Spezies angegriffen wird, die man tagsüber bereits einmal getötet hat. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist hierbei stark abhängig von der Ausrüstung und den Gegnern, die einen angreifen. So kam es bei meinem ersten Durchlauf (ich glaube auf dem dritten von fünf Schwierigkeitsgraden) stellenweise zu einer viel zu geringen Herausforderung, da die eigenen Waffen den Gegner stark überlegen waren. Vor allem die  vier Boss-Gegner, denen man im Spiel begegnen kann, werden ihrem Namen nicht gerecht. Aber da will ich jetzt nicht spoilern, sie könnten nur insgesamt agressiver sein.

Kurz vor dem Ziel, wenn einem noch ein einziger bestimmter Block fehlt, um die Rakete zu bauen, zieht die Schwierigkeit noch einmal richtig an und es war angenehm herausfordernd diesen Block zu beschaffen. Ist das einmal geschafft, kann die Rakete gebaut werden und auf den Start hingearbeitet werden. Um den aufmerksamen Leser etwas Frust zu ersparen, empfehle ich sicherzustellen, dass ÜBER der Rakete bis zur Weltgrenze kein Block im Weg ist, sonst muss man unter Umständen das Ding auch drei Mal versuchen zu starten, wie ich..

[h1]Atmosphäre[/h1]
Das Spiel liefert ein flüssiges und schön anzusehendes Spielerlebnis, was auch an den schön gestalteten Effekten und Texturen liegt. Auch der Soundtrack und die Geräusche sind abwechslungreich und stimmig.


[h1]Steuerung[/h1]
Die Steuerung geht intuitiv von der Hand. WASD für die zwei Achsen, in die man sich bewegen kann, Zahlen für das Inventar, jederzeit Blöcke abbauen mit Rechtsklick, Linksklick um das aktuell gewählte Item zu verwenden. Ich habe noch das Inventar von F2 auf die Maus gelegt, weil ich das so bequemer fand, aber an sich steuert sich alles ausreichend präzise und angenehm.

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Für nicht mal 10€ erhält man hier ein gelungenes Spiel, das schon im frühen Alpha-Stadium überzeugt. In ein paar Wochen, so der Entwickler, sollen die Arbeiten an einem Mehrspielermodus folgen.
Schon jetzt hat man locker 10-20 Stunden Spielspass und, je nach Schwierigkeitsgrad, eine schöne Herausforderung. 
Was mir nicht gefällt, ist, dass es viele nutzlose Blöcke gibt, aus denen man nichts craften kann und auch, dass es erst einmal wenig Ansporn gibt für ein zweites Durchspielen, außer vlt die Steam-Errungenschaften und ein höherer Schwierigkeitsgrad. Ich würde mir ein paar Dekoblöcke  oder vlt auch unterschiedliche Welten mit entsprechenden Variationen bei den Bewohnern wünschen, aber es sieht nicht so aus, als ob das geplant ist. 
Das Spiel ist, zum Zeitpunkt des Reviews, bei Version 0.21, da ist noch viel Platz für Inhalte und bereits jetzt habe ich keinen Cent bereut (außer vlt den Umstand, dass der Dollarpreis = Europreis ist, aber das ist ein Thema für sich..).

Alles in allem kann ich einen Kauf zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt empfehlen. Der Preis ist gerechtfertigt und eher zu niedrig als zu hoch.

21802678.review:
This game will make you start out on easy because of the reviews. You might think all of these reviewers suck at gaming and should jump of a bridge for sucking this hard at a 2D game. Well that's what i thought.

You'll start out as a man running around sucking up dirt, trees, grass and other junk. Once you got that outof the way you will start killing everything that moves, assuming every live thing in a game is hostile. You're having a great but confusing time.

Next you'll start crafting stuff, a shotgun, a few wooden blocks and probably a turret or two. Then night starts to fall.

You don't think much of it so you'll just continue making yourself a little cottage. The night slowly grows darker.

It is pitch black, several enemies try to attack you and seem to be breaking through your new house! You fight them off with your shotgun and the sun rises again. It sure was one hell of a night.

The next day you start looking for the materials and resources you need to make the next thing you want, maybe armor or a flashlight. You encounter new animal species and annihilate them on the spot.

Night falls and you rush back to your half destroyed home, quickly patch up the holes and get ready for another group of enemies. They won't catch you off guard this time.

You see the enemies coming, your turrets starts to shoot and off you go fighting for your life once again. You notice the new species you encountered seems to have joined the enemy army, but no fair match for your skill!

Sun rises once again and you rush out to collect and explore, ignoring the fact that you nearly died last night because you never had a second to look at your health bar. Time to annihilate new radioactive animals for pleasure and resource to get yourself a brand new shiny gun. Rather quickly sunset kicks in once again.

Night has fallen and you're starting to lean back a little bit, assuming you'll see victory again. Many many more enemies come. The easy blue flying things and the dog-like kanines don't appear, but instead red flying beasts drilling through your house in a fraction of a second, feral beasts running at you, your turrets all destroyed almost in an instant and you surrounded by enemies, when suddenly...

Everything stops. The foes charging at you casualy roam around the area. Then you realize you're not moving. Words appear on the screen saying: you are dead. You are dead.

You fucked up easy mode on the third night. You retry from the morning of day three trying to get more turrets, a better gun, healing kits, yet still you fail at night. You can't make it past night three.

This game is hard. Peaceful mode makes enemies harmless, easy mode rips your clothes off, bends you over and ravages your rear, tearing you a fist size dilation only to call you out for the bitch you are and leaves you to rot in a ditch.

It'll take me some serious effort to learn how to not fail as quickly as i did.

21654837.review:
Dig or Die é um daqueles jogos que parecem MUITO com o Terraria. Muitos chamariam de um clone do Terraria, porque é mesmo!

Pra quem curte Terraria, com certeza vai gostar de jogo e e também odiá-lo.

[h1]Prós[/h1]
- O jogo em si não difere muito do Terraria, só que o último é muito mais diversificado em armas e biomas, mas, vamos lá... Como o jogo ainda está em desenvolvimento podemos dar um desconto ao mesmo.
- O jogo tem física de construções que é algo bem interessante a se considerar. Faça algo sem base, e sua construção desaba. Isso é legal, mas também depõe contra o jogo. Nos contras explico.
- A idéia de um Terraria "tecnológico" é bem interessante também. As armas automáticas de defesa, concreto, armações de metal são uma idéias realmente legais.
- A idéia de infiltração da água no solo, também é algo muito bacana. Por sinal, a parte de líquidos do jogo merece menção honrosa. É muito boa.
- A música é legal também, mas fica enjoativa, pois são poucas.
- Pra quem gosta de jogar Terraria, é um jogo legal, vão gostar bastante por dar uma "variada" no feijão-com-arroz.

[h1]Contras[/h1]
- Mundo pequeno demais, é bem fundo, mas muito limitado. Seria equivalente ao mundo "small" do Terraria, mas, digamos, mais fundo.
- As construções desabam, ok. O conceito é legal, mas com isso não conseguimos fazer nada acima da superfície. Os inimigos atacam uma viga de suporte e lá se foi sua fortaleza!
- Por conta da física de construções, construir uma torre ou mesmo uma ponte, acaba sendo um desafio, então, digamos que um dos pontos mais divertidos do Terraria, que seria fazer seu "castelo", simplesmente desaparece nesse jogo. Se observar, praticamente todos os vídeos desse jogo não apresentam construções elaboradas e acima da superfície. Normalmente fazemos nossa base debaixo da terra porque lá ela não desaba.
- Os inimigos destroem o cenário, parece legal, mas acaba sendo um problema, pois eles literalmente "somem" com o cenário, uma hora, sua base vai estar, literalmente, "flutuando no ar".
- Falta diversidade, chegamos as melhores armas muito rápido, e são poucas.
- Poucos Biomas. De novo, o problema de diversidade.
- Ele tem sistemas elétricos, mas nada como o Terrária, como armadilhas, portas automáticas, enfim, falta muito ainda.
- Poucos Boss. Não são difíceis de enfrentar.
- Jogo ainda em desenvolvimento, acredito que falta eles lapidarem a pedra.

Enfim, como disse, é bom no aspecto de que se você jogou muito o Terraria, ele dá uma variada, acrescentando coisas que dão funcionalidades a mais. Só que, pelas limitações dele... Mundo muito pequeno, poucos biomas, final rápido, poucos itens, acaba enjoando. Não digo que não gostei, gostei sim, é bem legal, mas depois de terminá-lo, volto ao Terrária. ;-)

21621673.review:
Dig or Die ist bereits jetzt ein großartiges Spiel. Es weist zwar Ähnlichkeiten zu Terraria auf, in vielen Punkten unterscheiden sich beide Spiele jedoch grundlegend.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=637688337
Das Hauptziel in Dig or Die ist es ein Raumschiff zu bauen um vom Planeten zu fliehen auf dem man abgestürzt ist. Dafür muss die Umgebung erkundet werden und Ressourcen sowohl unterirdisch als auch oberirdisch gefunden werden. Allerdings muss nicht viel Zeit in Grinden investiert werden. Das Abbauen von Ressourcen und Graben geschieht sehr flott und der Fokus liegt am Tag auf dem Erkunden der Gegend und Bauen von neuen Dingen. 
Nachts verzieht man sich wieder in seine Festung voller Türme um Gegnerwellen abzuwehren. Diese sind nicht nur Dekoration, sondern haben es in sich. Dabei kann man den Schwierigkeitsgrad selbst bestimmen. Nachts wird man nur von den Gegnerarten angegriffen die man bereits irgendwann am Tag getötet hat. 
Das Crafting Menü ist schön übersichtlich und konzentriert sich auf das Wesentliche. Es gibt keine Dekoration die man Craften kann oder andere unnötige Sachen. Auch hat man unendlich viel Platz im Inventar, so das man keine Kisten braucht.
Das Spiel verzichtet auf unnötigen Ballast und Konzentriert sich auf das Erforschen und Überleben. Wem das reicht der findet mit Dig or Die ein großartiges Spiel vor. Wer jedoch ein schön eingerichtetes Haus bauen will und nicht viel Wert darauf legt sich Nachts in eine Festung voller Türme zu verziehen, der sollte lieber Terraria oder Starbound spielen.

Jeu acheté moin de 5 euros, que vaut il ?

Vous êtes un espèce de commercant spatial qui ce crashe sur une planète hostile. Le principe est simple, le temps ce divise en deux grande catégorie :

Journée : Récolte et construction (matières premières très diverses ! Constructions nombreuses !)

Nuit : Défense (Tout le plaisir du jeu réside dans cette partie, c'est la que vous vous rendrez compte de l'efficacité de vos installations !)

Le but est simple, s'évader de cette planète en construisant une fusée, mais il vous en faudra du temps pour y parvenir !

On peut parler de jeu de survie, mais il est en fait plus axé sur la construction, un jeu de défense plutôt. 

Les graphismes sont jolies, on ce lasse pas de découvrir des paysages parfois rocambolesques ! Bande son qui ne lasse pas sans être exceptionnelle.

Pour le prix, lancez vous !

For the price, I'd say give it a go.

I love the number of different ways you can find to drown in this game!  It's great to see a game where something as simple as rainfall can cause such huge problems.  Happily spent a couple of hours on peaceful just playing round with the water.

Which leads me to my OHGOD moment...  There's a big dude down there somewhere whom, when you approach, apparently throws the peaceful setting out the window.  And the autosave just before you meet him (an awesome idea, I can see that being a lifesaver!) seems to have saved AFTER everything I'd been walking past suddenly decided I WAS tasty after all.  I'll never see my dam again, nor break the seal to drain my giant artificial lake into the giant natural lake.

Beyond that, the progression is neat, and having to bridge the chasm to get to the next 'tech level' was nice...  the second time...  the first time involved questionable 'knowledge' of architecture and a quick lesson in gravitational forces; somewhat similar to learning why you don't stand ON the branch you're sawing off a tree...  :P  I didn't get too far into my non-peaceful try, something to do with enemies who will tunnel to you if you block them off.  A base with no foundations quickly becomes no base.  :3

21537554.review:
Dig or die is essentially equivalent to tower-defense flavored Terraria having grown a pair and subsequently deciding to slap you with said pair. The game is unforgiving but it never feels like it's cheating - once you get a hang of the building and fortification dynamics you'll finally get a chance to catch your breath and go out and really explore.

The environments and combat won't set any new standards but what really makes this game shine is what happens at night. Your actions during the day really influence what kind of experience you have later. Never have I played a game and debated so fiercly as to whether or not I really have to kill that black fly right now or if I should wait(this will make sense to you once you play).

The game is fairly short in this early stage of development but it already feels more than worth your dollar. Go grab it, support the developer, and good luck.

21536562.review:
After about 2 hours, I started wondering whether this was getting tedious. Then, I made it back to base, and realized that I was just starting to scratch the surface of what was available to me in this game.

I know my second playthrough, once I finish the first, will be even better.

The main complaints I've read are
1) about the water, which is one of the coolest things about this game!!!
and 2) not enough content (somewhat true)

There are solar panels, and a whole electrical system - I feel like I'm in FTB Minecraft all over again, but without all the decorative crap, and with more enemies and challenge.

This game is a fair bit like Terraria, but doesn't feel quite as linear; I don't have to jump through the same kinds of hoops to advance. E.g. Right now I'm terraforming the area around my base to accomodate for some good hydro-electric power. I have no clue what I'm doing, but it's been intuitive so far, I have a lot of tools at my disposal, and IT'S SUPER FUN!!

edit: 5 hours in, I've beat the boss, and there's nothing left to do but gather a few parts to complete my rocket and win the game. It's early access, so a dry ending was to be expected! I can't wait for 0.2 to come out so I can have more stuff to do in the game :D

TLDR totally worth the time and money, lots of fun, although a little shallow, at the moment of course (v0.1)

****************************************NEW REVIEW******************************************
 
          In an alien land where the inhabitants and land are unknown you are left with one decision, to stay at your crash site and try to survive or gather the courage to face the unknown. Starting at a laid back atmosphere it delivers the sense of safety while you collect your materials and begin crafting but soon the fun turns into terrror as night falls and the rains come. As you progress the game does too. You need materials that only certain creatures can provide which means they also will attack at night, you will battle unknown circumstances as you treck through long unmarked chasms that will deliver you to uncertainty. You will become close friends with F5 and always be on the look out for something new. But beware deep in the almost unmineable depths there lie a creature so sinister that you must first face your biggest competitor...... The RED FERN! Locating this simple plant will not be easy as it still to me has an unknown location. First things first! You need light, don't travel to far or you demise will be imminent darkness creeps up but when night fall comes the only thing visible is the horizon and the impending death. This game has many modes for all users from the I won't bother you unless you bother me "Peaceful" to the you don't have a chance "Hard" if you liked Terraria this will definetly get your heart pumping and your inner gamer roaring. At this price! You can't loose, you will die, but you can't loose. 

-----------------------------------PAST REVIEW-------------------------------------------------

The mechanics are ridiculous, first moment in the game. Your getting attacked from everywhere. Then there are casams that you fall to your death in. Nighttime is so black that you can't see and it comes quick. The controls are all over the keyboard and the map also puts in you positions that make it impossible to get out without using your carefully collected resources.

21299607.review:
个游戏真容易上瘾，挂了决战支援捞船打算在走战斗过场的时候玩玩。结果一个不注意一个多小时过去了……发现的时候因为决战支援过期到了Boss点只得了个A胜，自然就没捞到……之前挂出去的远征也回来了，由于任务上限的原因没选远征任务导致整个过程都很亏……
个人感觉整体风格以及玩法跟泰拉瑞亚差不多。但是没有泰拉瑞亚的携带物品上限，这一点很方便，不用出个远门还要清背包。怪物的设计挺有意思，唯一的缺憾就是怪物寻找目标时会彻底破坏方块，搞的战场千疮百孔不堪入目……
作为理科生我并不能理解建筑方块受力的原理，经常是拆了某一个大破的方块然后整个房子都在颤抖，补回去之后又神奇的慢慢恢复了。
不推荐在家里设防御公事，一不留神怪物就能把你家拆了。最吼的方法就是在地下开出一个极大的空间，搭上两层各几十单位的相距至少8个格子的木平台，搭的距离大就是为了防止下面的狼跳上去咬你。然后最上层延伸到一条挖通的隧道里，在隧道里设置各种各样的防御武器，可以在平台上厮杀占据下风时转移到隧道里保命。不知不觉玩着玩着就玩成了东方……

不得不说汉化太接地气了，美中不足的地方就是NPC的个别台词没汉化，嘛，反正也看得懂，这种小细节就不用太在意。

最后，给各位一个忠告：

进夜晚之前一定存档！
准备玩命之前一定存档！
听到夜战BGM之前一定存档！
因为重要所以说三遍！

21297867.review:
说实话，0.2版本不是那么令人满意，虽然游戏材质换了一个风格，但个人觉得没什么卵用
《挖或死》：
科幻、建造、探险。不同于一般的建造游戏，《挖或死》的建造是要讲究力学的，模板、混凝土垂直搭到一定高度就会崩塌，需要一定的结构来承重才能建造一个完整的基地，这一点很重要，否则没有牢固的基地会死得很惨（前期的基地要挖洞建造！挖洞！挖洞！这个很重要所以说三遍）。

记住，也许前期的蚊子和狗会怼哭你、房子也不能搭建起来（木头无法承载太重的重量）、你很迷茫不知道该干什么……但是请不要因此放弃这游戏。挖地洞、造炮台、不停往地下深处挖吧，当你打完第一个boss，也就入门了。不要忘了天空还有岛

你的目标是要发展科技，建造一个火箭来逃离这个星球，整个世界有四层：地表世界、地下世界、最下面有个地底湖、湖的下面还有空间，空中三个级别高度的空岛。地底湖的boss可能是你第一个见到的，因为你只需要从西边的悬崖跳下去，经过很长一段时间的掉落就会落入深不可测的地底湖，再一直往西游就行了。

说了这么多，总之《挖或死》值得一玩。然而它的游戏内容并没有《泰拉瑞亚》丰富，嘛，毕竟2015年才发售的，目前处于测试版本，自带的中文翻译很给力，比如：“黑土，远古的沉淀，那可是相当的黑”、“没有可靠的光源，我劝你还是不要在深不见底的地下作死”

20858960.review:
I cannot recommend this game anymore than I physically can - 150% Worth buying! 
I played a decent amount of time - so far until I decided I MUST let the community know how good this game is.
In this review, I will cover the good things and the bad things.

So, lets start with the good things:

1. Awesome idea actually been created like it was planned, unlike some games.

2. BETTER Than Terraria. I prefer this to Terraria because it's much funner and you can actually do much more things.

3. The physics make the game SO much funner, like a lot more.

4. It's gameplay is smooth and is easy to learn controls.

5. The artificial intelligence of the ship is so good, it gives you company.

6. The way you get hooked in after a few minutes is amazing.

7. The defenses, they're awesome.

8. The amount of cool things to build and do.

9. The variety of mobs, blocks and biomes.

10. The way it takes the irritating things from Terraria and makes them unexistant.

11. The way the structures have a limit to their strength, that forces you to make things like real life, like a bridge with supports. It makes the game so much more pretty with actual nicely structured houses/buildings/bridges etc.

12. The way you generate power, is so complex and difficult, that when you finish it, you get to biggest dopamine (Chemical your brain releases after an achievement to award yourself/feels awesome) rush you will ever have in your life!

The bad things:

1. It's early access.

2. The ground mob AI is awful.

3. The way you get attacked by an immense amount of creatures at night, it shouldn't be that much.

4. The dumb saving system - It needs an upgrade.

5. The way your turrets die far too fast.

6. The loss of health is insane when against a creature with a high HP.

7. The way you have to go back to a previous save if you die - IT'S ANNOYING, Just set a respawn code in.

8. The size of the world, it is the same for everybody, so why is it so small? I wanted a big world to explore, not small.

9. The way you don't move in flowing water, that's just so unrealistic in a physics game.

10. Some minerals are far too hard to find, it ruins the game having to look for hours to find an ore.

There you go! If you wish me to go into detail about any of these or want me to purchase another game to test for you and give improvements, then email me at winnerasyougo@gmail.com

I look forward to seeing this game progress through early access and I hope you use my review to improve the game!

I hope you find this review useful and/or wish to use it as feedback. Please get back in touch if you need anything!

ConGsta15 -

This game promises to be fantastic!

The Early Access is a complete -- but shorter -- game of the final version that is very replayble, fun and addictive. It's well worth the low cost that's asked and the bonus of getting the final version for free is even better. Dig or Die has a great balance between grind/craft/build that doesn't become tedious like other games. Just when you think it will, you progress and unlock new things that change what you need to do. There's no going back and grinding out level 1 resources; you've always got enough just by playing and exploring. The progression feels natural, not laborious, and doesn't wear you down.

By far the best part of this game is the base defence. The combination of mining/crafting with tower-defence/building is amazing. Coupled with the under-spoken sci-fi theme it's a real joy to play. Highly recommended. Can't wait for the final version.

20651902.review:
If you want a short review, there: if you liked Terraria/Minecraft/Starbound, you should absolutely give this game a whirl. And even if you didn't, I'd say it is still worth it. For only five bucks I got absolutely blown away.

Now, there's a bit of a broader review. Do keep in mind this is an early access game and it's very early into the development, so there is content/changes coming. That being said, it already has plenty of stuff to offer for an evening or two of undiluted gameplay. It is a really well made game.

So, Dig or Die, a game like many others, yet so much different. The idea is simple: you are a space trader who crashed on a planet with no civilization on it, but with plenty of rabid monsters that want a bite out of you. You gotta escape.

So, right off the bat you are thrown into a world that absolutely, positively wants you dead. And dead is not what we want to be, right? Well gee, it's simple: just build a small wooden hut and call it a day, right...? Wrong! 
The key difference of this game is that you have to work for your survival. You can't just build a sky tower - physics are a thing in this one. You can't just dig a hole underground and stay there - when the night comes, hordes of monsters will dig right through to you. And don't even get me started on (poly)water floods. If you want to escape your temporary prison of a planet you better be ready to dish out some pain. Or get eaten, the choice is yours.

All in all, with funky artsyle, simple, fun gameplay, pleasant soundtrack and a few pleasant surprises, this game is an absolutely great piece of work which I highly reccomend.

20490303.review:
AMANTES DE TERRARIA E STARBOUND: se espera algo similar, passe longe.

O jogo em si é 80% TowerDefence, e 20% crafting. Por estar em acesso antecipado, e ser muito novo, claro, tem pouca coisa a se fazer, aliás, uma porta pra sua base ia bem também, mas não há porta no jogo.
Você é um representante da CRAFT&CO e cai num planeta desconhecido. Seu objetivo é procurar itens para sua sobrevivência e futuramente, sua escapada do planeta considerado hostíl. Só que é o seguinte:

-no lugar onde você cai tem poucas coisas
-tu é forçado a ir procurar
-não muito longe de onde você está os inimigos começam a vir, e cada vez vem inimigos mais fortes
-qualquer inimigo que você matar, irá te atacar de noite, você estando preparado ou não
-quando você consegue os itens pra contruir sua base (base mesmo, não casa), ao construir, você irá perceber que é quase IMPOSSÍVEL mantê-la de pé, por causa da física do jogo
-você tem que ser formado em arquitetura
-você tem que ser o Chuck Norris pra matar aquela porrarada de bicho vindo querendo seu cérebro
-não há descanso
-não há exploração
-quase não há diversão, pra quem espera um tipo de jogo, quando vê ali nos filtros o termo "sandbox"
Esse game NÃO é sandbox.
Porém o jogo tem um potêncial incrível, mecânica ótima e a jogabilidade flui bem, só não era o que eu esperava, e o jogo não é o que parece ser... mas podem comprar sem medo, ele é bem legal, mas como eu disse, não espere algo como Terraria ou Starbound.

08/10

20461581.review:
I can definitely say that Dig or Die is easily worth $5 in its current state. I'm not entirely sure what additional development is supposed to be added to this game but "as is" the game is worth the cost by a long shot.

If you've played Terreria or Starbound then you'll feel right at home playing this game. The major difference at this point between Dig or Die and those games is both difficulty and depth. Dig or Die is far less deep and much less difficult at all stages of the game. While I've yet to beat Dig or Die I've played 7 hours and nearly completed what I percieve to be the end of the game. I'd venture to say I'd need 3-4 more hours to complete it at most.

I've played more than 50 hrs in Terreria and Starbound each and I've not come close to completing those games. 

Dig or Die stands on its own in my mind. Beyond look and feel Dig or Die is a different game than Terreria or Starbound.

Dig or Die doesn't require the same level of non-stop grinding that the other two games do. The learning curve is significantly lower and the strategy required to succeed only needs average execution for survival/progression. 

Pros:
-Only $5
-More of a Causal Play (easy to pick up)
-Low Learning Curve
-Relatively short Start to End
-No excessive grinding
-Graphics 8/10 (for this genre)
-Mechanics are smooth 
-Fun 8/10

Cons:
-A bit too shallow (I realize its early release)
-Can feel a bit repetitive between tiers
-Game allows player to get too OP by mid-late game
-Very little consequence for dying

All in all I'd say spend the $5, playthrough in about 10-20 hours (depends on skill), and then see what new things the developer adds.

20388217.review:
I'll be honest. I was a terraria addict for a long time. Then came Starbound, and I was smitten with that too. There were times I wanted to take the building tool for Starbound and give it to Terraria and other such things.

I wasn't sure what I was expecting when I started Dig or Die.  The graphics are very simliar, but the playstyle is very different. The basic concept, dig stuff up, build things, survive the night. That's all there, but Dig or Die adds a few things. One of those things is water. Water pouring down from the heavens and flooding your base because you forgot to plug that hole that radioactive alien firefly punched into the dirt to come eat your face the night before...

This game instills paranoia. Water paranoia. There is also that moment of "oh crap did I kill something on accident with my plasma rife?!" and the moment when 50 angry friends of his come to stomp you into the dirt when night falls. That's paranoia right there. 

There that frustration that the game has physics, but it is also a sort of love/hate relationship that makes the game it's own thing. You can't just pile up bricks forever. Eventually, that tower has to have support or it's coming down. You can't build a bridge without supports. You have repair walls that took damage or there is a good chance that the night waves will say hello through the hole in your wall.

Overall, this game  had a very satisfying feel to it, despite it being early access. I happen to really enjoy the soundtrack and hope there will be more from said composer. Best of all, the devs are active on their discussion board, and they even had time to answer my noob questions (from the gal that literally has only been playing this game for 19.9 hours according to steam...) as well as l isten to my suggestions from a new players standpoint. That's the kind of thing I like to see, and that makes the modest price-tag on this game worth every  penny.

20202495.review:
Luego de 14 horas de juego he terminado Dig Or Die. 

Comencé este juego directamente en difícil -dig or die-  y luego de algunos intentos logré agarrar el ritmo fácilmente.

Despues de esta aventura, quiero traerles mi análisis para que puedas decidirte en adquirir o no el juego.

Dig Or Die es un juego prometedor, en el cual puedes desenvolver tu forma de enfrentar las oleadas que vienen en cada noche con tu estilo propio (en la primera noche más vale seguir los consejos eso si ;D). 
No esperes un Terraria, ya que además de faltarle bastante desarrollo las horas de juego son incomparables.

DOD pone a prueba tu habilidad de resolver problemas y tu paciencia, y aunque se vuelve tedioso ir de un lado a otro sin saber donde encontrar lo que necesitas, el final llega a ser satisfactorio gracias a todo lo que tuviste que pasar.

El soundtrack no me pareció la gran cosa ni tiene melodías que se te quedan pegadas incluso despues de dejar de jugar.

DOD no es un juego que busca satisfacer tu vista o ganas de ver algo nuevo -a no ser que te guste ver como perros con distemper se caigan de guata cuando los matas-.
 
¿Viste ya en trailer? bueno, eso es casi todo lo que tiene el juego.

Aun con todas estas características negativas que acabo de dar, te puedo decir que es una experiencia divertida y una BUENÍSIMA apuesta ya que te recalco, es un juego prometedor y además no cuesta una gran cifra por ahora, por lo que puedes llegar a tener un juego que en el futuro puede llegar a ser uno de los más pedidos, quien sabe.

Recuerda: El juego te lo venden por lo que lleva hasta el momento y tendrá multiplayer próximamente, además puedes aportar con tus ideas para moldear lo que será el futuro de DOD, lo cual es una oportunidad única.

Yo ya aposté por este juego, ahora espero que con mi análisis puedas tomar tu desición. 

-Astronovo

下完玩了一会儿，塔防建造挖矿为基础的，和TR差不多，不过因为有科幻背景，不需要什么镐子斧头，一台黑科技可以一次满足捶树挖铁多种需求，让我在第一个白天还觉得这个游戏对初始玩家很友善。
一直到当天晚上，哎呀一到晚上，各路牛鬼蛇神全都出来开会了，两下就把我的木头墙锤烂了，直到我升级了MK II之后有了混凝土墙才保住半条小命……
这个游戏怪基本上就被设计的是一直压你一头，终于有了混凝土墙，下矿坑挖矿就会碰到穿山甲，穿山甲非常凶悍，默认的枪打他不痛不痒。因为我的疏忽，导致我没有活过第二个夜晚，不知道穿山甲能不能锤烂混凝土……
哦对，这个游戏的怪物攻击也很谜，如果你攻击了新的怪物，他们就会加入怪物party，大晚上一群跑到你家门口开会……明明是你先打我的啊混蛋！
暂时就是这些，其实还不错。游戏应该还在持续更新，所以导致部分字幕没有汉化，不过也不影响。
汉化了的部分也非常魔幻，比如那个开始菜单……
以上，TR玩家可以比较容易的上手，前期夜晚生存比较艰辛，因为默认的挖掘机是不能挖石头和铁的，要升级了挖掘机才能挖石头做出混凝土。而怪物又能锤烂木墙和泥土……
不过有什么困难是SL大法不能解决的呢(｡･∀･)ﾉﾞ

6/10

19539441.review:
A lot of these reviews don't really say why this game is a hidden gem. The developer really deserves the money he gets from this- 5$ gets you more than what you pay for. This isn't a game for everybody, though. It requires lots of planning and management to survive at harder difficulties, but on easy and normal you can be a bit more relaxed. It's a somewhat short game, but what do you expect from early access? The developer takes suggestions on how the game could be better or what items would be cool, so if you feel like this game is missing one amazing item, just say so in the discussion thread!

Exploration and material gathering is needed, which can get tedius at times, but you'll pretty much be constantly on your toes with enemies you can easily take out, but doing so will kill you at nighttime. The fact that you have to worry about night makes you have to plan out your adventures carefully and sparingly. Returning home early is better than returning later at night and dying.

A major fun-factor is how you can boost your jumps and movements just by shooting your plasma weapons (Shotgun is best for this) in the opposite direction when you jump, effectively using the knockback to get to hard-to-reach places, for fighting tactics (I love to just boost above a firefly, fall down and just blast that sucker straight into the ground) and to reduce fatal fall damage to nothing.

Water is a very restricting factor in this game- at one point in time you'll have your main cave blocked out by water, causing you to find the source of the problem and plug it up or plan out how you can use your time sparingly underwater unless you want to meet an untimely death. Even your base is prone to floods if you don't plan it out carefully!

Now the enemies are something else. Want a new miniaturizor that will mine things faster? Well, you're going to have to prepare yourself, because that firefly you need to kill for it sure isn't going to go easy on you. Need some aluminum, but don't want to die by these tough enemies at nighttime? Well, you're going to have to move around them or avoid them outright. Running away is always an option, but make sure they don't dig out a path towards you right when you think you're safe.

Defense is fun as hell. You'll spend a lot of time figuring out what turrets work best in what areas. More area coverage means less enemies your turrets have to deal with at a time, but that means more management and costs for keeping them up- and by that, I mean that enemies will target your turrets and go full kamakazi if they so choose, getting at least a couple shots off your turret in the hopes that their friends will take it out.

The music is also really nice. The nighttime music is upbeat while the daytime music is nice and chill.  There are a lot of different tracks, which reduces repetitiveness by quite a bit.

Now here's the big factor- replay ability. It's a sandbox game, so this is an extremely important in buying it. I'm going to be honest here: This game is straightforward and very lenient. After a couple of playthroughs, you'll know exactly what to do after you get this item and the game will get somewhat boring because the enemies feel similar like the fireflies. The only time the replay ability shines is trying out different base designs and the world regeneration, but other than that, there's nothing too special about it.

So overall, a 7/10 for an early access game. The game gets boring after a little bit, which is something the dev should focus on a bit more when he can. The first time experiencing might be a bit confusing, but fun and interesting. The graphics aren't too special, but they're getting a makeover in v0.2, so I'm excited for that. The weapons are diverse and fun, but the only time you get really fun weapons is when there's nothing much left to do in the game. I just love how unique this concept is, and I'm excited to see how this game will develop in time. The developer seems to be constantly updating it, which will in turn make this game cost more, but for now this game is worth it! After all, this is still in early access.

19308442.review:
For 4,99€ you just can't go wrong, even for 12€ (the final price), it's a must buy in it's current state. 

Why? Game play is polished and addictive, in my 46 (so far) hours of game play I have not ran into single bug, the learning curve is just right, it's extremely easy to get into but not so easy to master. Kinda like math, it's easy when you just have numbers but add the alphabet and it gets complicated. 

Most extraordinary of it all are the water physics, I have never seen such great physics in any game, be it a 60€ title or something I bought for 0.99€. The water just flows so naturally coupled with a soothing background music it creates such an serene atmosphere. At times I just stood in my base, listened to nearby waterfalls and music. 

But don't take this for a serenity simulator, it's far from that. The game day is divided into day and night, day is the building and gathering phase and night is the survival phase. The nights can get quite tense, especially when you discover never and stronger enemies. Ramp up the difficulty and it's a real challenge to survive.

19165553.review:
TL;DR: It is one of the best Terraria clones. Recommended.

Plus:
- Actual objectives, that make exploring mandatory
- Sci-fi environment
- Very fast digging speed
- More realistic building and structures (building a larger bridge or tower is an actual challenge)
- At night monsters come, changing the pace of the game
- Endless inventory

So-so:
- Monsters can dig, so you can't build unpenetratable defences.
- The water behaves more realistical.  I think it doesn't change a lot of things after all, just mentioned since it is different here.

Minus:
- not a lot of items to create
- not a lot of variety in enemies
- no summonables (or at least I didn't found any). Just turrets. 
- still a Terraria clone

All in all I recommend it, good fun, especially for 5$. I hope the devs will add more content.

Would you like to loose a weekend or a week?
This game is for you.
Constant feeling of learning curve, yet not that complicated.
Satisfaction from building, exploring and constant survival.
At night, build your own defences that will keep you alive from the brothers and mothers of those creatures, you killed during the day.
During the day, spend 20% of it for looking for the nessesary resourses, no need to dig for hours, and yet, you have the feeling that you are far away, and need to control your time in order to get back to safety.
Get resourses not only from underground, but build architecture structures, that will fall in case you put too much weight on it, so think before, not after.
Will you escape from the planet, or will you stay and build it at your pleasure?
Will you be able to locate and kill all monsters in order to be able to craft prime items that will ease your survival?
This Game is a must have in the library, specially when you pay that low price.
I could easy give $15 for it without blinking, but got it only for $4.99, and no, I have not been hiered to write this review.
Developer, my hat is off.
Ronicx.

19022842.review:
[h1]Dig or Die, es könnte auch Dig and then Die heissen[h1]

Die 2D Grafik macht ihren Charm aus, gepaart mit liebevollem Comicähnlichen Styl macht es einen sehr runden Eindruck. Passt völlig zum Spiel und Spielerlebniss.

Grundziel ist es seine Rakete (neu/auf)zubauen um von dem Planeten wieder zu entfliehen. Das Spiel hat eine sehr Herrausfordernde Schwierigkeit , die sich sogar noch durch Verschiedene Grade ingame Steigern lassen.

Der wiederspielwert ist nicht ganz so hoch. Da die Welt Endlich ist (Zumindestens seit meinem Letzten Test) und irgendwo Links und Rechts aufhört, und wenn man Tief genug kommt ;) wer weiss... .
Aber erstmal jeden Schwierigkeitsgrad durchzuspielen ist in jedemfall eine Herrausforderung. Glücklicherweise Speichert das Spiel nach jeder Gelungenden N8cht Automatisch.

Die Möglichkeiten sind ziemlich groß. Man kann eine Basis unter der Erde , in Stein oder auf Wolken bauen. Sogar Unterwasserbasen sind möglich. Nur eins bleibt es nicht Friedlich. Wer einen Aufbau Simulator oder Ähnliches sucht, ist hier Falsch.
Auch für die Ästethik ist gesorgt man kann den Hintergrund mit Panelen auskleiden. (Dies soll auch das Spawnen von Tieren verhindern) Denn nichts ist Ärgerlicher als gerade in einem Langen Minengang zu sein und zu seiner Base zurück zu laufen und Lauter Tiere kommen einem Entgegen ^^

Die Möglichkeit Wasser zu Stauen und umzuleiten sind Grandios, auch das Wasserverhalten ist super. Inklusive Regen.

Wer also eine Herrausforderung sucht, mit 2D Grafik keine Probleme hat und einige nette Stunden Zeit hat, dem ist das Spiel zu Empfehlen. Auch die Musik ist sehr Angenehm und Unterstreicht das Spielerlebniss. Und für derzeit 5€ ein Schnäppchen. Ich hätte auch bis zu 8€ dafür bezahlt.

At a $5 price point you really cant go wrong, I finished the game in just over 10 hours. 

That being said, the game is lacking in story and depth, and feels very linear for a sandbox game. This isnt Terraria and doesnt have 10,000 items/equipables to craft, the crafting is very limited, and all items are unlockable in a very linear fashion. There are few enemies, most of which are clones of earlier variations. and are not very interesting to fight. The building physics seem pretty wonky and don't work exactly how you'd expect (then again I am a carpenter by trade so i am biased XD)

As a side note the wiki is a mess and found myself stumped a few times on how to progress.

In its current form for the price I'll give it a 7/10 and would recommend if you want to kill a few hours.

18778954.review:
In order to really get into Dig or Die, you have to play it for a little while.
I tried it for around 45 minutes, and it didn't appeal to me.
After I was able to build a small base with turrets and cross a giant chasm, I started to enjoy the game a lot more. There are many different enemies, which once you kill, will sic their whole species on you at night. You must build your base of operations in a smart place, as the planet you crash on is extremely rainy. If you decide to build your home at the bottom of a mountain, you can and will be flooded.

The world isn't very wide, but it's pretty deep. The previously mentioned Chasm is an extreme drop, and falling down would most likely result in certain death.

Dig or Die implements new and cool mechanics, such as water power and the said species progression system. It's a lot of fun.

18757220.review:
TL:DR - BUY THE GAME ALREADY!

Break out that laser pick and plasma machine gun, and get to digging! Work to escape the rain-soaked rock you crash-landed on by gathering what you need to build a rocket. Survive the night when all the radiation-maddened species you've provoked (by killing one) comes to return the favor! The developers have a great music beat for the night-time combat, it really pulls you in and has you yelling "Bring it!" at your screen when the sun goes down. Oh, and watch out for burrowing mobs. They will quite literally tear your base out from under you, from the foundations up. In this game, structural integrity counts. If you build a tower, and they tear out the floor trying to get to you, it all comes down!

9/10 - Would have collapsing fortress fall on my head while unloading on full auto again!

18736172.review:
Once upon a time, an interstellar salesman went station-to-station, selling the AwesomeMatic 2000 matter reprocessor!  It slices!  It dices!  It performs molecular restructuring, and YOU can have it for only 2000 Space Dollars!  After this brilliant, and original sales pitch, however, the salesman found out the hard way they tried cold-selling the wrong person.  Captain Benjamin "Don't F@#$ With The" Sisko punched them in the throat so hard, they crash-landed on a remote jungle planet.

Dig Or Die is a neat little block-building game in the vein of StarBound, Terraria, MineCraft, and all of the clones spawned thereof.  The first thing that's apparent after starting the game, is the influence.  This game appears to draw significant aesthetic influence from [i]Mega Man[/i] - not [i]Metroid[/i] like Terraria does, or the Cthulhu Mythos like both Terraria and MineCraft do.  As a result, the game has a very retro feel, in a good way.

[b]What Works[/b]
Also, the game is very difficult, but in a (mostly) good way.  The early game [i]sucks[/i].  You have crappy tools, no facilities, and have to hastily cobble together some form of shelter before the thankfully-super-short night falls, and you get beset by waves and waves of monsters.  I've died a couple of times so far before I've gotten the second-level workbench, but not in a "BS" way - usually I die because the game is asking something of me, and I didn't do it.

What makes it [i]more[/i] difficult, but also a deeper game, is you can't build structures that are sustained by videogame logic.  Nono[b]no[/b].  If you want a roof on your structure, you need to build supports.  Walls are helpful.  Also, monsters do damage individual blocks, which means by night the packs of wolves and space-bats can tear down a side of your carefully constructed base.  Even if that doesn't happen, failure to properly reinforce your buildings and placing one block too many causes part of your building to fall down...causing you to need to put it all back in place again.  As a gamer used to video game logic, this is both incredibly refreshing, but also something that I find I've gotten used to not considering as much as I should.

Further - point defenses.  Something Terraria and MineCraft just don't have.  You absolutely have to use point defenses to protect your structures...but they do have their limits!  Still the presence and use of point defenses to protect your structures during night brings up on big point that the game does well - unlike most block-buildy games, [i]everything[/i] is useful.  Even the Dirt.  [i]Especially[/i] the Dirt - Dirt is a prime component of Concrete, a reasonably resilient material that has good structural properties.

[b]What Doesn't Work[/b]
On the one hand, I don't want to cast my vote too early - and make no mistake, this game is in [i]early[/i] access.  It has a good ways to go before I consider this a completed game.  That being said...critique time.

The game's balance is off - the initial difficulty curve is simply too high for my tastes.  While everything above is a strength, it's expressed in the most painful way possible.  Certain monsters like the fish regenerate HP more quickly than you can damage them, leading me to be very hydrophobic in this game.  The monsters for some reason can tear down your wood/concrete walls.  Digging through dirt, I understand.  But wolves, spacebats, and fishes headbutting concrete until it breaks?  That's an innovation only videogame logic could pull off.

The visuals need some work - the Mega Man aesthetic is neat, but poorly realized, and lacks cohesion between various elements, particularly the game and the UI.  Speaking of the UI, the UI does not scale well at all - the only setting I can reasonbly play the game on is 1366x768; at 640x480 Windowed the UI is unusably small.  Also on the note of scale, the blocks being as large as the player feels off too.  I usually expect the player to be larger than a single block.  The game would work better if the player were 1x2 blocks, and all enemies were about 50% larger.

Speaking of the UI, the in-game UI is very awkward.  There are more item hot-slots than there are top-row keyboard keys, which means you're obliged to use your mouse scrollwheel to be able to select items (of which you get a lot.)  Now, this wouldn't normally be so bad - after all, it's close to how I play Terraria.  Where things go downhill, is that the inventory UI itself is very unlike anything else in the block-buildy genre.  I find myself expecting a grid of items I own - uncategorized - but instead of the inventory UI being helpful as it's no doubt intended, it feels wrong.  This may be personal bias, but I think this game's inventory/hotbar system actually breaks the established genre interface, thus making the experience feel more off than it [i]should[/i].

[b]The TL;DR[/b]
At $4.99, in this early phase of development, with the good points and problems all factored in...this game is [i]worth it.[/i]  I forsee it only getting better as it catapaults to, and past the 1.0 version.  As long as the developer remains engaged, and keeps putting great effort into this game, I think they've made a game that beats a lot of its competion in the Sci-Fi Block Buildy genre - [i]especially[/i] StarBound and Edge of Space.

I will update this review as the game evolves further.

18596362.review:
Alright, I absolutely recomend this game if you like Terraria.  I haven't been playing terribly long at the point I'm writing this review, just about 4 hours.  The thing is, that's 4 hours in the same day... Which is huge for me with what is currently a single player game. So far, I have but one complaint, and that is: No co-op mode.  I have no idea if they plan to add one, and it's already loads of fun, but I'd absolutly love to play this with friends and familly. As the game is still in development, that could change.

That said: I like this game BETTER than Terraria, it just made more sense to me on an intuitive level. I've been learning very  quickly. 

You set your own difficulty at the start, but also in the game as you progress. You do get mobbed at night, but only by the creatures you've killed before, so if you aren't in a really defensible location, just don't kill anything new.  The game makes it hard to get too far too fast. This is good, as the farther you are from the start, the harder the foe.

 Seriously, for a game this early in dev, at the price point its at... Dig or Die is way more fun than I was expecting.  I've heard the price is going to rise with the updates, so I recomend getting it now.

18592244.review:
At the end of the day, I wasn't as moved as everybody else by [i]Terraria[/i], even though I was psyched and did pick it up on day one. [b][i]Dig or Die[/i] is a much more 'conservative' take on a [i]Terraria[/i]-esque game; most importantly to me, it has an endgame goal that is presented to you at the begining, and a cohesive art/ambient theme.[/b] No clowns and laser guns mixed with battle-axes here. The artwork is very nice, as well - less pixel art this time. It feels much more reserved, than 'in-your-face' considering its pastel colors and mellow music.

Essentially, you crash land on a planet, and need to gather the resources to both protect yourself as well as get off the planet. It has various difficulty levels, but proves challenging at even 'easy'. Its really easy on the eyes and things all make fairly logical sense. The menus are intuitive enough. There is also some mild tower defense elements that are quite welcome.

[b]Most of all, the price is right - five bucks is too low, in fact, for the content you are given.[/b]

18515420.review:
This game is pretty fun. I've been playing it off and on, a little here and there since it first came out on Steam. The developer is very friendly and interacts with the community a lot, often fixing bugs ASAP when he sees a bug report. It gets new features added all the time.

To be clea, this is a survival game. This is not building cute structures or making emoji faces with lego blocks. You have to survive nightly onslaughts from creatures you killed throughout the game. The more creatures you kill, the more that show up. It's pretty entertaining, and I'd say well worth $10, let alone a mere $5 or even a good steam sale. If you like playing building games and you'd like to try a fun terraria-esque survival game, buy it!

8/10.

Very good game. I don't know how much more they are going to update it, since it seem pretty complete already. It's short and fun, only takes a few hours to beat if you are smart, and doesn't get repetative easily. 
It does lack replayability, since it's literally the same thing over and over again, with very little variety.

The biggest problem for me is the AI pathing, which is terrible. They will simply go staight towards you, even if that means actually burrowing through a mountain, even if there is a clear path two blocks over. This can be very annoying when you have to rebuild half your base each morning. 

It is also seemingly impossible to have an underground base for long, since the aliens tend to destroy everything around you. Literally. You end up with a 5+ block gap all around your base, with it just floating in the middle.
