18407752.review:
This game is just a joy.  Imagine something vaguely like Terria, but with a real sense of progression, physics, and purpose.  This game just does so much right.  Everything you do feels meaningful.   I built a base and spiked it with guns.  Why?  Because I freaking needed those guns to hold back the monsters at night or else they would destroy my base and overrun me.  I set up a semi-elaborate system of water power.  Why?  I needed to set it up so that I could use a teleporter between two areas of operation.  I built a bridge and later on a couple of towers; both of which were kind of challenging because physics actually matters a little.  I built those things for a purpose; I need to span a chasm and to get to something high.  Build your tower or bridge without enough support and it WILL fall down.  If you don’t stud them with turrets, monsters will eventually rip them down.  

This game (at least right now while in Early Access) isn’t a hundreds of hours of sandbox time game.  You can play it like a sandbox, but you can also win.  I just beat it after roughly 40 hours, and I feel like I spent the right amount of time doing it.  I am satisfied and done.  If this game gets released with more content after early access, I’ll probably be back to do it again.  If it doesn’t, I’ll still be contended with what a got.  If it didn’t say Early Access, I would have never of guessed because it is pretty damn complete as it is.  

The only real possible negative I could see someone having with this game is that it is smaller in terms of scope and sprawling then Terria and other Terria-alike games.  It doesn’t have a dozens of biomes or hundreds of enemies.  It is smaller, but I actually kind of find this to be a positive because it is so much tighter than other Terria-alike games.  It is like the developer picked a proper amount that they could bit off and made it exactly that big.

Overall, if you like Terria flavored games, this is easily one of the best right now.  If the developer adds more between now and release, that is all just gravy to me.  Seriously, congratulations to whoever developed this; this game is just great.

18240255.review:
Alpha games are tough to rate as they are in progress but so far this is a 9/10 for me. I feel as this gets closer to release it will be a 10/10. 

Pros:
- Fun graphics (guy jumps like old school megaman)
- Lots of content. (tons of varied enemies, bosses, etc)
- Zero bugs. game never crashes, solid physics engine, water behaves rationaly, etc
- Fun progression. No grinding, just fun exploring. You can not kill new types of enemies to keep the game from progressing to harder levels if you feel in over your head.
-  It's like terraria and Craft the World, with biomes and underwater bases. If you like that type of game this will be most enjoyable for you. 
- Price/Value. Right now the game is $4.99 which is an incredible value for what you get.
- Lovely music/sound effects
- Great base defense and tower defense type setup.

Cons: (being picky as this game is pretty flawless)
- The ships computer in the beginning of the game kinda cheats (scans) and tells you where to find everything, if you want a challenge don't listen to him.
- The overcharge cannon has such a high kickback you keep donking your head and sometimes die.
- So many enemies come at night digging at you that you frequently create large underground spaces. Would like the AI to better use existing passages and not dig the entire world up trying to get at you. Just bugs me having a base floating there with no rock or passages around it. 

I dunno maybe it's because I just got done playing Skyshines Bedlam, which was $20 and had 1/16th the content this $5 game has and also was a complete steaming pile of shit, I'm now biased. But Dig or Die is an absolute delight to play and incredibly fun. I'm completely hooked and haven't had this much fun in ages. I haven't been this excited about a game since Ori and The Blind Forest. You know when it's hard, but not so hard you say "screw this" and you just stay up till the wee hours of the morning playing it? That's the type of addicting game this is. Whether it's prefecting you underwater base and getting your safety airlocks in place, or building a rikity bridge across a chasm trying to discover new riches, the game is constantly fun. I can't say enough good things about it. 

With so many ealry access games out there pissing me off with bugs, lack of content, glitches, crashes, and you name it. This game shines like a uranium nugget in the swamp biom (sorry inside game joke).

Just buy it now, thank me later.

18096387.review:
Very rare to see an early access that can still be called a working game. No bugs so far, dev promises an end game but I have'nt played long enough to achieve this. It is pretty difficult, but you can save anytime. There is some trial and error gameplay using saves, ex: try to find the mineral to unlock next set of stuff and die, or try to build base up using gravity system and it all collapses, or build underground and the whole thing gets flooded. The biggest innovation with this versus anyother sidescroller exploration is the realistic water. Its a very wet planet and when it rains the water level rises, then seeps away. There is gravity controlling the water, if you dig down through a flooded tunnel into a dry one, all the water will drain into that one basically. A very interesting and fresh puzzle aspect to the survival/exporation theme. 
I never get into early acess games because they usually are pipe dream half assed and never get finished. This one is worth the 5 bucks because it is a complete game (as in it works top to bottom compared to others) just needs more content. Very good execution of early access, reminds me of Killing Floor 2's early access: it was a working game will very little content, devs adding on and balancing going forward.

18017026.review:
Очередная выживалка на подобии Террарии и Старбаунда, только менее разнообразная по крафту, но, тем не менее, до отказа набитая драйвом. 

Вы терпите крушение на планете, где вас люто ненавидит всё, что движется. Правда, уровень ненависти и количества врагов (немногочисленных, но с каждой новой обновой пополняемых новыми) зависит от уровня сложности. На пассиве зверьё действует согласно "Золотому правилу гласности". Не тронешь его, не тронут и тебя. На лёгком же уже складывается впечатление, словно доктор Фуфелшмертц стрельнул по Вам из Выгребайпи***линатора, и вас все хотят убить. Ваша самая главная задача - съе****ся с планенты как можно быстрее, построив ракету. А чтобы построить ракету, нужно добывать ресурсы, раздавая пи***ля животным, шершням и рыбкам, и, как правило, выгребать их самому. А выгребать придётся очень много, особенно по ночам. Так же следует добывать ресурсы, копая под землю, из обитателей которой можно сделать броню, что позволит выгребать пи***ля не в полном объёме. Зверьё появляется за пределами экрана в самых неожиданных местах. Даже шершни могут появиться глубоко под землёй. Строительство ну очень весёлая вещь в игре. Башни нужно строить крайне осторожно. Допустите перегруз и не закрепите башню с боков железными балками, ну или ещё чем, и башня развалится. Однако, что хорошо, затраченные ресурсы вы получите обратно. Небольшой дождик может за несколько минут затопить ваше убежище!

Игра вышла очень весёлой, захватывающей, и поэтому она стоит своих денег.

18009229.review:
It's like a single player Terarria that focuses on you fighting off monsters during night time. Unlike Terraria, however, the visuals are fairly weak, the gameplay feels awkward because of the odd physics in the game (why does a plasma rifle knock you back...?), and overall it's not very.. fun. Terraria and other Minecraft spinoffs work because of the multiplayer aspect, or because they make the objective of the game very different from the originals; Dig or Die does neither. 

Pros:

- Game progression is much faster than other similar games (Single player vs Multi, I guess)
- Basically no learning curve

Cons:

- The actual gameplay is really boring; not sure if it picks up later, but if I spent 2 hours in the tutorials the tutorials need to be nerfed and progression needs to be sped up
- The inventory takes up half your screen so you can't see jack if you need to pull up stuff in the middle of a fight
- The knockback on guns is stupidly high
- Digging feels like a chore considering it's a SP game
- Progression is completely and totally linear, so it's not actually a rogue-lite
- Something like 7-8 monsters are recycled with palette swaps
- Visuals are pretty bad
- Night defense is kind of silly because you have to build a fort but the monsters can just break your walls
- The weight physics in the game is just wrong
- A lot of other things tbh

3/10 - I think there are some okay concepts in there but really the overall product is just unpolished and needs a complete overhaul. Sure it's in EA, but if the end-game product is anything like it is now, I still won't be able to recommend this.

17838134.review:
Dig or Die is a nice touch to the 2D sandbox genre. It easily combines Tower Defense elements with physics and a strong sense of survival. Graphics have some time getting used to, but blends together nicely. The only issues I found was the questionable save system and the structural physics. For someone who prefers casual games with a mix of hardcore elements, the structures in this game require knowledge of basic construction and more often than not hinders half of the creativity games like this want to become. If you don't know what I'm talking about, all of your buildings and creations must follow physical properties and be well supported, along with being not too heavy. I understand the appeal, but It doesnt suit a sandbox game in my opinion. Lastly the save system needs to be completely revamped. Currently your game auto-saves after every night but can be manually saved at any time. If your character dies, its gone forever until you reload a previous save. This means you lose everything you obtain between saves and amplifies the feeling of dread when a simple respawn system would fix this.

I understand the game is not complete. If you enjoy a sanbox game with a slice of realism go for it. Until multiplayer is added, I do not see this game even coming close to the behemoths of Terraria and Starbound. Overall, A good game, with niche mechanics.

17686065.review:
I was attracted to Dig or Die by my experience with Terraria.  Dig or Die is very different however.  Terraria is a great game, and it is cute, and it is lots of fun.  In Dig or Die however: night time really is carnage, the monsters will rip through the landscape to get to you and the items are serious, neither colourful or wacky (rather, the stuff you might see in a sci-fi movie).  In Dig or Die we have a game focused more on surviving the harshness of a new world.    

So far the game has been a delight to play.  I tried Brutal and eventually found a way to survive the first night.  Once you achieve that feat you start to adapt to your surroundings and the adventure begins.  I offer only one reservation, and it's not a criticism of the game, more a shortcoming of my own.  I've always found the availability of a strong wikia/gamepedia source to greatly enhance my own experience and enjoyment of a game like this, but because Dig or Die is a very new game, you may find it a bit of a struggle to begin with.  That said, perhaps this is the best opportunity to delve into Dig or Die, when you know absolutely nothing about the world, the items, the monsters!

17607646.review:
I love this game. Hardcore, permadeath, realistic survival. 

It lets you go at your own pace, which by my standards is not the best feature, since a player can get stuck unintentionally from going out and getting new things. but for more casual players, this feature is totally fine. 

The enemies are unique for each and every one of them, and the deeper you go, the more enemies you find. you also find more resources, to craft better gear, and to make better weapons. the movement is smooth, the controls spot on, and the combat fluid. 

If you like survival 2d games like terraria, then try this game. If you like roguelike 2d games like risk of rain, than try this game out. it has random generation, expansive world, crafting, shooting, building, and REALISTIC WATER PHYSICS!!!! 

to be honest, this game is a gem that is worth way more than 5 bucks. I imagine that I could get at least 3 times the playtime that I already have on this game, just because it is so much addicting fun. multiple save files are nice too, meaning that you can have one world fully geared out and then start a new run on the hardest difficulty and see how far you get. 

BUY. THIS. GAME. Understand? 


Also, the title should be dig and die, because most deaths come from underground. If you don't dig, you can sit in you perfect night survival setup like a little B*tch and live forever. But don't do that. That's stupid and uninteresting. Go out and explore, and then get buttraped by incredibly powerful enemies!

17605842.review:
Although this isn't a bad thing, Dig or Die reminds me heavily of Terraria, but I won't get into why.

[u]PROS:[/u]
-Great music.
-Solid crafting system.
-Good challenge.
-Impressive physics.
-Overall fun game.

[u]CONS:[/u]
-Enemies can dig through dirt with their attacks.
-Enemies can detect you through solid objects.
-Rain occurs far too often, almost more often than not.
-The health regen you have is almost negligible, especially at night when you have a ton of enemies attacking you at once.
-Death can occur rather quickly even in daylight if you aren't careful and wary of the enemies.
-The distance at which enemies will stop following you is 27 blocks. That generally means they have to be off your screen, but quite a few early enemies are faster than you.
-Because of how the physics work, it has been nearly impossible for me to build a successful bridge, even when I know I'm doing it correctly. I have fallen to the depths of the world 3 times now, and I've barely been playing for an hour.

Overall, it is an OK game, one that I do recommend, but expect a lot of somewhat unnecessary challenge (for reference to the difficulty, I've only been playing on the second-easiest difficulty so far.)

I'm going to punctuate this review with one sentence because it's what kept me satisfied through my first few hours of play; You can use the recoil from a shotgun to jump higher and use this to one shot enemies that were previously out of range.

The fluid mechanics are pretty good, even there's enough water to contend with a flooded Venice. Then again, you can clear the "bridge" challenge by using the recoil from the shotgun. 

The enemies are nicely varied if a bit overpowered by being able to dig and swim infinitely (even the flying ones). If there was an achievment for killing 6 enemies while airborn, I would have it, thanks to the shotgun. 

The night combat gets inane and tedious once you've realised you can build a huge base in the minded out "crater" of a mountain. There really should be multiplayer so I can blast my friends with my shotgun, while flying over them in a hail of shot and glory. 

This game has a huge amount of potential but needs a significant amount of development and balancing. Shotgun is love, shotgun is life.

P.S. Make the shotgun on your first night, profit.

17526373.review:
Dig or Die ist ein 2D-Spiel im Geist von Terraria oder Starbound. Der Spieler ist in der glücklichen Situation, auf dem wahrscheinlich regnerischsten Planeten aller Zeiten gestrandet zu sein. Einzige Gesellschaft: ein Bordcomputer, der neben diversen Bemerkungen zu den mangelhaften Flugkünsten des Protagonisten auch durchaus nützliche Hinweise liefert, und Horden von Monstern, auf deren Diätplan Bruchpiloten ganz oben stehen. 

Tagsüber erkundet man die Gegend, baut Ressourcen ab, bastelt neue Gegenstände und Bauwerke (bis hin zu ganzen Wasserkraftwerken!) und Verteidigungsanlagen, um des nachts die Ernährungspläne der einheimischen Fauna zu durchkreuzen. Die Bauerei wird durch den eingangs erwähnten Regen sowie eine Physikengine zur Herausforderung, da bei falscher Planung schnell das eigene Behelfshaus  unter Wasser steht, so es denn überhaupt stehen bleibt - ohne solides Fundament am Anfang eher unwahrscheinlich.

Die nächtliche Invasion ähnelt eher einem Tower-Defense Spiel, da man sich der Gegner zwar mit diversen Waffen erwehren kann, besser aber die ebenso vielfältigen Geschütztürme die Arbeit machen lässt. Interessant: neue Gegner greifen erst an, nachdem man sie auf der Welt gefunden und mindestens ein Exemplar ins Jenseits befördert hat. Der Spieler kann also selbst entscheiden, wann die Schwierigkeit steigt.

Weiterhin gibt es nur zu sagen, dass der Entwickler Gaddy Games bisher durch ein absolut vorbildliches Verhalten auf Steam aufgefallen ist, von der Preispolitik (ich habe Dig or Die vor dem letzten großen Update für 1.99€ erstanden, der Preis steigt mit großen Contentupdates) bis hin zur Aktivität im Spielforum und in der Entwicklung. Für Fans des Genres absolut empfehlenswert!

First I was really questioning if this game was fun at all. The only reason why I bought it was because I had an extra 5 dollars after a game purchase. Well lets just say this is one of the funnest games I have palyed in a long time.

This is a 2d style game that surprised me how fun it was. 

At first its confusing to play. For example, enemies digging strait to you at night from the surface. I abandoned my surface base to make a deep underground one and well... no they were coming from the caverns. Eventually I made a near surface base and found a way to prevent this from happening. I wont spoil it, find out how to yourself.

Water is a force your going to have to deal with. Occasionally when building down you need run off areas (Massive hole near by) Or spare water tanks incase the area gets flooded. Dirt also holds water, and if enough is removed you can quickly find an area flooded. Rain also seeps through dirt, flooding anything down below, however this is easily blocked.

I'm awaiting for more updates, I beleive this game is going to be a blast full release. Also I dont see multiplayer options at the moment, so its sp only.

17512317.review:
I picked up the game  as beta v0.06, not really expecting much, and it delivered.

But then v0.10 came out and sweet holy mercy! Well, it changed a lot and the game got a lot bigger with a lot more to do.  The number of hours I have put into playing the game should say something about how much I enjoy playing it. Hours will slip by and I will wonder where the day went.

About the game.

You have crashed on a planet and you must survive the night creatures. And only the creature types you have killed will hunt you at night. So start digging up necessary ore's or your going to die!

The water physics in the game were a challenge at first, but it really makes the game unique and fun. Use the water to your advantage with hydroelectric generators to power equipment. Craft solar cells to collect energy during the day. Create a base with turrets to protect yourself at night. Its all there, waiting for you to find it, to collect it, to bring it home and to build with it.

You must battle (at the moment, two) bosses in order to collect special items so you can build unique equipment to help you in your quest to escape the planet. The final mission is to build a rocket ship so you can finally leave this hostile planet.

All in all, I find the game adictive. If your not into 2D platform style games, then this may not be for you. But if you enjoy exploring, building and battling, and you can look beyond the game style, your going to love this game.

17506079.review:
Dig or die is still in early access and has just had the 0.1 update. Before that you could get off planet in the space of an in game week with ease ending the game. Now there are bosses to fight, more areas to explore with materials and things to craft from them and the promise of more to come. Patches at the moment are very frequent and tend to be not much more than a few kilobytes.

The game has an interesting way of pacing the difficulty which is explained by the ai computer in the wreckage beside you at the starting point. This happens in a couple of ways. One is that at night creatures become hostile and will be even more inclined to want to chew your face off than during the day. The other that some people might miss out on is that creatures only become hostile if you start killing them first. So if you run and gun during the first day there's a good chance that come nightfall death will follow.

You know those games about building a bridge on a tight budget where you end up making something from girders and knicker elastic? In some ways that is similar to how building works in dig or die. The higher you build the more stress blocks get and once they get too much things will collapse. So with the exceptions of floating islands having a skybase a la terraria isnt possible. Thankfully you can craft goggles that will show stresses when they're on the hotbar that make things a bit easier.

There's also rain, more than the average scottish summer, and that brings some changes as well. Digging requires a bit more thought as some tunneling habits will lead to death by drowning. The good news is that the water can be controlled and used for power or just flooding the world to save building up to the islands overhead.

Weaponary comes in handy for both killing stuff, obviously, as well as mobility. Rocket jumping isnt a new concept in video games, strangely enough the rocket launcher isnt the best for it in DoD, but a lot of the weapons have a knockback to them which means if you need a boost to cross a gap shooting down will give you the nudge needed. Sililarly if you're swimming in the ocean and start running out of air shooting down can get you to the surface faster.

Value wise, one playthrough from start to getting off planet should easily get you below the £1 per hour mark. Currently on around 30p per hour and falling so in the realms of witcher 3's levels of cost per hour.

And one last thing that I really like is that, unlike terraria, you aren't forced into looking at a wiki to find out what to do next. All the info you need to play is in the tooltips or mentioned by the crashed ai. It might not say specifically where to go for the black grass but it's easy enough to figure out black dirt is involved.

Что же можно сказать об этой игре. Да много чего.
Одновременно проста в понимании и хардкорна.
Классическая 2D песочница, но с приятной глазу графикой, напоминающей Flash.
В игре приятная музыка, которая меняется при наступлении дня или ночи. Крафт не слишком сложный, разобраться что и как делается вполне просто.
И все выглядит спокойно до наступления ночи, когда вам, с плазматическим дробовиком наперевес, необходимо отбиваться от орд шалупони , которая наступает сверху, снизу и по бокам, и для выживания необходимо построить базу, учитывая физические особенности игры.
Так все и проходит: собираете ресурсы, улучшаете оборудывание, ставите турели по базе, и кроете матом этих тварей за то, что они прогрызли вам пол.
Плюсы:
-Проста в понимании
-Возможность самому выбрать сложность
-Физика игры
-Крафт, включающий в себя броню, оружие и тому подобное.

Минусы:
-Игра на раннем доступе, а значит в игре еще мало всего. Но игра имеет большой потенциал и возможно этот минус исчезнет.

First off i want to say this 
PLEASE DON'T JUDGE THIS GAME BY HOW IT LOOKS!

This game i truely an gem in the midst of alot of terraria/minecraft clones. DoD introduce some game mechanics that you can't find i that many games. 

Just try to imagine this:
You're standing quietly in your newly build base trying to craft some potions, but then suddenly you are ambushed by "spiky turtles" and vicious dogs and shooting mosquitoes (size of a big bird) because they dug through you base! and suddenly the base is flooded because you forgot to dig a way for the water to drain. That is basically what will happen in this game. 

But do bear in mind that this game is in alpha, so don't expect some massive game that you will spend 500+ hours on. although it is a game you can play again and again.

All in all i would give this game as it is now 7/10, however if i were to rate the potential of this i would say 9/10!

17456171.review:
This one has really good game mechanics.

Think SciFi Terraria with phisics for material resistance like in 7 days (But applied only to Your buildings above ground - sorry no cavein's here). You can use water physics to generate power for advanced machinery or to rise water to reach inaccessible places.

Combat is more focused on base building and planning Your defences against attacks during the night.

The difficulty of the game changes as You progress from Your starting point: As You kill a new, more powerfull type of creature they will also start attacking You during the night. And to reach some places You need to learn how to build a tower or bidge that does not fall to pieces under its own weight. No "sand elevators" or "hanging platform bridges", and this is why I love this game.

Don't be afraid of (low) price. The developers have been genious in delivering a really fun product that delivers much more than You could expect.

17400904.review:
You remember that boring part of minecraft/terraria where you start out with practically nothing and have to spend a good ten minutes to half an hour to get to something interesting?
Yeah this game doesn't have any of that, you start out and the game throws you a crafting table some starter materials and a gun and tells you "be ready to fight off enemies at night." It also has sort of a rogue-lite permadeath thing but since the game gets going so quickly I don't think I can fault it for that.(even trees get fully grown inside of five minutes)
The other thing is that the game has two physics elements that interest me:
Blocks you build with are simulated to an extent so you can't just build an infinitely tall tower into the sky.
It rains fairly often which actually has an effect of depositing water into the world and the water can slowly soak down through dirt but not stone so you have to take that into account.

In the end this game isn't like terraria or minecraft because the focus is on building a base with turrets to survive the waves of enemies at night and there are no swords or pickaxes, only guns and high tech miniturization technology.

17312832.review:
[h1]The Game[/h1]
"A brilliantly simple yet awesomely addictive concept." This is likely the best sandbox, base building, tower defence, simulation that I've ever played. On top of that Every play-through is different due to the completely procedurally generated and simulated open world. Personally, I cant get enough and have subscribed to the beta branch to help test for bugs, but also get a taste of all the new content in the works.

[h1]The Developer[/h1]
Gaddy Games (an experienced solo dev team) is actively working on improving the game and very involved within the steam community - eager to accept suggestions, answer questions etc. a real positive guy!

[h1]Reason to Buy[/h1]
This "Beta" is likely the most polished build still in beta I have ever seen -- and the dev is still adding features! I would say this game is *well, well worth* the current price -- although the dev should really charge $10-15 for the amount of content/entertainment already available to the public..

17183148.review:
"Oh god.. No.. NO! Not the bees!" -Silver, shortly before death.
This game had me on the edge of my seat, all through the night. If you're not careful, you'll be swarmed with Bees, Wolves (I think), 'Dwellers', among other monsters. As you craft better items, the monsters seem to upgrade themselves, until the point where each monster can overpower you, unless your paying close attention. This makes for some truly outstanding gameplay, especially since the monsters can mine blocks.
  Also: Physics. Things collapse if they do not have enough support, etc. It's awesome.
  I think the best way to describe this, is that it's pretty much a mixture of Starbound and Risk of Rain. It also has tower defense aspects in the game.
I enjoyed this game far more than I thought I would. No, really. Get this game: You will love it.

17068720.review:
This game is really fun. Though, I think Dig or Die isn't most fitting title for this game... Neverless....
This game is very well made for the start of early access. [h1] Water, Water, Water.... every where. [/h1] Yes. There is tons of water but if your smart enough, you build your base on the highest part of the Mountain. If the monsters are too high of a level, build to the start of the area where the monsters are high level. 
So it begins, for new players: Normal is more on 'learning the game mode of survival' and Hard is well... Hard.

When I started this game, I did it on [u] Hard [/u] and I suffered painfully. After 3 deaths from Hard difficulty night time, I decided it was best to start a normal game. I kept on forgetting to save the game, because if you don't save it... You have to start all over again if you die. [h1] Water wasn't a problem for me on Normal [after 3 games], because I connected the water waste to the huge tunnels that goes wayyyyy below. [/h1] 
-The most important part of this game is: 
-180* turrets on top of the roof
some 180* turrets on the bottom with straight turrets going inward where the house is.
This way, none of the monsters can destroy your house.
Make sure your house is off the ground by 4-5 blocks high so that the monsters can't jump up.
-The other thing is, I strongly recommend having cement blocks and wood platform 1by1
This will help you shoot below, jump up to your house, filter the rain out of your house if it manage to get through, and let the excess Wasp monster to come through the bottom if the turrets can't kill them fast enough. Make sure you have a lot of health potions.

Overall, I love the game for what it is right now. But you may be like-  "there some negative reviews!"
There is only one thing I got to say about that:
"Wahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh. Noah Ark Simulator. Wahhhhhhhhh."
- Get over it. Build tunnels into caves. Build your house on the mountain. Be a man.

Good Job for making this game. I'm glad that I bought tons of this game gifts now than later.

17036509.review: Just downloaded the game and already see the potential for an amazing Indie title! I say potential because although the framework for Dig or Die is solid and many updates are happening/coming, there are plenty of tweaks to be made to help with the overall enjoyment of the game. Most importatntly to me as a new player, would be to add an autosave function. The game DOES autosave every night, but the day/night cycles are long and no one wants to have to manually save, especially if they are reallly in the zone. The UI (user interface) and in-game menus are decent, but having an inventory screen where all my items are in a list feels very strange and akward. Finally, I know this might upset some people but, the RAIN is so annoying when attempting to build a house. I can put up with the physics building, but no one wants to live their entire early game in a f****** cave. I do not doubt that most players tried to build a typical survival house and watch it get flooded with water and fish to their disappointment. I understand how the game is supposed to be diffcult and rewarding, but the water is just frustraing and annoying, making the early game very not fun. Otherwise, it is a fun game and can't wait to play some more! With the game still in Early Access, I almost guarantee that the end result will be a polished and fun Indie game!

17026263.review:
V0.06でのプレイ。
基本システムはTerrariaそのものです。
大きく違うのは住居が居住スペースではなく防衛の拠点、つまり基地であるというところでしょうか。Terrariaのようにデザイン重視ではなく、なによりも機能性を考えた設計にしなければなりません。
基地の機能性といえば防衛力。分厚い防壁で周囲を固め、砲台をずらりと並べる格好になります。こう書くと簡単に聞こえますが、これがなかなか難しく、悩ましい作業でもあります。
まず平地にブロックを積み上げていこうとしても、うまく支柱で屋根を支えないと自重で簡単に崩壊してしまいます。そのため地下をくりぬいて建造していくのが通常の流れになりますが、単に穴を掘っただけでは雨水がしみ込んできて水浸しになってしまいます（この世界では定期的に雨が降ります）。水没を免れるためには天井を岩のブロックで塞ぎ、場合によっては水抜き用の排水口を作なければなりません。そうすると今度は、その排水口が同時に敵の侵入口にもなってしまいます。
また、防衛兵器の配置も重要なポイントになります。屋外にキャノンを配置して進入される前に片付けるのか、細い通路にマシンガンを並べ、敵を誘い込んで一斉掃射で殲滅するのか。それによって、建物自体をどのような構造にするのかが変わってきます。
…こういったことを悩み、試行錯誤しながら自分だけの基地を建造していくのは非常に楽しい作業でもあります。

と、良い点ばかり書いきましたが、現状はゲームバランスも甘く、ボリュームも圧倒的に少ないです（他の方も書いていますが、数時間でクリアできる程度）。上記の基地建造にしても、単にクリアを目指すだけであればむしろ必要ないほどです。
とは言え、まだアーリーアクセスの段階です。これからどんどん面白くなる可能性を感じさせられますし、また、完成が楽しみでもあります。

17022830.review:
A beautiful gem in the making

Dig or Die is already an engaging experience. A reminder of the time when 
games had vision. It is also a demonstration for the beauty of 2d and that
perspective is not a limitation of time and technology, but a decision - 
for art-style and direction. Dig or Die is many pieces that manage to
come together and form an harmonic whole. 

Watching its process is like watching an artist painting a canvas.
There's already a picture in the mind, the only thing is waiting
for the process for it to manifest for it into reality. 

And this canvas is already an enjoyable outlook of things to come.

17004314.review:
~This is a early access review and may be edited later on depending on what is released in terms of material.~
Dig or die is a cute game, Its blocky style gameplay appeals to a younger audience and is familiar to terraria but alot more forgiving in a sense. The aspects of the game are very familiar to Terraria, but are also unique in their own accord. The really cool thing that caught my attention immediately is the creation and use of turrets, Which are incidentally, key to your survival in the game. I am going to list a couple pros and cons from my inital take of the game. 

Pros: 
~Very unique gameplay style
~Survival relies on more than just sitting and watching your turrets blast everything away.
~Is very welcoming and has a very friendly appearance, despite its name. 
~Can be used as an entrance game to other more complex varieties, such as minecraft, terraria, Ect 
~Has extreme potential to be something amazing.

Cons:
-Is heavily unfinished, (not particularly fair due to it being early access) 
-has a learning curve that is somewhat higher than most games of its type.
-Can be quite difficult if you dont know what your doing. 

Edited: The game gets easier after many days have passed, finding out weapon upgrades and whatnot are essential, however aquiring these items to do so are often quite a challenge. @Gaddy Games, I would suggest making the world larger and making building things a little easier. Just a suggestion of course.

16970674.review:
If you like 2d platformer games similar to Terraria, Starbound, or Risk of Rain, this game may be for you. 

Caution: my review may contain spoilers

This game is similar to Terraria/Starbound in that you have to mine and find resources to achieve your goal, (which is where it is similar to Risk of Rain) in that you have to do your best to survive the oncoming waves of enemies. Another similarity this game has with Risk of Rain is that the monsters you fight night after night are harder and stronger than in previous nights, so the purpose of mining is to get resources to build and upgrade your defenses. Your ultimate goal (which I have yet to achieve) is to get the necessary resources to build a spaceship and get off the planet. 

I have enjoyed the game so far, from what I have played. The controls take some getting used to and they are not the same as games like Terraria and Starbound, but if you have played those games at all, you should be able to pick up the controls pretty quick. It does take a bit of getting used to, and you may die before the first night is over on your first couple of tries, like I did. After you gather enough resources, you can build turrets and walls that will fortify your base. 


----Edit: the monsters don't get harder every night - until you explore more, and run into the harder monsters. Once you attack them, you'll see swarms of them come after you at night. Only attack them when you think you can handle them. 

Highly recommended! 10/10 (Especially for Terraria/Starbound/Risk of Rain players)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dig or Die

or

"Terrarias ugly little brother"


I won this as a key on a twitch giveaway and gave it a shot. To sum it up, it was pretty disappointing. The gameplay can be explained in a few words:

-build a shelter
-build 3 tiers of workbenches to build weapons and material of the next tier
-go west and east to collect the 2 main ingredients for these benches
-dig to collect 3 different kinds of material
-meet about 5 different enemys to slay and collect their dropping material
-craft a few items; weapons, structures, healing pots, armor 
-build defenses for your shelter
-dig for the one last rare marerial to build the bench to construct your spaceship
-The only thing that enlongens the gameplay is the difficulty level that makes the few enemys harder to kill and more aggressive

The world is very limited and not too much interesting. But it is the perfect game for kids at the age of 8 to 12 years. If you want a game for your Kids it might be probably this one Everyone who does not belong into this range i would not recommend this game if you don't just wantt to fak around. Anyway, for a little project like this, the game is well coded and polished in its overseeable content. Even if this was still ea, i don't expect Dig or Die to develope in a much more larger scale upon release.

16773262.review: I am already 90 minutes into the game, and I must say- it's already one of my favorites.  The game is very easy to get a handle on, yet it is very difficult.  You'll find your first night way harder than you thought it was going to be (if you kill something on your first day) with bees trying to gun you down and dogs rushing and destroying your base.  The difficulty makes the game more fun however and allows focus on uprgrading your base and tools.  This is NOT a Minecraft clone (thank god) and is one of a kind.  It focuses rather on an objective and defense, rather than worrying about hunger and how stylish your home is.  You wont be crafting pioneer tools such as pickaxes, axes, swords, etc., but rather laser guns, a tool that extracts resources by rays, and other unique, futuristic items.  I am really excited to see where this game goes and what type of stuff they will add in that will keep the survival-defensive like feel while keeping things fresh and new.  I hope they will add multiplayer sometime soon!

16515933.review:
The game starts off simple. You are stranded, shipwrecked on a foreign planet. You have some tools to use at your disposal and some scrap materials from your shipwreck. Along with your ship's AI, you develop a plan to scavenge to try and discover a method to get off this wretched planet. But like all epic tales, what begins as simple quickly turns to a battle between life or death. If you were a fan of Terraria, Edge of Space, Starbound and similar gathering and crafting 2d survival games, this is certainly up your alley. But this time, you will have to Dig or Die. 

Do you have what it takes? This game succeeds in differentiating itself from the rest, and had me on the edge of my seat at many moments. I suggest you pick up this title and find out.  Two thumbs up.

(Now 4.99, still a good deal)

It costs less than some coffees from Starbucks, and it'll last longer. With Steam's new refund feature there's no reason not to try this out.  Two hours of time is a decent amount to decide if you like it or not. If it's not your cup of tea, then ok.

16254392.review:
I'll put it simply: If you are thinking about getting this game, get it. If you aren't thinking about getting this game, get it anyway. This game combines traditional 2D sandbox mechanics with build-a-base mechanics. The concept is simple: Collect resources as best you can during the day, and fight off hordes of monsters during the night. However, this game makes you think. This game makes you consider every path, every defence, every resource, every kill, and every risk on every step of the way.

Another thing that separates it from the rest are the mechanics. What other game makes you consider [i] water pressure [/i] in your defence strategy? Suffice it to say, you won't find any floating blocks in this game!

Now of course, comes the cons. The complaints I have in this game are few. For one thing, it rains too much. You may complain about Minecraft rain being too loud, but in this game flooding is a serious problem. It can mess with your movement (which can easily kill you in more tense situations) and given enough time can break your structures. Another problem would be the building is a little... off. Just little things, like a block breaking when it shouldn't have or the support behaving unexpectedly, but they could still use some fine tuning.

When it comes right down too it, that's all that's wrong with this game; it just needs some fine tuning. As a game that still in it's early stages, all it's problems should be taken with a grain of salt. From the time you're climbing the steep learning curve to when you've conquered its challenges, the game remains fun the whole time.

Over all, a fun game with huge potential, and one I would happily pay three times as much for.

16197438.review:
簡潔に言えばサンドボックス＋2Dアクション＋タワーディフェンスです。
v0.1から大幅に要素が追加されました。ゲームバランスも調整され、より面白くなっています。
早期アクセスではありますが、現時点でも十分に遊べる出来に仕上がっています。
今後のアップデートも非常に楽しみです。
（筆者は v0.06 からプレイしています）

以下、ver0.12 build 98 でのレビューになります。

自己評価　85／100

宇宙船の故障により不時着した星で、なんとかロケットを作って脱出するのが目的です。
しかしこの星の生物は夜になると大量発生して襲ってくるので、防衛拠点が必須となります。

つまり、昼間は素材を集めて武器防具やタレットなどを作成し、夜は無数に沸いてくる敵を拠点で迎撃する、という流れになります。

この世界では、ブロックに耐久力が設定されていて、自重によって破壊されます。
マイクラやテラリアのように、ブロックを宙に浮かせることはできません。
高層建築等を行うには、土台作りが重要で、慣れないうちは拠点作りも難しいです。
なお中盤になればブロックにかかる負荷を目視できるアイテムが作成できます。

またこの世界のモンスターはブロックを破壊します。
正確にはブロックを攻撃し、そのダメージがブロックの耐久力を超えると破壊されます。
特に夜になると、大量発生した生物が一斉にプレイヤーに向かってくるため、上手く敵を誘導しないと周囲の地形が変わってしまう可能性もあります。

とにかく生きるだけでも過酷な世界ですが、タレットを複数配置し、耐久力のある建材で防衛拠点を作成し、強力な武器防具で身を固めると、この防衛が非常に楽しくなってきます。
無数に襲ってくる敵を無数のタレットで一斉射撃したり、強力な武器で一網打尽にするのが爽快です。

ちなみに難易度設定でピースフルにすると、夜の襲撃をなくす事ができます。
襲撃以外にも独自の要素があるため、ゲームに慣れるまではピースフルでのプレイをオススメします。（特に建築など）

低価格ソフトですのでクリアまでにはそこまで時間はかかりません。
v0.13時点では、イージーで20～30時間程度でしょうか。
ですが、高難易度をクリアしようとすると、かなり苦戦させられると思います。

v0.1 以降は日本語にも対応しています。
v0.12からはゲーム内オプションから日本語選択可能になりました。

Love it. I like the day and night cycle and that it'll show how long you will have until day is over. I like how the mobs will only attack you at night if #1 you're close to them or #2 you attacked one of that particular species at some point already. I also like the different difficulty settings. You really don't see that often in most games where there will be 5 different difficulties with one being peaceful. I don't think I could handle anything over normal though, currently. One thing I would change if I could is not to have as many mobs starting out, because when I'm looking for a place to build after my first move I don't want to be running down too many mobs and end up getting swarmed by them all at night. Music is a good tempo and not too repetitive. I'm looking forward to seeing more from this rock'en team.
As updates come in I'll revise this review. June-04-2015

16162906.review:
(Written about version 0.06, build 5 after finishing it)

When is the last time that you paid $3 bucks and got about 20 hours of entertainment for it?

This is an absolute STEAL. If you even REMOTELY like Minecraft or turret defense games, you should love this game. I could barely stop playing it. Honestly, I had more fun with this than Minecraft. There was an eventual goal/end to this game, and I really enjoyed building out my bases, trying out the various gadgets, weapons, and turrets.

Everything just works really well together in this game - the mechanics, the monsters, the sound and music, the graphics, movement, etc. It's just a good game.

Granted, it's an early access game, so the content is a little more limited than I'd expect in the final version (the world is still pretty big), and there are a few glitches (mostly in the player's favor), but it's easily worth $10 for the amount of fun I got out of it. I took my time to explore and build things and try them out, so it took me about 20 hours from start to finish on the easy mode.

Ive played a good few hours of this and theres alot to like and dislike in the game, for me i didnt like other games like this and ive gotten very bored of minecraft so bought this as i read a few reviews and it seemed different/interesting enough.

Likes:

+ Physics, the ways structures crumble makes sense
+ Movement in the game is very smooth
+ Weapons and Enemies 
+ Graphics


Dislikes

- Theres not much in the way of enemy variation they change colour (may be more that i have not found?)
- It Rains far too much and makes mining way too difficult as the underground floods
- Difficulty ramps up expotentionally, to the point were just leaving your house is impossible
- Attacks from the lower enemies should not be able to break concrete
- required enemy drops are too random, first game i had loads of blue cystals second game i struggled to get a drop.


Suggestions:

1. Include a slider and let us choose how much it rains
2. Increase the drain speed
3. limit lower level enemies so they can break dirt and wood boxes, higher level eniemes could then break concrete/dirt/wood
4. increase the amount of items and materials (how about a grappling hook? or reinforced concrete? sheild generator limited to 10 seconds with once a night runtime would be cool for when your overwhelmed) 


Overall im giving this game a recommendation due to the price £1.99, theres alot to be tweaked and aslong as the developer continues to support ill look forward to any updates.

16137994.review:
A sophisticated 2-D game, Dig or Die impressed me from the beginning. I don't usually play survival-type games, but this one hooked me. Stellar gameplay makes up for the moderately-good graphics. The day/night system reminds me a bit of Don't Starve in a good way. Still in Early Access, so glitches, bugs, and errors can be fixed, and improvements are sure to be made. The water simulation can be annoying, but I appreciate the consideration the developers put into this game, so as to make it this sophisticated. The monsters come in droves, forcing you to actually think about your fortifications and defenses. Physics in this game are pretty decent. All in all, for the price of $3, this game was too good to pass up! 12/10

EDIT: AFTER V0.2 UPDATE: 
Graphics are even better than before, loads of things have been improved, more sophisticated systems and building/crafting physics. The game dev continues to amaze me every update, by adding something new and amazing to the mix. Definitely worth the buy (which has increased to $8) and can't wait to continue playing more!!

不要把这个游戏当做terraria or starbound.你只有发展到科技2才能制造光源，我是玩了0.05和0.06版才写的评测哦！
1.这是个水星球，一天要下3场雨，经常发洪水，当然你是自动半浮于水面的
2.建筑有承重设定，不能无限堆叠，想要无限制地搞建筑是不行的，浮空建筑是做梦
3.你杀了某种怪物，每晚这种怪物就会在你周围大量刷新攻击你，你不能逃跑，它们不会因为天亮而消失	，需要杀光它们
4.你的个人能力提升很有限，主要攻击手段是靠收集材料做‘防御塔’（自动机枪等，可以被击毁）
基于1+2，这个游戏几乎没人特意去做好看的建筑，你也可以一直不做，怪物是可以拆家的，而且很疯狂！
基于3，到了夜晚，你必须回到你预设的基地(战场)，呆在家里刷疯狂的小怪，你可以出去挖矿的时间大概不到半天时间，你还要赶路呢（游戏后期有传送）
基于4，这是个过关游戏，制造出火箭就通关了，也就无所谓与是否能爽快的用双手杀敌了。
我购买了这款游戏，因为他的塔防系统让我有点心动，而且只要2磅，其次他有简体中文版，武侠翻译有点萌，就想支持下作者了：D
由于个体的脆弱和怪物的仇恨系统，其实做成多人模式更好，期待后续更新吧。

샌드박스형 게임에 밤에는 디펜스가 된다는 점이 매우 참신했습니다. 아기자기한 그래픽과 비(?)가 내리면 물이 고이는 부분이 매우 재밌으면서도 화가 났습니다. 기지를 세우면 기지를 동굴로 연결하지 않을 경우 집에 홍수가 일어납니다.(...) 또한 총을 쏘면 일어나는 반동을 이용해서 기본 점프 높이인 3칸을 뛰어넘어 5칸 까지도 뛰어넘기도 합니다. 무엇보다 블럭마다 무게가 존재해서 기지같은 건물을 지상에 세우기 위해서는 그에 맞는 지지대를 세워줘야 하는 부분에서 건물을 짓는 재미를 한층 더 올려주었습니다. 때론 재밌으면서 한편으론 화가 나는 이 기능들때문에 게임이 더욱 마음에 들었던것 같습니다. 문제점이라고 하면, 아직 많이 부족한 요소와 좁은 맵, 아이템 획득의 밸런스입니다. 맵은 매우 한정적이라 왼쪽으로 가면 끊어진 절벽이 나오고 오른쪽으로 가면 매우 높은 산이 나오는데, 최상위 등급 아이템이 오르기 쉬운 산에서 나오고 바로 하위 등급 아이템이 절벽에서 다리를 이어서 건너야만 얻을 수 있습니다. 블럭의 무게때문에 이 다리를 건설하는 작업이 쉽지 않아 파란 풀을 얻기 힘든 반면에, 하얀 풀은 약간 도망만 다니면 순식간에 많은 양을 얻을 수 있습니다.

반드시 필요한 업데이트
1. 물을 빼줄 수 있는 펌프가 필요합니다.
2. 더욱 넓은 맵과 다양한 몬스터가 필요합니다.
3. 몬스터들의 근처에 플레이어가 존재하지 않아도 몬스터들이 블럭을 공격하는 경우가 있습니다. 이때문에 잠시만 한눈을 팔아도 기지에 구멍이 뻥 뚫려있을 때가 있습니다.
4. 디펜스의 난이도가 한정되어있습니다. 날이 지날수록 더욱 많은 양의 몬스터가 한번에 몰려올 수 있도록 해야합니다. 어느정도의 포탑만 설치해두면 1티어 포탑이라도 모든 몬스터를 막아낼 수 있는 화력이 되어서 심각한 밸런스 붕괴가 일어납니다.

I really am enjoying this game and it is totally worth the £2 i paid for it. I would definitely say it is well worth the price even now in this early stage. And as such i recommend it to anyone who has similar games and to those who don't. 7/10

The game it self is great. Its same says a lot for the game, you do need to dig or die. The game needs a tutorial of sorts to get you in the game maybe, as i feel the F1 help a little vague. The only other thing i don't like about the game is the character armour / clothing system. This and sometime the path finding on the enemies is a little less desired.

Overall its a good game and a good price, i look forward to updates in the future. Definitely buy this game.

I was browsing Reddit and someone asked for a game that would run on an underpowered system.  Having an old laptop I use for surfing Reddit while pooping, I drew interest in this topic as sometimes Reddit gets a little boring.  One of the suggestions was Dig or Die so I figured for $2.99 why not?  I must say I got a lot for my money.  The game is pretty linear but it's fun.  You go at your own pace depending on how comfortable you feel so you can stay at tier 1 until you have 50 turrets and a badass fort if you like (what I did since I like to play it safe) before moving into tier 2.  The same goes before you decide to move into tier 3.  

Once you get into tier 3 though it's a whole nother ballgame.  I have to say forcing you to build while being attacked by those black monster wasps was painful but fun.  I was finally able to escape the planet!  Although the ending didn't really feel all that rewarding :P  Maybe it's better if you beat it on brutal but damn Normal felt hard enough.  I guess I'll run through it again at the next difficulty and see how it goes. 

Highly recommended!  I would have paid 3x the price (Might actually buy more copies to gift to friends).

So far I've enjoyed most of what I've done in-game, but there certainly are things that could be improved.

My experience with this game, including some constructive criticism.

I spent most of the time gathering resources for crafting since better items are always essential. The amount of items you can craft is fairly decent, personally I can't complain. Though, I would very much like to see more items in the future.

Combat is typical platform-style game, but the fact that you can make better weapons adds up. What I disliked the most was the amount of monsters that spawn at night. It's nearly impossible to be safe, even in a concrete building. I found out that digging down to stay out of sight from the monsters worked best. Don't even consider building a house unless you figure something out. 
NOTE: You can't build doors as far as I'm concerned. I'm not sure if you can with the tier 3 crafting system.

I like the physics, all though the rain/water can be a little annoying at some points.

Conclusion: I would like more content. Somewhat reduced monsters at night (or content such as traps, guards, more turrets, better building material etc.)

Overall it's a great game with potential for the price. If I were to compare this to anything, I'd probably say Starbound or Terraria.

15934210.review:
If I made this game, I would have called it swim or die.  Or noah's ark 2.  There is water everywhere, and it gets a little insane.  At this point in time, I would say this isn't such a great game, and that I wouldn't recommend it until it comes off early access.

The good parts of this game is the music for sure!  It's very upbeat during nighttime.  It sets a good atmosphere, and it works pretty well with the game.  I love the backgrounds above ground, and I honestly like the building physics.  It makes sense and is fun to try and build something nice while avoiding it collapsing.

The bad parts of the game, as I mentioned before, is the water.  Mind you, I love rain in video games, but I started to dread it when a storm came in.  It is almost impossible to get out of a cave after it rains because the current is so strong, and If you build your house wrong, it floods.  I feel like I had to maintain the landscape and caves of the game, to allow it to drain properly.  I really like the idea that the world was flooding, but the water needed to drain faster, and the current is just too strong.

Another annoying thing about the game was the movement.  I could be walking on flat ground and it would seem like I was being jerked around in the other direction.  He would almost stutter back and forth as he walked.  Same for the mobs.  The character's jumping is also really strange, because it seems like he jumps differently every time.  Sometimes he'll jump really short, and other times he'll jump his normal height.  It makes it really hard to get around the terrain that way.  I really like the shotgun, and I love that there is knock back from the weapon, but it can get a little too out of hand. A couple of shots and I'm either a third across the map, or I'm careening down the cave shaft.

The crafting could use more explanation.  I have a lot of ingredients, like grass, but don't know what to do with it all.  Could use a chest or something to keep all the junk until you upgrade crafting stations.  Also the underground is a bit boring.  The graphics are very simple, but it just needs something to break up the really mundane rock and dirt.

Not bad for so inexpensive, but it definitely needs some work.  I'll be interested to see how it updates.

15911775.review:
There's a lot of potential for this game. 2D-Sandbox, adventure, tower defense. I like the concept, I especially like the game mechanic of structurally sound buildings as to opposed to most other sandbox games of 'screw physics, we have a floating fortress of awesome'. Understandably, this is a really EARLY ACCESS game (0.06 Build 5) review. Given that there's also one developer, at time of writing, here's the major complaints I have with the game:

1. Random freezes
This is extremely annoying. It can happen in crafting, combat, quick saves, auto-saves, you name it. It has happened so many times that I'm putting off with the gaming until it's fixed. It's especially annoying when you save or it auto-saves, it happens right before the save can occur. When you try load back into the game, it most likely didn't save and you lose that progress.

2. Graphics or user interface
Yes I know, early access, but you look at Gaddy's work portfolio. It's mainly mobile/web games. Considering that this is a game for the PC gaming master race, you would think that maybe the graphics would look a bit better. It's just for future feedback. Right now the graphics: they're cartoony. They're simple. They're clean. I get 60fps constantly. It works.

Graphics-wise, I started out the game and I wasn't even aware I had a weapon. For the most part of the first five-minutes, I was just dodging every enemy until "oh that's gun, who knew". Your argument might be "you're just a bad gamer", but I've been gaming since the original NES game out, so I would like to think I know what I'm talking about. The graphics are not a tribute to 8-bit or 16-bit games, as I said, they're like Flash game graphics. But when it gets to the point where I'm constantly asking "what the Hell is that?", it needs to be more clear and defined.

The user interface is clunky as Hell. I'm playing at 1080p resolution and I constantly feel like I'm playing a Flash game at fullscreen. You can never go wrong with cleaning up the user interface. Scale GUI, it's a thing.

3. It's insanely dark
Like seriously, night time comes, and it's pitch black. With maybe the exception of the night sky but it really doesn't help. You're constantly firing off a weapon just to see the path of where you can go. Terraria and Starbound are the sandbox games I play the most. Their night sky has a bit of lighting to the terrain, and that is fantastic, this however is just ridiculous. You might argue that I needed to build the flashlight to counter that, I just never got that far due to the random freezes.

4. The flood
Water physics, it's cool. Maybe one day, we craft half-height blocks so we can create a water filtration system. Flood out the houses or whatnot. What's not cool, is that it rains a lot, to the point that it floods half my screen. It resulted in a building an underwater base. Theoretically it's kinda cool, what's not cool is trying to get out. I wish I had more time to play around, but again, random freezes,

Like I said, there's potential for this game, but I wouldn't recommend getting the game as it is right now. If you're willing to wade through the bugs/crashes/freezes, it is worth your time if you're into a game like this. I may change my opinion on this if fixes and changes are made.

15897382.review:
Dig or Die

Well, I died. But I'll dig again. In fact, I dig the digging in this game.
Dig Dug, was the first thing that came to my mind. Good old 
Atari 2600 madness. 

This was an impulse buy. And although it's just closing in to v.0.1,
I'm already having way too much fun. I played barely an hour, 
and I'm gonna be just in time for an appointment, because
of lingering here, writing these lines and already have the
feeling, I got my money's worth. 

The fighting is fun. It has a little Mega Man vibe, but without
the punishment. The crafting isn't getting tedious, so if you
like your crafting without the micro-management overkill
this might feel just right. But, I'm not too far in, although,
art direction, controls, environment, sound score, it all
sits right at the moment. 

40 hours in, I'm still having a jolly good time. The community
that evolves around Dig or Die is also quiet friendly and helpful.
Not to a small part to the developer, who manages to be kind
and communicative at all times. 

I especially like the approach to difficulty. Mastering the game
on normal, you'll find new challenges on brutal. Adapting your
approach. Enemies will only attack you at night, when you
provoked them in the day. So you can save, and have a
look how deep you want to get yourself in trouble.
While I thought myself master of the world on normal,
I was jumping around like a crazy ferret with a laser gun
on brutal. After some tries, then finally, the first survived
night on brutal. A victory, all the sweeter, for having learned
from previous mistakes, that never got tedious. 

The game doesn't hate you. When you learned another trick,
you'll think to yourself, yeah sure, howcouldn't I have seen
that before? Cool beans! And now to the next adventure!

There's also an often updated devblog, that's always
worth a visit, at: http://gaddygames.tumblr.com/


[b]March 2016 - Dig or Die has hit version 0.2 [/b]

The graphics have gotten a complete overhaul. 
Physics have been expanded. A.I. has gotten smarter.
Increased diversity in monsters, fauna and flora. I thought
it might have become too complex, but Dig or Die still
has its unique charme. Even though crafting isn't 
really one the most regarded mechanics for me,
I find myself returning on this rainy planet.

[b]May 2017 - Dig or Die has hit version 0.3beta [/b]

It's been a year since I have played Dig or Die.
The game has continued to be constantly updated
in the past year. The systems have become more
solid, the user-interface has been optimized and
the physics have grown more complex without
inducing tediousness to the game formula. 
Version 0.3 is about to leave beta soon,
with multiplayer being introduced.

15778183.review:
You thought this was a terraria clone?

You're in for a suprize.

Okay, thats quick. Now what this game has to offer?
Lets go through together.

Your main challenge is physics and rain. Physics the bane of your bridge and rain the bane of your house.

Rain is short but happens often and flood your place, so be careful. this is a hard challenge to a base to not become a pool. But you can harness rain for hydrolectric power.

Physics make it hard. Certain challenges, such as a ravine to get something on the other side, you need to BUILD there. good luck.

Day is craft and dig.
Night becomes a tower defence game.
Hordes of enemies come and attack your base at night.
EVERYTHING wants to kill you, day or night.

This is enough.
all u need to know, this game is awsoeme, despite an odd name.

15660970.review:
Dans Dig or Die, vous incarnez un pilote de vaisseau spatial s'étant écrasé sur une planète au climat très humide : chaque nuit, vous combattrez les monstres que vous aurez précédemment attaqués. Vous évoluerez dans un environnement en deux dimensions généré aléatoirement à chaque nouvelle sauvegarde, avec certaines similitudes entre chaque génération propres au scénario du jeu. Le monde n'est toutefois pas infini (du moins pour l'instant), j'ai pour ma part rencontré une limite en profondeur et sur les côtés.

Le jeu a en effet un scénario, vous êtes guidé par l'intelligence artificielle de votre ordinateur de bord coincé dans l'épave de votre vaisseau, cette intelligence vous donnera de rares indications pour vous indiquer la localisation de matières premières nécessaires à l'élaboration d'objets plus avancés.

La récupération de matières premières est le but du jeu, pour en arriver à l'objectif final : s'échapper de cette planète si pluvieuse. Avant d'en arriver là, vous aurez sans doute passé quelques heures sur le jeu sans forcer si vous consacrez également du temps à construire une base digne de ce nom.

Les textures du jeu à présent : rien d'exceptionnel, fiez vous aux captures d'écran, ces textures ont été réalisées par le développeur. Ce dernier a tout de même exprimé le souhait d'engager un graphiste professionnel pour refaire les textures si le jeu obtient un certain succès.

Au tour de la bande-son du jeu : je crois bien avoir entendu 4 musiques dans le jeu, la musique du menu, la musique de jour et deux musiques de nuit. Ces musiques sont agréables à écouter en jouant, elles bouclent sans doute mais on ne le remarque pas.

Au-delà du jeu et de son contenu, bien complet pour un early access à si bas prix (les prix augmenteront au fur et à mesure des mises à jour), le développeur consacre du temps à la communauté en gardant les joueurs informés et prenant en considération tous les avis, des bugs aux suggestions. Le jeu possède plusieurs traductions fournies par la communauté, dont le français et l'anglais créées par le développeur (le développeur est français).

Je n'ai réellement aucun côté négatif à ressortir du jeu : tous ceux que j'avais trouvés à mon achat ont depuis été corrigés par le dev', selon mes remarques et celles d'autres personnes. Ce jeu vaut le coup rien que pour son développeur.

15512371.review:
故事背景为飞船失事在外星球，主角需要保护自身安全并且收集资源铸造火箭逃离此地
很像是terraria的一款游戏，区别在于其并不太违反物理定律， 单独石块墙体并不能凌空存在(玩家无法自建可以供墙体使用的背景墙，系统可以生成浮空的背景墙附上石块形成空岛），并且墙体不能无限累积链接，过多会根基承载不住而破裂并且倒塌，但可以研究搭建的方法以此来盖更高的大楼。

地图环境大体固定，右侧是颇高的山峰；左面有直通地底的峡谷；上空有若干个浮空的空岛；但整个地下最底下的部分是一望无际地下海没有连接土地的部分，假如你没有携带某些道具的话基本等于死刑，因为你不能轻易的搭建墙体台阶重回陆地部分

日程分昼夜，夜比较段占整个日程的五分之一，值得一提的是极其频繁的下雨天气，这点感觉实在是过于频繁了

道具方面，因为背景是飞船失事，所以科技可见的发达，武器全是枪械和自卫炮 制造工具分为普通和升级的mk2 mk3等。采集只有一个像是吸尘器一样的东西就完全解决，当然需要升级来采集更高的材料。

说下缺点：可见此游戏目前完成度还不够高，内容并不丰富，无论是道具、怪物、地图、剧情、模式都过于极其的单一稀少。并且不能多人协作。

15491590.review:
Achtung - Spiel ist noch in der Entwicklung!

Dig or Die ist ein Ein-Mann-Projekt, das eine Art Terraria mit mehr Action hervorgebracht hat. Ziel ist es mittels Rohstoffen Technikstufen zu erreichen, um schussendlich vom Planeten (auf dem man abgestürzt ist) zu entkommen.
Noch ist Dig or Die sehr jung. D.h. es gibt eine überschaubare Anzahl an ... allem. Rohstoffe, Waffen, Gegenstände und Gegner. Dennoch ist es schon jetzt recht fordernd (jedenfalls für mich). Die Gegner sind aggressiv und scheuen sich nicht mal quer durch den halben Bildschirm zu beissen/kämpfen, um dich zu erreichen, denn entgegen Terraria, können hier die Monster praktisch durch jede Barriere durch. Durch Erde dauerts kurz, durch Stahlbeton lange, nur muss der erst mal erfunden werden. Bei der Abwehr nachts helfen einem Geschütztürme und Reparaturtürme. Aber die erste Nacht ist so schnell da, da ist nichts mit Hightech.
Versionsnummer 0.054 habe ich jetzt gespielt. Das stimmt auch damit überein, wo man vom Umfang her das Spiel sehen kann. Es gibt momentan tatsächlich nur das Nötigste, um das Hauptziel zu erreichen. Schön ist es daher, dass der Macher den Preis mit dem Umfang ansteigen läßt: jetzt zu Beginn habe ich 2,99€ bezahlt. Insofern ist es okay, wenn es sich noch wie ein Flashclone von Terraria anfühlt. Aber es soll ja wachsen.
Ich freue mich jedenfalls auf zukünftige Erweiterungen (die jeder Besitzer automatisch erhält) und habe den Kauf nicht bereut.

15467296.review:
[h1]Dig or Die[/h1]
2015-04-20
[b]Жанр:[/b] Аркада с элементами песочницы.
[b]Управление:[/b] клавиатура - движение, мышь - прицеливание, стрельба и размещение блоков.
[b]Сюжет:[/b]
Ракета с героем игры разбивается на неизвестной планете. Parallel Earth, resources negligible. Климат тропический, фауна враждебна и вокруг очень сыро.

В игре приходится очень много прыгать и стрелять. Оружие не выбивается из каких-нибудь там монстров, а крафтится на станциях, как песочницах (ага, из того, что выбили из монстров :) ). У крафта несколько уровней, для разблокировки каждого надо изготовить станцию (Auto-Builder) соответствующего уровня. Большого количества рецептов не ждите - это всё-таки аркада, а не песочница. 
В начале игры приходится считать ресурсы, иначе их может попросту не хватить. Потом приходится покопаться под землёй в поисках ресурсов, попутно истребляя местную фауну. Время от времени приходится чего-нибудь строить - мосты или лестницы. Один нюанс: у всех строительных блоков есть прочность, и если на какой-то блок опирается слишком много других, то он вываливается, а вслед за ним начинает разваливаться вся конструкция, иногда прямо под конструктором.
Еще один нюанс - мобы тоже не дураки чего-нибудь сломать, особенно ночью. Ночь - отдельная статья. Ночью к вам в гости толпами приходят все местные монстры. Убежать, скорее всего, просто не получится, да и некуда бежать - самые мощные монстры водятся под землёй и по краям карты. Приходится копать нору (а монстры тоже умеют ломать землю) и ставить вокруг турели, которые тоже далеко не вечны. 
Вода в игре шикарна в плане физики. Местные дожди обильны и могут затопить очень большую площадь... или вашу базу. Приходится предусматривать водостоки... через которые тоже могут прийти монстры... 
Уровни сложности. Они... сложные. Даже на Easy не ждите покоя, это реально Dig or Die - "копай или умри". Или "копай И умри". К счастью для нелюбителей бурной деятельности, есть весьма спокойный уровень сложности Peaceful, на котором местные монстры не пытаются истребить игрока сразу же. Про уровень сложности Brutal мне даже думать неприятно - это для асов клавиатуры и мыши.
Ах да, самое главное - у игры есть цель! Цель вполне логичная - свалить с этой планеты, для чего на финальной станции крафтятся узлы ракеты. Ракета, в отличии от многих других игр, вполне работоспособна и честно завершает игру. Финального ролика нет. Я думаю - это временно. 
Музыка неплохая и не слишком надоедлива.

Итого: 9 из 10 и надежда на дальнейшее развитие игры.

15458571.review:
TL;DR overview:
Pros: 
harvesting / mining / gathering is super quick
decent soundtrack
fun to explore
difficult
very different from Terraria, not a carbon copy
devs seem to be updating regularly

Cons:
Not very much content so far (enough for a full game, but still lacking compared to Terraria)
Entirely combat centric, no real rpg elements
Lack of options when dealing with enemies

Non TL;DR! This game is really fun, I enjoyed it as much as I did Terraria!  The game is combat centric so it provides a much different play style than Terraria.  The long process of mining and cutting trees has been stream lined to give more focus on the combat.  I spent 3 bucks on this game, and if this was the final product I wouldn't be disappointed at all; I've never enjoyed a cup of coffee for 10 hours.  However, this game is severely lacking in content.  The content it currently has is solid and polished, and I can't wait to see what the devs have in store for it.  There are only 3 types of enemies, turrets, and weapons, which leaves very little long time gameplay, but it still leaves a good 5-10 hours of fun.  I've heard that the game will go up in price as more updates are added, so I would highly recommend getting it now.  Worst case scenario, the devs abandon it, but it's still a complete game!  Best case scenario, it really picks up and you have a 20 dollar game for 3 bucks.  That my friend, is economics.

Un super jeu franchement pour 3euro c'est donné

Au cours de l'aventure , vous serez confronté à la pluie , des enemies hostiles que vous devrez repoussé pendant la nuit , ainsi que des boss que vous rencontrerez en allant chercher des ressources pour vos défenses et pour construire une fusée pour tenté de s'échapper de cette planet hostile . La pluie et les enemis ne sont pas vos seuls défis vous allez devoir gérer également vos construction pour construire des ponts et structures stables sous peine qu'elles s'effondrent , Vous allez devoir vous servir de la physique de l'eau (pression) pour alimenter vos structures . Pour résumé Dig or Die vous allez devoir construire et partir à la recherche de ressources le jour  pour vous préparez a l'assaut nocture des monstres de la planet . La gestion du temps est important dans ce jeu le jour dure certe plus longtemps que la nuit mais il faut faire gaffe a pas ce faire surprendre car les nuits sont intenses sans défenses ( tourelles ; mur et fortification  )  il est parfois difficile d'y résisté voir impossible si vous jouez au niveau de difficulté max :D
Les gros points fort dans ce jeu c'est qu'il y a une progression rapide ( genre on passe pas un temps infini a creusé en plus plus on améliore le gun pour creusé plus sa va vite , l'ambiance sonore n'est pas lassante (enfin pour moi)  . Et le jeu a une bonne rejouabilité avec divers niveau de difficultés pour les plus hardcord gamers d'entre vous ;)

Edit : Le jeu ne fais actuellement plus a 3 euro (il est passé a 8 euro) car il y a eu beaucoup d'ajout de contenu ( le développeur a fais un planning du contenu qu'il allait rajouter  ) 
Si vous hésitez encore a l'acheter n'hésitez plus foncé parce qu'après il me semble il y aura une nouvelle hausse de tarif
Le développeur est méritant ( il bosse seul sur ce jeu ) et le jeu les vaut largement ces 8 euro  

Donc si Dig or Die vous interesse , je vous conseille de l'acheter dès maintenant après ce sera plus cher

15316439.review:
To be honest, I first saw this via gameplay posted by Chimneyswift. It looked fun, and the fact that it was so inexpensive also helped me along. For me, the fact that it is currently in early-access means I get to actually have a game from its release, and watch it grow and evolve. The game itself is one I enjoy. A lot. It is reminescent of Terraria, but it has a stronger grasp on physics. I discovered that to build a bridge across a certain chasm, I needed to have a huge support for one half, then I had to use the shotgun's recoil to jump to a small ledge on the other side, and build another oversized concrete arch. I managed to connect the two, and it didn't fall!
        The guns have recoil in the game, with the shotgun having the most as far as I have experienced. You can aim in the opposite direction of where you are going and pull the trigger, preferably while jumping, and you'll propel yourself across the terrain with ease. It reminds me of rocket jumping in TF2. 
         Now, onto the enemies: they start out nice and easy, just your basic horn hounds and whatever the bee thingies are in the beginning. The bees are ranged, but the power crystals they drop are essential. You are able to craft some turrets early on, and you WILL need them when night comes. Luckily, night is rather short, but very intense. I have survived maybe seven or eight nights, and have lost an unfortunate amount of my turrets. This is due to the black variant of the bees having a long burst of stinger-plasma-bolt-thingies, each dealing 6 damage with-out armor. They melt terrain, and your defenses along with it.
            It all creates a unique and difficult challenge, which I quite enjoy. The music is... Incredible, to say the least, and the gameplay is addicting. I don't really know what I could recommend to be added, because I just have no idea WHAT to add. I'm a player, not a programmer. (No, not THAT kind.) So, all in all, this game has my attention, and it will keep my attention. I am eager to see how it all unfolds.

Un juego de supervivencia muy entretenido y bastante simple.
Tendremos que sobrevivir a un planeta bastante hostil y prepararse para las noches que son muy duras .
Iremos cavando y encontrando recursos para mejorar nuestro armamento armadura y sobrevivir a este mundo tan peligroso acompañado por una banda sonora muy buena en el que te da ganas de jugarlo más y más hasta poder terminarlo.
Hay muchos enemigos y encontraremos diferentes armamentos aparte construir torretas y diferentes cosas para no tener problemas en la noche.
Aparecerán nuevos enemigos a medida que vayamos avanzando por el planeta. Recolectando nuevos recursos y las noches se volverán mas difíciles.
Algo que hay que recordar siempre es que si no exploras vas a morir…

[b][i]En mi opinión el juego está muy entretenido y al ser simple no hay dificultad en los controles pero claro en la noche si será difícil.
Tiene una gran cantidad de recursos, armas, herramientas, torretas aparte la variedad de enemigos y su dificultad.
Tengo que darle un 8/10 ya que me gustaría que tuviera más cosas claro que no está completo pero supongo que cambiara la nota más adelante cuando vayan actualizando el juego.

+Completo - Recursos, armas, herramientas, armaduras, torretas, etc

Kryowaffen auf einem Eisplaneten und solche sparenzchen) und die Möglichkeit Waffen von vorherigen Planeten mitzunehmen.

Die Schrotflinte die ihr zum Anfang herstellen könnt eignet sich nicht nur um euch zu verteidigen sondern auch zur Fortbewegung. Ganz nach dem Rocket-Jump-Prinzip katapultiert euch die Waffe in die entgegengesetzte Schussrichtung wenn ihr sie im Wasser oder in der Luft abfeuert, richtig eingesetzt kann man damit viel höher springen und sich schneller fortbewegen, nutzt das einfach aus^^

15239061.review:
First off, I would like to congratulate the developer for being one of few that I did not regret buying an early access game from.

Dig or Die is one of the few gems in early access ATM, and it brings something new to the table when it comes to sidescrollers. The goal of the game isn't as simple as many would like to think. First, there's fighting monsters, then digging, then searching for rare plants atop a giant mountain - this game has it all. There are many things about this game that stand out to me as a gamer. One being that the blocks have weight. Though the blocks do not fall over if you hit them, they can and will break if you build them as if you were building in Minecraft. For building large structures, there are blocks you can place to hold up ceilings and other roofs. Another thing is water. You'd think that water wouldn't be a problem, but on the planet you're on, it is a huge one. Forget just digging a hole and covering the entrence to survive, because water will drip from the dirt blocks all around you until you decide to put some actual walls up. And did I mention that enemies can dig, too? Yeah, this game is challenging, but that's where crafting comes in. There are 3 tiers of crafting that are actually well-balanced for being a fairly new game. I'm not going to spoil them for you, but they are categorized by different auto-crafters, each one requires the previous to be made. Each tier also has a new turret(s), allowing you to lock down areas of the map with force. They are also your lifeline at night. The most prevalent mechanic in the game is the day and night cycle. Imagine Dying Light, but 10 times worse (in a challenging way). Enemies are absolutely vicious at night, turning the game from adventuring to tower-defense in a split second. You'll need to think quickly in order to survive away from your base at night, or else its GG for you. Thankfully it auto-saves after every night. 

Overall, I give this game an 8/10, even though I usually set my limit on early-access/beta/alpha games at 7/10. With the price set at only $3, you have nothing to lose when trying this game.

15190968.review:
[b]Dig or Die[/b] czyli kop lub giń. Wcielamy się postać, która podróżuje po galaktyce, ale na jej nieszczęście rozbija się na nieznanej planecie. Niestety to nie koniec przygód naszego bohatera. Podczas poszukiwań cennych surowców w celu odbudowy naszego środka transportu napotkamy nieprzyjazne potwory.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=14AWKNuvmRE

Na swojej drodze eksploracji napotkamy lądowe, wodne, a także powietrzne stworzonka. Każda z nich posiada inne właściwości walki, a także zróżnicowany poziom zaawansowania. Każdej nocy atakują nas hordy przeciwników, które charakteryzują się zaawansowanym systemem sztucznej inteligencji.

Każdy kto twierdzi, że [b]Dig or Die[/b] to klon [b]Terraria[/b] może się delikatnie mylić. Główny czynnik, który przemawia na korzyść tego pierwszego to zaawansowany system fizyki. Budowanie wieży, budowli czy nawet prostego mostu będzie lada wyzwaniem. Każdy architekt wie, że ściany posiadają swoją wytrzymałość, a [b]Dig or Die[/b] posiada ten mechanizm.

Aktualnie gra kosztuje [b]2.99€[/b], a w dodatku jest w wersji pre-alpha v0.05 co czyni go bardzo atrakcyjną pozycją. Autor [b]Gaddy[/b] twierdzi, że ukończył dopiero 30% z całego projektu, a dodatkowo ma powstać jeszcze tryb multiplayer!

Jak za cenę 2.99€ śmiało można kupować w ciemno. Wraz z rozwojem gry cena będzie sukcesywnie wzrastać, gdzie w finalnej wersji będzie kosztować 12€.

W wakacje będziemy mogli zagrać w tryb multiplayer, a w 2016 Dig or Die uzyska status wersji finalnej.

[b]Plusy[/b]
+Cena
+Fizyka
+AI potworów
+Wymagania
+Rozwój gry

[b]Minusy[/b]
-Czasami gra dostaje crasha przy ręcznym zapisie
