15176569.review:
# Rating

* 10 of 10
* Very good game, probably the best game i purchased in steam. You have games like this with way more recipes, bigger worlds, more content, but none have the water system of Dig or Die. Thats what makes this game unique and amazing. You can build huge dams, mess with water using water pumps and you can also build water power generators!

# Gameplay

* During the day you search for resources and during the nigth you defend from hordes of enemies.
* You can build bases, bridges, etc.
* Structures can colapse. 
* The rain/water system is amazing.
* The eletrical system could be better... A water pumps outside of water still consumes power. No batteries to store power. No uranium power generators or any kind of portable power generator.
* Some enemies explode on dead and their explosions can pass through blocks...

# Music

* Good music

# Interface

Its clean and easy to use, however the only way to see resources that you have is if you place them in your shortcut bar...
No stashs: You can hold up to 9999 of each item. No more time lost organizing stuff.

The developer seems to be dedicated to this game, he plans on adding a little more to the price with each update until it reaches it's planned full price at around $12.00, so clearly he has a long term plan in place. It has no multiplayer yet, but that is such a highly demanded thing by the community that I'm sure it will be. The construction of defenses, bridges, and towers are extremely fun and have a good amount of skill involved in them. There is little grinding in this game, you get straight into the action which I personally enjoy. The developer took everything good about Terraria and other similar games, mashed them together, picked out the bad parts that didn't compliment eachother, and added many unique features and aspects to finish it off. This is a fantastic early access game with a promising future.

15058392.review:
A very basic sandbox survival "Terraria, Starbound, you name it" like game. Unfinished in content but what is on show at the moment does seem to point to a bright future. The title does have a end game which is crafting a spaceship to get off the alien home world. The crafting involves collecting the usual, getting gems from flying bugs and using the workbenches to upgrade items. Its not a overly the top system to use and I got the hang of it early on. What sets it apart from other 2D survival games is the tower defence element which is done rather well. 

It also makes you plan how to go about building bases as there is none of that floating blocks you get in minecraft and if you go over the strengths of the building blocks it will all come falling down about you. Another notable mechanic is that this title does better than most, is that you never feel that you get large stop gaps in gameplay where you are clueless on what to work towards next. The title is currently on sale for £1.99 which will go up in price as content is added to the game. At its current price and what is on show I recommend this title at full price as of 26/03/15.

15037091.review:
Dig or Die... its all in the name. 

I've play a lot of sandbox games but this one finds a special place in my heart of gaming!

Like most I've played all the mainstream sandbox games and when i found this little gem i knew i had to try it. Remember being stuck outside with no base to speak of in Minectraft, Terraria and the like? the next day after hopefully not dying over and over again you build a base then..... nothing. Terraria added some nifty features with zombies knocking on doors and breaking them down and Minecraft has mods but none that feel like this game. 

Never mind the awesome physics or the quick and easy crafting system it was the base defense and path-finding mobs that made me fall for this game. I've been a fan of the tower defense genre as well as sandbox games and too see them together, but more importantly, to see them put together well, I was amazed. Remember your first night in Dig or Die? 

I had diggin into the side of the hill my spaceship had landed on. i dug in deep with my 2 turrets and shotgun which i had the the luck of killing enough fireflys to craft and enough scrap for iron. i had watched some videos so i knew what to expect. leaving a hole for the mobs to come in i felt safe..... i was wrong. they came from below and both sides, within moments i was running, screaming like a little girl trying to dig deeper to avoid the continuous stream on monsters trying to devour me. Its safe to assume i didn't make it and i will now admit that was my 3rd first night.  

Play this game and you'll like it!

Also i would like to note the replay ability of this game, its a sandbox so each time try something different and learn something new. My hat is off to the developer, you sir have made my day and many more to come. 

My input for the game would only be a harder survival mode. Not just stronger mobs, but make them dig, walk, shoot, strike better based off of how many in day games you've been around. Once you've built the best base you can where everything repairs and lasts the night what then.... sure you can leave the planet but what if you want to stay!

15024268.review:
Awesome game. Keeps the simplicity of the Tower Defense, but also adds a bit of terraria/minecraft/starbound feel to it.

PROS: 
- Oldies graphics
- Relaxing music during day, exasperating during night.
- Nice variety of manual weapons
- Challenge to build actual structures in a 2d game (Most of them just lets you place anything anywhere)
- Very challenging once you've pissed off all the mobs.
- Nice GUI 
- The requirements to progress forces you to go all over the map,

CONS:
- From time to time it seems like the mob swarms are a bit overpowered.
- The map is limited.
- It's hard to understand how the physics of the buildings works. (You end up placing shit everywhere and pray to god it will hold that way)
- There are not enough turrets in stock.

Saying all that, I must say its a super good game, due it's alpha state. What I think it should be added:

- More materials, weapons and items.
- More mobs
- More stages or steps you have to get through to get the fuck out the planet.

14999418.review:
This is a game that seems to have watched what people didn't like about other sandbox games, and worked extremely hard to avoid those problems. Jumping into the game, it's clear that this game doesn't intend to waste your time. The menus and overall feel are extremely smooth and quick. This seems to permeate the whole game's design; don't waste the player's time, let them do what they want, and look good doing it.

To start, most sandbox games take forever to mine a block. This one doesn't. And while the time it takes to mine a dirt or stone block decreases with better tech levels, it never feels  arduous to cut through a mountain or dig a tunnel. Which I think is fantastic in a game that's about digging tunnels. Your character occupies one block of space, and it takes under a second to mine one block.

After playing a bit, you get to the "building" part, which is even simpler. The game dispenses with the idea of you manually putting down blocks of dirt that you picked up. Instead, you mix concrete and place *that*. It's one of about five basic block types you can place. While that seems limiting, it's actually freeing. I've never enjoyed making dirt palaces with haphazard streaks of cobblestone and sand. It lets you focus on the stuff you actually want to do; dig tunnels, get resources, craft new things, and fight monsters.

(spoilers ahead)
But the real treat comes when you're told to go westward to pick some flower if you want to craft the next tier. while the world itself is randomly generated, there's a giant chasm in the west, cut straight through the ground. You need to build a bridge over it in order to cross, but it's not as simple as just laying down concrete - if a structure is too unbalanced or too much weight is placed on one block, the whole thing falls apart. You're forced to design a bridge that can cross the chasm. Similarly, there are floating islands that contain a mineral you need for a different tier - and you have to build a tower to reach them. While these are fairly scripted things to do, it felt surprisingly good to be given a well thought-out challenge in a building game, yet still have the feel of random generation and freedom.

While this game may not last forever, it gives you a great experience for a few hours, and seems to respect you as a player. It knows you've seen it all before, but it knows you quit playing those other sandbox games for a reason - and it's determined not to have those same problems.

14952939.review:
Update - 8/22/15 - Many Thumbs Up!

I'm leaving my previous review up so that people can see just how much progress the Devs have made. This game has become incredibly fun. I would highly recommend a playthrough. It'll take you a couple tries to get the hang of it, but it is well worth the time. This is definitely a game to own and stay up to date with. The Dev is constantly involved with the player community and responds kindly and with tons of info if you are stuck or upset. Give this one a try. I got fed up at the beginning of Early Access, but the updates to this game make it worth playing.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
(Previous Review) - Thumbs Down

I'm playing on normal and can't even make it to the 3rd day. The game difficulty increases near-exponentially while your ability to upgrade is tediously slow. The acqisition of materials needed for crafting is difficult and delayed but extremely necessary to make it through even a single night.  The water is just a pain in the rear. I know it is being billed as one of the key features, but I hate it. Water accumulates even where there was no water and no way for it to get where you are. Diggin in a dry patch of dirt uphill? Lets fill it with water.  Not raining above ground? Lets make it rain underground. Can't mine through stone yet? Don't worry, the first-level enemies can blast right through it.

I typically hold off on giving a review like this, but this game needs a lot of work before I would suggest buying it.

Check back in a few months and see if there are any updates before buying. The developer is claiming to be done, if all goes well, by summer 2015? Hell no. This game is not even close to being done.

---------------------------EDIT --------------------

Close to making me change my recommendation.

So I have been back to check in on the game and here is what I've found:

Very big thumbs up for the Dev taking part in community reviews and being nicer than a grandmother with dementia. Seriously, the Dev actually seems to care if people enjoy the game. Its a nice change of pace for early access. Well played Dev!

The "tutorial" given by your ship seems a bit more informative. It tells you how to get along a bit better than when I first played. If you play on easy, you can survive, but it is almost too easy. I like a challenge, but the content is still a bit lacking. I like the concept of the game and enjoyed the play through on easy. 

Verdict: so-so.

Easy is now too easy and difficult is really bloody difficult. The plus side of this is that you can play on easy to get the hang of things and try your hand at difficulty settings afterwards. The updates of the game have definitely helped. My hope would be to see a "DLC" for this game to extend the game play and allow for a bit slower increase in difficulty on normal difficulty settings. 

Also, good luck if you get a map with sky islands that are 40+ blocks above you... That took some creativity on my part.

14943646.review:
So, this is your standard 2D sidescrolling sandbox adventure game. Just, it looks like it was made in flash. There's some decent pros and cons that I'll get into later. So, in short: Why do I recommend it? Because it's $2.99. and it's not too hard to get more value out of this than your local fast food dollar menu. There's mandatory gap(s) to build over, so it forces you to use the bridge system. Toped with structural integrity of some sort, you may have zero luck doing whatever. It's a fairly quick play. If I had to guess, you could speed run this in about an hour from begiunning to end. But that may not be giving the game enough credit, due to some of the (current) end game collection needs.

The long version:

Without comparing it to obvious titles, this is your standard 2d sidescrollking sanbox adventure game. You're bound within a certain width of the map, and you spawn in the middle of it. You're given a basic box (it does all your crafting, because lore) with some basic recipes in it. You do the standard 'break and kill things for loot' and use it to make a larger, more advanced box to craft upgrades for your collection tools, guns, make new blocks etc.

Pros:

Clean graphics - Simple yet charming graphics make it easy to comprehend the background from foreground.
Physics - The blocks you place have physics, and will deconstruct themselves if you don't have any structural integrity.
Water - There's lots of it. Always. The water physics are quite good. Gravity affected, and follow semi-normal laws.
Cheap - It's stupid cheap, better than a dollar menu!

Cons:

The graphics look like they were made in flash. Charming as they may be, it looks like a title from newgrounds from the early 2000's.
Too much water. There's always water, and it doesn't go away, it just falls through caves and fills up somewhere.
Early access- This is ONLY a con, due to the lack of content. But for the price, I suggest you get over it. Its your money, don't buy if you don't want to.

Do I recommend? Sure, why not. If I compare this to buying like 3 tacos, or 3 double cheese burgers I was able to enjoy this much longer, and it didn't make me poop (pooping is quite good for you though, this game offers no health benefits).

I can't take this seriously anymore.

14943309.review:
Fun game, albeit a bit short. I played through on normal, might go back and give harder difficulties a shot. There's a sharp learning curve in the beginning with the physics and enemy AI. Collecting the loot for the early defenses is also tedious. I almost gave up on it honestly, but gave it another shot after watching the trailer, After what was a slow and rocky star, things moved along nicely progression-wise, Totally worth it for the current price tag of $3 and the demand on your system is so low that the game could run on a toaster. 

Pros:
- Realistic physics for building structures
- Bridge and tower building was fun
- Smooth combat
- Nice music
- Mining doesn't take ages

Cons: 
- Not much to explore
- Little variation for enemies, items and terrain 
- Rough, grindy and somewhat confusing start (might just be me)

Noteworthy:
- Surviving nights goes from really hard to really easy, at least on normal difficulty
- Enemy AI was very strange sometimes (a single bee following me across the map for a while, monsters spawning very close to me while digging straight left or right, monsters choosing to dig through an insane amount of ground to get to me)

I'm interested to see how the things fleshed out. As of now, it feels a bit like a section of a bigger game. Fun stuff though, a no brainer to buy and play if you're the terraria/starbound type.

It's similar to "Terraria", albeit a "lighter" version that concentrates more on tower defense.  During the day, you'll be able to go out, explore, collect resources, and so on.  During the night, you'll need to (quite literally) "Dig or Die"...that is, dig yourself a nice enclosure and hide behind your towers/base walls until morning.  The physics in this game are a bit more realistic too, what with the need to construct bridges in a "proper" manner lest gravity plunge them into the very pit you're trying to cross.  I personally find this game to be incredibly fun and is a must-own for those who enjoy "Terraria" and "Starbound".

14927244.review:
I just got this game for it's $2.99 pricetag and oh my god is that the biggest deal I have ever seen.

I only have 40 minutes in this game so far (At least at the time of this review) and I am already having a blast scavenging for supplies and building a defensive system before night falls and I get swarmed by the hostile wildlife in the unknown planet our protagonist lands in. 

In this game, Dig or Die, the story is basically that your character was part of some company, and your ship crash lands in this unknown world. Almost instantly, you are thrust into gameplay, with a little funny AI companion to guide you along your way. A few seconds in, and he tells you that you must look for supplies to make turrets before night comes, and you are forced to fight for your life. I got supplies and even got some wood with this cool little gizmo thing that's supposed to act as your 'mining' mechanic. It kind of reminds me of the gravity gun from the Half Life series, in it's look. I built a small fort with 2 sentries mounted on each side and hoped for the best went night came, and my god, was that one of the most epic fights I have ever had.

While the music in the day time is peaceful and serene, when the monsters are unleashed after dawn, it turns into some epic, badass soundtrack that just made me feel awesome while I shot monsters left and right, determined to keep them away from my base, determined to keep myself safe.

When night makes way to light, I have to work hard to find upgrades to my supplies, get better armor and better weapons as while you progress, the game gets increasingly difficult. But it all depends on how hard you chose your game to be in the settings. This is only the surface of the game, I've scratched, in almost just 1 hour of gameplay. The only issue I currently have with the game is that when the rain comes, it rains for only a few seconds, and it completely floods the land. Not a lot, but just enough to bug me and other players as it seems. I hope this gets fixed. Other than that, this game is completely worth it's price and people should get it. I can't wait for the full release! 

9.5/10. I approve. Awesome game so far!

14914169.review:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-OUT OF DATE--OUT OF DATE--OUT OF DATE--OUT OF DATE--OUT OF DATE--OUT OF DATE--
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

So where do I start wth this game?

I guess with a bunch of curt statements about the pros and cons, before I get on to the full review.

Pros:
-Varying tiers of difficulty.
-Difficulty curve that you control. (mostly)
-Challenging building physics.
-Decent amount of content for $3 (With price slowly being raised as game is developed)
-Not some cheap money-grab knock-off of terraria or anything like that.
-Night is somewhat short (Only played Easy, so I don't know if it gets longer at higher difficulties)
-It has an ending (You escape), but you can avoid it.
-Enemy AI is relentless. And I mean it.
-Rain physics.

Cons:
-Enemies WILL overwhelm you on playthrough one.
-Building physics take getting used to.
-Released like a week ago, so may be unbalanced/not enough content at the moment.
-Indie (Lower funding/Less employees than triple A studios, so dev time may be longer)
-It has an ending within only a few hours (Will probaby get longer as development goes on).
-Night starts to feel much more pathetic, and the shortness of it gets annoying, once you get high tier items. I often find myself wishing for a gamemode with a 15-20 minute setup, then an infinite night. Or at least customizeable timers.
-Rain. Physics.

Basically, this game is Terraria mixed with Xenominer mixed with **some game that requires you to escape a planet** (Shut up, I couldn't think of anything)

So let's start with my first playthrough. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
NOTE: This CAN, and WILL, spoil your first playthrough. STOP READING NOW if you have already decided to purchase it. Trust me, the first playthrough is so much more fun blind.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

(Note 2: I'm refraining from mentioning any part of rain or water in my playthroughs, because it's basically everywhere, all the time. No need to tell you that it rains every minute. It hardly affected me this early into the game.)

 I immediately charged to the far right side, thinking like a terrarian, trying to explore everything. Within seconds I encountered yellow flying bugs and yellow dogs. No big deal, super weak, killed them with ease. Went farther, and after about a minute, I found a black colored variant of the flying enemies. It took ages to kill with the starter weapon. Unfortunately, here's where I had issues. I read nothing in the quick help menu, and only listened to the AI for a short while. So when I decided to bunker down for the night, I didn't realise what I had brought upon myself.

Context: The game's difficulty curve is technically one that you control. You will only get assaulted at night by enemies that you killed during the day.

I didn't know that.

Within seconds there was an absolute HORDE of the black flying enemies. I had only a few concrete walls (which stood no chance) and one weak turret (RIP) in between me and unescapeable death. It was over in 20 seconds. I had no chance. Luckily, I had thought to quicksave... after I had killed the black flying enemy.

So on to my second playthrough. I learned pretty fast. Only killed the yellow flying enemy and yellow dogs for the first few nights while I built up. Then the AI clued me into some flowers to the west to get my T3 autocrafter. So I immediately went east, like the smart man that I am.

To the west: Red flying enemies, the next step up from the yellow ones. Not easy, but not difficut either.

I made a mistake.

I went east and found the black ones again. Figured me, my 12 turrets, and my 3-thick concrete walls could take take them.

I was wrong. Again.

I lasted nearly until morning that time. But by halfway through the night there were droves of them. It felt like a bombing run. I was down to 3 turrets which I had hastily evacuated to my basement. They were busy with all manner of dogs that I killed during the day (Higher tiers than the yellow, but dogs don't hurt nearly as much as the flying enemies), which left me valiantly defending against the fliers.

It went well for about 3 minutes. Then the dogs broke through the turrets.

With just me and my getling gun left in that hole-filled basement, I went down again.

And I made the mistake of autosaving just before nightfall again. 2 more attempts got me no closer to daytime.

I've yet to start a third playthrough. I'm trying to plan my house on paper beforehand this time, decide choke points, where the walls should be thicker, thinner, supported, where to place turrets, where to place lights, where to place myself, and all other things I can think of. But I can say without a doubt that this game is challenging.

And I'm only on Easy. There's still 4 higher difficulty levels.

Time to get crackin'.

music 8/10 - the music has a nice beat. especially during the night time. but the daytime music gets repeditive. 2-3 more tracks (i know there's 3-4 already) i think would help.
sound 10/10 - no complaints here. sound effects are precise and fit the game fine.
controls 7/10 - my main reason for this is jumping on single blocks is almost a nightmare. i often found myself either overshooting or my character taking so long to slow down that i would fall anyways. even after hitting the opposite way trying to keep from falling in the first place, i'd still fall.

14888733.review:
Rock eating dogs, biblical flooding, mass deforestation and a rewriting of the laws of physics "For every action there's a [i]ten times more powerful[/i] and opposite reaction" are just some of the wonders of this alien planet in Dig or Die.

Granted, it's only been pre-released for a week so much of this will undoubtedly change, these little... let's call them "quirks", make the game a bit more enjoyable than most of it's counterparts on the market.

At its current state, it's a short(ish) game. You essentially have 3 "levels" to get through. Each level is dependent on how far you upgrade a core piece of equipment (similar to a workbench in other games). And then there are the enemy levels which scale according to how far you explore; spend your first day going as far across the map as possible and you will die horribly come night.

That's one of the ways this game sets itself apart from some of the others like it. There is a serious and real threat to you. It takes a page out of 7 Days to Die's playbook and throws a real challenge at you when night comes. Every enemy you've encountered swarms around you or your base come nightfall. Gives you a real reason to set up some good defenses!

And these aren't mindless zombie drones we're talking about. Even though their options are limited, the enemies will use whatever means at their disposal to get to you... directly to you, even if it means tearing down 12 feet of concrete block.

Physics (to a degree) are another factor that make it different. I'd also compare this to 7 Days to Die in that each material has a different strength to support other blocks; build up too high or out too far and your walls will crumble over.

The third and last, that I personally really like, it water. Water can either be your best friend or worst enemy in this game. It flows, it settles, it gets absorbed, it pools... it drowns. Just the moisture from the dirt around you will be enough to flood a mineshaft if you don't plan it carefully. It's the same problem miners face in real life and so far, it's the only game that tries to replicate that.

This game took me completely off-guard. There was no hype around it. There were no ads on Steam for it. I didn't even see any previews for it anywhere on the Internet. And at $2.99 at the time of this review, how can you ever possibly go wrong??

Considering the one-man dev team has already updated it once after a week of release and is also an active member of the community, I can see this as being one of the games that may actually live up to its promises... a rarity for a lot of these titles!

Всем привет,если вы любите игры и вам не столь важно какая в ней графика, то хочу вам показать игру Dig or Die.Игра пока находится в раннем доступе и стоит всего 79 рублей.Игра начинается с момента крушения вашего космического корабля на неизвестной планете,а ваша цель выжить и построить ракету на которой вы улетите обратно.Внешне игра смахивает на очередной клон Terraria,и в начале вам так же нужны будут ресурсы и вам придётся копать.
Но так же вам придётся защищать себя, потому что ночью все монстры становятся агрессивные и нападают на вас,и это основное отличие от той же Terraria.На руках вы имеете лишь однозарядную винтовку да пушку которая собирает землю, деревья и все остальное.
С каждым разом монстры которые в начале не будут проблемой, в последующих волнах начнут разрушать ваши стены а так же пулеметные установки, и выживать придётся все сложнее, из убитых монстров выпадают разные предметы необходимые для строительства:деревянных стен, ящиков,лестниц, оружия и всего остального.
Необходимые ресурсы поначалу лежат на поверхности,но в последствии вам придётся спускать все ниже и ниже что бы искать то что вам нужно.Даже сейчас на раннем доступе игра завлекает и я без отрыва провел за ней около 2-3 часов, конечно многое еще будет сделано,но даже сейчас ее уже можно покупать, каких то багов замечено не было и все работает исправно.Так что советую всем кому нравятся такие игры.

14834503.review:
For my full review and other delicious content see [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QjB1Q-3Q3Fw]Glitch[/url]

Developed and published by Gaddy Games, a small indie studio that has dabbled in both the gaming and advergame markets, Dig or Die is a 2D, sandbox, strategy/adventure game currently in early access. You are a galactic salesperson, selling automated fabrication tools. On a recent trip your ship crash lands on a strange planet, full of hostile creatures. You must put your fabrication tools to good use, and gather the local resources to build the structures and weapons needed to explore this new world and survive the nights.

The game kicks off with the protagonist outside their crashed ship, and leaves the player too start exploring and gathering resources. The crashed ship's AI offers some timely advice about some of the native creatures and some ideas on how to survive. Using your Miniaturizor you can mine the basic items of the world, and by killing different enemies collect valuable resources to build defences, and upgrade weapons and your autobuilder.

I like this minimal instruction, as it is great fun getting in over your head in the early game. As you learn more about the world and find different resources, you will build stronger walls and the more powerful weapons and turrets needed to survive the onslaught of creatures each night. The night onslaughts are great fun, and have a tower defence feel.

As you progress the game starts to get a good rhythm , of exploring for new resources, then collecting all you can, before choosing a defensive location and digging in for the night. After surviving the night, I found it best to pack up my modest camp and move on in search of more resources. The resource gathering is well paced, and the requirement to upgrade your autobuilder repeatedly, to get to the best building materials, weapons and Miniaturizor is a great motivator to take risks when exploring.

Overall, I was quickly drawn in and addicted to the rhythm and exploration in Dig or Die. I found the pacing to be spot on, with each day cycle giving you just enough time to increase your overall resource pool, before fighting out the night. The upgrade system with the autobuilder, dangles the carrot perfectly and had me searching every inch of this world for weird and wonderful resources. I can't wait to see what other craftable items become available throughout this games development, and recommend this game to anyone who enjoys sandbox creation and exploration.

14829293.review:
I picked up 'Dig or Die' on its release date for 2 reasons.  The first reason was the introductory price of $3.00, and the second reason being that it looked like it would be fun.  

The game is simplistic in concept:  Explore, Acquire Resources, and prepare defenses for the onset of night.  

But that simplistic concept becomes much more challenging as you progress through the various crafting tiers, not to mention the oft-occuring flash flooding.  You begin to not only plan area defense, but also dig strategically placed water drainage ducts and dams.   

This game can feel relaxing and safe one moment and then quickly become a frantic struggle for survival the next.   For me it brings to mind that old school classic arcade game Dig Dug.  

Dig or Die itself has a cutesie, arcady graphic vibe, but it works just fine for me.   

The game, in its current state is very playable, very enjoyable and often fast paced.   

As mentioned in other reviews, I agree that it is difficult dealing with the multiple tiered crafting stations. It can be very confusing when it doesn't have to be.  This is most apparent when you are frantically trying to find that recipe you need as you are being swarmed by creatures at night and realize that the crafting station you need as halfway across the world.  - However - with that being said, it does add a strategic element by deciding whether to keep these stations close together, or spread them out between your various attempts at bases - or - just decide if it is worth building duplicate stations at the cost of precious resources.  ;)  

In my opinion, with the game as it is in its current state could easily pass muster for a finished game at $7.00 and probably sell decently.   But this game is in early access and therefore in constant development.  I believe that the developer proves that this is a workable game idea which can stand on its own merit and NOT be compared to a Terraria/Starbound clone.  I also believe that the developer knows what he is doing, has a solid roadmap for this game and a bright future is quite probably ensured.  

My recommendation is to get this game now at the lower price, rather than waiting, because you know by each of these reviews that this game is definitely heading in the right direction.  Get it at the bargain price now, or just wish you had in the future.

After spending a couple of hours playing in Dig or Dies sandbox, I'm impressed. OK yes it can be dull as hell at points, oddly enough this is at the early stages where all you have to look out for it a couple of dogs and a few flying wasp things. Yes it is an alpha so it is not exactly polished, but no crashes and everything so far has worked. Then just as I had thought it was licked things got tricky, do I try and save, or buy the much needed flashlight. How can I make a base which will kill any attackers but not turn in to the worlds biggest swimming pool. All these factors come into play, which makes for some frantic and engaging game play. 

If you like Mount and Blade, Kerbal Space Program and Banished this is a bargain with massive potential. If not then go back to CoD while the rest of us enjoy a challenge.

14804339.review:
DIG or DIE is a survival/mining open world sandbox game.
In it you must explore, dig, kill monsters, and of course, survive.
Like most in it's genre there is a day/night cycle.
You must be ready to face them or hide from them by night.
However in THIS game there is no hiding. (At least on night one.)
There will be plenty of monsters on your ass and it will be DARK!
Im talking about silhouette dark. So save at sunset.
If you don't have a save to load then you lose your world, simple as that.
Apparently if you don't bother or kill mobs they won't hurt you at night.
The problem is that they attack you during the day. Kinda making that a moot point.
Crafting is easy to use. There's a bit too much of the whole "I need this item I don't know how to find to progress. 
This game has awesome music. Calm for the midday labors and tense for the night fight or flight.
I wish there were more though. There are no sounds for digging and collecting which is sad. As far as I know there is only one biome. The plains/hills. The game looks good in my opinion. I like the way it looks.
The combat feels weird and sorta stiff. I can't explain it but it isn't a snoothe as say, Spelunkey or Minecraft.
As for the mobs themselves they are aggravating at best. You have a flying creature a dog and a mole creature. And they are tiny!
They are hard to aim at. My biggest gripe is that their shots break blocks. NO! One mob is fine but ALL of them is a bad idea.
The biggest problem im currently having is the god damn flooding! It's happening all the time. At random! Anytime it rains your home is flooded. It seems as if there are no other weather effects so they put in rain to fill times where future planned weather 
effects would be. The options are limited at best. https://twitter.com/SnowWither/status/574784805264474112
Overall a good title that should get better over time. It's early access and it will raise in price with updates. Get it.
Pros:                      score
Great music                 +1
Cool&dangerous night        +1
Good looking game           +1?
Good Crafting GUI           +2

Cons:
No digging/collecting snds -1
Weird combat               -1
Flooding                   -2
Mobs destroy blocks        -2


(? means you and keep or remove it based on your opinion.)
Score: -1 Score w/o ?: -2

It's 3$ or your regional equivalent. Get it now. Despite my score, get it when it is cheap. My complaints will most likely be fixed in the next update.  Thanks for reading.

14791384.review:
Malgré le fait que ce jeu soit en alpha, et qu'il reprenne le concept de Terraria, Starbound & co, ce jeu réussit à merveille à nous faire découvrir un genre nouveau (mix entre Terraria et Tower Defense très libre).

Les graphismes sont très charmeurs, simples mais très efficaces.

La bande-son est tout simplement géniale.

Il y a bien au moins 6h de jeu à faire en mode facile si l'on veut arriver au bout (rien que là le niveau est relevé).

Le principe de sauvegarde après chaque nuit (et interdit pendant la nuit) est bien posé.

L'obtention des ressources met à l'épreuve votre skill pour vous battre contre les monstres et pour respecter les lois de la physique qui sont vraiment intéressantes.

Et enfin, le prix : c'est tout simplement cadeau, plus tôt vous l'acheterez, moins cher il sera.

Je vous le recommande chaudement. Meilleur early access jamais testé pour ma part.

En introduction, une citation tellement vraie du développeur : [quote=Gaddy]Quand une poignée de jeux se ressemblent, c'est du plagiat. Quand il y en a des milliers, c'est un genre.[/quote]

[i]Le jeu étant en accès anticipé, je ferai bref et cet avis sera modifié pour être complet plus tard, lors de prochaines mises à jour.[/i]
Si je devais résumer le jeu : Sandbox, impliquant de l'exploration et de la récolte, en surface et dans les cavernes. Mais surtout : Des nuits mortelles.

En bref, [b]la musique est très agréable[/b], les contrôles répondent bien et ce jeu semble prometteur. Je salue l'initiative d'un prix plus bas au début.

14750084.review:
1-English version.
2-Versión en español.

1--English version:

I still need to try this more, but for now this game is good and very well polished. 

In my opinion, needs some balance with a few things (rain, filtrations, water floods) and an option to customize keys. Those 2 asap before adding more content.

Also, i miss a lot the possibility to use the dirt, rocks, etc you mine. All raw material, once obtained, cannot be used until converted to something. As this is a game where mobs are constantly shooting and breaking all materials and since you need also to dig and mine, this means that your base floor, favourite cave for spelunking and finally all your world, will be like a emmental cheese.

Adding the huge quantity of rain and the fact that all that you build and all those holes i was talking about flood in a mere seconds, this means you will end diving across an emmental flooded world.

Despite that, which i think is just a question of balancing water and filtrations, the game is very solid already. The movement is fluid and very well done and you can craft a good bunch of things: building materials, machinery, guns, armor, turrets for defense...

I'm eager to see more, so i will update this first opinion after testing a bit more.

Oh, i forgot, and it's so cheap that will be almost a crime not to support the developer.

2---Versión español:

Todavía necesito probarlo más, pero por ahora el juego está muy chulo y muy bien afinado.

En mi opinión, necesita equilibrar algunas cosillas (la lluvia, filtraciones de agua, inundaciones...) y una opción para personalizar los botones. Ambas cosas lo más rápido posible, incluso antes de meter más contenido.

También echo en falta la posibilidad de utilizar los bloques de tierra, rocas, etc que minas. No se puede usar ningún material en crudo si no se transforma primero en otra cosa. Como en este juego los enemigos están continuamente disparando y cargándose todo y como, obviamente, necesitas minar y cavar, esto significa que el suelo de tu base, tu cueva favorita para explorar y, en definitiva, todo tu mundo acabará pareciendo un queso emmental.

Si añadimos la enorme cantidad de lluvia que cae y el hecho de que todo lo que edifiques y todos esos agujeros que mencionaba se inundan en apenas unos segundos, ello supone que acabarás buceando a través de un mundo como un queso emmental inundado.

A pesar de ello, que creo que es tan sólo una cuestión de equilibrar el tema del agua y las filtraciones, el juego es muy sólido en el estado actual. El movimiento es fluído y muy bien ejecutado y puedes fabricar una buena cantidad de cosas: bloques para construcción, maquinaria, armas, armaduras, torretas para la defensa...

Estoy ansioso por ver más, así que actualizaré esta primera opinión en cuanto lo pruebe un poco más.

Ah!, se me olvidaba, encima el juego es tan barato que sería casi un delito no apoyar al desarrollador.

14749585.review:
It's like Terraria with more guns - IGN

[u][url=http://youtu.be/h767IOiK8nY]Don't want to read all of this text? Check out the video review![/url][/u]

Pros:
_Very Terraria-esque: The addictiveness of  digging and crafting is here in full effect. Although...
_It's more action-y than Terraria: There's no slow start here, everthing is faster. You get to explore and do combat almost right away. You also dig and gather stuff a lot faster too.
_Difficult: Surviving the first night might be way harder than you think. As enemies will relentlessly chase you down and ruin your entire life.
_Exciting night time: During the night, the game plays like a tower defense, where the stuff that you painstakingly build in the daytime come under attack with waves of enemies. Set up those turrets!
_Nice, clean presentation: Very quiet soundtrack. Simple in terms of graphics as well. But everything is easy to see and interpret, and never gets in the way of the gameplay.
_It's 3 bucks: The game $3 right now. The creator mentioned that he doesn't want to sell this game at full price yet, until it's more fully featured.

Cons:
_Still in Early Access: It's not fully featured. No crashes or game breaking bugs here, fortunately. But the game is still in the process of getting more content as we speak.
_Could be too difficult at times: Or maybe I just suck. I don't really know.

Overall, you would like this game if:
_You like Terraria and looking for something different.
_You DIDN'T like Terraria and looking for something different.
_You like difficult games.
_You like Tower Defense.
_You like to kill wasps with laser guns. Seriously, fuck those guys.

Is it worth the (currently) $3 price? Absolutely, it's very easy to get into this game and lose track of time. A must buy for this price point in my opinion.

14749528.review:
Alright, so I bought this game because I had spare money and being a brand new game it caught my eye.
Dig Or Die is a fun game but with the typical issues of an Early Access game.
Ups:
+ The controls feel nice
+ Artstyle is cool
Downs:
- The difficulty gap between zones is devastating.
- The nights are impossible, and i mean impossible once you provoque what I'd consider "Level 2" monsters.
- Water system gets extremely annoying.

So for now I'd say please nerf those damn blue wasps, nerf the spawn rate of monsters during the night, nerf the "provoque" system, and please slow down the rate at which water accumulates with rain its ridiculous hahahaha.

The game is nice and it's definitely worth the price, it will go up, so buy it now and support the developers, this game is a solid gem!

14742503.review:
My First Play on Launch Day Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_pFIZzx2duU

While so many people are focused on bigger, more expensive games, Indie devs continue to pump out games like this little gem that deliver BIG TIME!

This game is no exception.

Combine Terraria with a tower defense game and hordes of enemies out for your blood during the night.. and you have a good idea of what "Dig or Die" is all about.  But this is even better.  It moves faster, better, and with more action then I've seen in Terraria, especially at night!

..You better figure out a game plan during the day and be able to protect yourself either with firepower or solid walls, because these mobs at night will stop at nothing to rip you to shreds!  They are smart and will tear down the weakest link between you and them if you've dug yourself or built a shelter.

Digging.  Crafting.  Resource gathering.  Exploring.  Fighting.  Building.  

It's all here, and this game is fun as hell already.  I can't wait to see where this game goes!

Psst.. Take my advice and buy this game NOW before the price goes UP!  (It definitely will!)

14741865.review:
A lot of fun right now. Very short learning curve...if you've played Terraria or any of the others in this genre, you can pick it up right away. The only thing that threw me at first was that you have to create multiple work stations that appear identical, but learning is learning. :)

The water physics in this are spot on. Very smooth. The nights are short, frantic and fun, and you breathe a sigh of relief when daylight comes! I only played on easy just to get to grips with the game, but I can see this being a massive time sink for me.

The stage the game is at right now is very playable, and if you like Terraria mashed up with a little bit of 7 Days to Die, you can't go wrong here for this price.

14741722.review: Honestly it's a really fun game that's cheap at the moment and quite easy to pick up. Graphics are fine, sounds are nice, and a lot of attention the spelunking has been put in. At the moment the only thing I can think of asking for is some sort of rope be added that I can attach to walls that I can climb up and down on for spelunking instead of having to waste blocks or build giant stairs, but other than that the game is way worth the price.
